review_body: Cannot thank Danny in particular at the Aqua Pacific Hotel, wow, what a fantastic, enjoyable trip and Danny's friendly, bubbly service was absolutely an incredible bonus to our family, within such great walking distance to the beach and city life, I would highly recommend staying here for your next trip to hawaii, very family friendly, we will definitely be back.Jess Bryant

If you are looking for accommodation slightly off the beach that iis comfortable, consider this propeprty. Good rooms and facilities. However, the best part is the people who work there. Efficient, friendly and always ready to help.

My wife and I stayed at the Pacific Monarch from February 1st to 14th, 2020. We loved it here. Yes, it's not the Hyatt or the Four Seasons, but it has everything you are looking for at a reasonable price. My wife and I are pretty selective about where we stay. This place worked. We had a suite on the 29th floor and would recommend to anyone that they try and get a higher room and an '02' room (any room that ends in 02). Separate bedroom, small living room, full kitchen with stove/oven, M/W double sink. and adequate bathroom. The best of this room however was the Lanai, the deck, the balcony. We could access it from either our bedroom sliding doors or through the living room. It's huge - we had seven people on it. it has a GREAT view of the ocean. It gets morning sun and partial afternoon sun. You can move around to get sun or shade throughout the day. We spent a LOT of time on the lanai. It's also private, you cant hear or see any of your neighbors in the building. We loved this lanai a lot and you will too. Other amenities in the building? Beach towels, nice pool on the roof. Location is about 200 meters from the beach. Staff is excellent. Place was clean and cleaned well daily. We had very good service from Danny and Rose. We'd recommend Pacific Monarch and would stay here again next time we're in Waikiki.

Excellent location and extremely friendly and accommodating staff. It's a very basic hotel but it is clean and convenient. Pool area isn't anything special but we spent most of the time on the beach. The closest grocery store is about a 30 minute walk away. You need to take the bus or rent an uber. Hotel is on the bus route.

We have stayed here many times . Staff are very friendly always willing to help. Although the decor is dated you can’t beat the location. Having stayed in a few different rooms I would always pay extra for the one bedroom ocean view room

There was a musty smell upon entry to the elevator & room. The electric portable stove burner was rusty. The coffee pot was a13 cup capacity, only 2 packets provided enough for 8 cups. Otherwise stay was good.

The Aqua pacific monarch was great value for money. The hotels location was fantastic and only a short stroll to the beach. The provision of beach towels and beach chairs were a great help. The room was a good size with a partial sea view which was fantastic, the room was very well equipped with everything thing you could need for a week in Waikiki. The only downside was the room faced the diamond head crater and was in full sun all day and the air conditioning struggled to keep the room cool and was quite noisy. The stall were very helpful and accomodating. Overall a great stay and wouldn’t hesitate in booking to stay there again.

Pacific Monarch has one really good feature - location. It is two short blocks from the beach. Other than that it is just a plain-jane hotel, which makes the "resort fee" a joke. There is a cafe and a restaurant there but neither have a view of the ocean or beach. We didn't eat at either one. The rooms were clean but the last renovation was done somewhat sloppily. The furniture was pretty beaten up. Scratches and water spots were common in all three rooms. Some rooms have a nice view of the ocean and I think all rooms have some ocean view.

The hotel had an amazing location, 5mins to the beach and we got a partial ocean view / mountain view room. The room was super clean and comfortable with ample space. The kitchen facilities was enough for a short stay and coffee was replenished daily. The only down side was the loud construction outside and the super loud air conditioner, but luckily there was a fan in the room. The hospitality was great as management put on a cocktail party each week so you can mingle with other guests. The staff were super friendly and helpful. You can also rent DVDs for free which was a huge plus. I thought the bed was comfortable but my partner disagrees. The rooftop pool deck was also a plus with amazing ocean front views and mountain views on the other side.

Great location close to the beach and main shopping district Older style hotel with rooftop pool and viewing area Rented a privately owned apartment on 31st floor clean and quite modern decor aircon was poor and noisy... cooktop was annoying and kept flashing errors and after reading reviews seems the property managers Ali’s beach rentals are still putting the wrong cookware in the apartment... and everyone is still complaining...Very slim balcony is something to think about if you like sitting outside... very narrow and intimidating with only 2 old plastic chairs to use if you’re game...

Stayed at the Pacific Monarch on our latest trip to Hawaii and were very pleased during our stay. Last time in Hawaii Four years ago, we opted for a more expensive hotel but in hindsight we realised that it was money wasted considering how much time we spent in our room. The Pacific Monarch is a middle-of-the-road place to stay; not the flashiest in Waikiki, nor is it a budget motel. We found the rooms comfortable and clean and, depending on what floor and options you pay for, had a good view of our surroundings including the beach. The service from the friendly staff was fantastic and we were made to feel very welcome during our stay. The rooftop pool and spa was nice in case you wanted a quick dip instead of heading for the beach, and the panoramic views from the roof was a bonus too. Nothing is perfect and our only gripe was the noisy window mounted Air Conditioner next to the bed, but other than that, I could not fault the place. We will most likely stay here again on our next trip!

There’s a water cooler with ice in reception. It was needing refilled. My husband asked if it was getting refilled because water in room was warm no matter how long we ran it from the tap. He wanted to fill our water bottle. She suggested going to local supermarket to buy cold water!! I think customer care needs looked at.

This place needs to be demolished the aircon that really doesn't work well is very old..the washroom was disgusting I didn't even want to shower but did with my sandals on..take a look at the pictures it will tell the story.. save your money go to a different hotel...plus they charge 25 dollars a day resort..I would not give this hotel a star rating..we stayed out most of the day and night..spend about 8 hours to sleep..the door you could see outside from the inside no dead lock only a latch..

We enjoyed our stay. The unit had a stove and mini fridge. It had a rice cooker, toaster, coffee maker, cutting board, a plug in water pitcher, knives, utensils....(fully equipped).It was like a large studio apartment. We also had a great view on floor 32 (penthouse) of both the mountains and the ocean.The soaps, conditioners, etc were a Hawaiian Tropic which was so fitting. The lobby offers water. The hotel also offers a free local shuttle that goes all the way to Ala Moana shopping center. There is a shuttle to the airport for $14. The hotel offers free use of beach towels and beach chairs (you receive a card per person that must be returned upon checkout-lost cards cost $30). The pool, hot-tub, and sunbathing area are on the roof. The floor below has a community area that has a large fridge and sink. This would be a great place to congregate for a large group on vacation together. This area also has a Redbox.The laundry facility was where the parking garage was. I believe the cost for wash was $2.75 and the Dryer $3.00.The location was two blocks from the beach that is by the Duke statue.Easy access to bus.Nice fish tank by elevators.They also gave us coupon book.There are ABC stores on the two blocks toward the beach.Staff was friendly and helpful.Doors locked accessible via keycard after a certain time of day for security purposes.Unfortunately, we were not there on a Wednesday when they have a cocktail hour that has refreshments and finger foods. Can’t wait to go back.

My wife and I recently stayed for 8 x nights at the Aqua Pacific Monarch. We are both retirees and so the location for us was perfect. 2 x minutes walk from Waikiki beach. Close walking distance to shops and restaurants.Good feature is the free use of beach towels and also beach chairs. Lovely roof top pool with great panoramic views.Great cleaning room service and friendly helpful desk staff.Only slight criticism is that the decor is a little "tired", but that does not detract to the overall good experience of staying here.Would recommend to potential travelers.

I checked alot of reviews and was particular about where we were going to stay, Pacific Monarch had great review and it didnt disapoint. We were on 31st floor with great views of ocean and city. layout was great, bed in one end and dining in middle with living one on other end and a galley kitchen. I was wanting a balcony to sit on but our patio doors opened to a small skinny balcony with was even better as the doors opened about 10 feet bringing the outside in! Staff were great! Beach 4 minute walk, and the hotel has beach chairs, towels and mats, perfect! Location was the best (I am in the hotel busienss so I checked out other properties and can honestly say this was best for value - clean, location, excellent staff, I would stay again!

We were on 22nd floor with great views all over Waikiki from our two balconys. Separate bedroom was nice and comfortable with lots of storage for clothes in drawers and a safe. There was a fully equipped kitchen with oven and microwave and a dining table and comfy couch as well as good outdoor furniture on the balcony. This was great for drying our wet swimming gear and towels. Not too far to walk to the beach and loved the little restaurants close by which were inexpensive.

The location is excellent - 4 minutes walk to Waikiki beach and surronded by numerous ABCS Stores, overall, not noisy but close enough to everything. Fabulous room view, we like the balcony a lot as we enjoy the wind from the ocean, but there is always a BBQ smoky smell coming from some restaurant nearby. Also the hotel provides beach towels which is quite good.It's a pity, however, that the hotel doesn't keep luggages overnight. So for those customers who will re-check in after travelling to other Hawaiian islands, they have to take all the luggages with them...

Love this place and staff so much (especially Danny) that we have returned 9 times in 9 years. Great location. All the staff are sensational from front desk staff, maintenance and cleaning staff. Treat you like family. Wouldn’t stay anywhere else. Just a few blocks from Waikiki beach and central to everything. Rooms are good and the kitchen facilities save you heaps on eating out all the time. Really recommend!

Spent a week here.Found the room was basic and an adequate place to leave our gear, the second bed was exceptionally squeaky, kept everyone awake. Teenager took cushions off the sofa and slept on the floor. Took housekeeping 3 days to clean the room, had to call reception.Really good location for us

This place is fantastic everything you need at a reasonable price and close to everything from buses, shops, restaurants and beach. The service and help from amazing staff at the desk is outstanding especially from Cherly and Keiko. They always greet you with a smile and go over and beyond to help in whatever you need. Definitely recommend

This hotel met our budget requirements when staying on Honolulu for 10 days. We spent most of our time touring around the sites of Hawaii and a basic clean room was all we needed. It is only a block or two back from the beach and walking around was a breeze. If you're coming in on a red-eye flight from Australia, pay for the extra night's accommodation, give them a call and let them know you'll be checking in mid morning when your flight lands. They had baggage check in but no real lounge area where you could spend a few hours waiting for check in time. There is parking on site at about $30USD per day. I would stay here again when visiting Honolulu. It is about a 15 min taxi ride from the airport and about $50USD in fare. You can walk to Alamo for rental cars in Honolulu easily if you wanted to get a car locally instead of jumping behind the wheel at the airport after a red-eye flight.

Excellent value for money if you’re travelling with younger school age kids. Friendly, helpful staff. Awesome location, so central, we got away without hiring a car for our entire two week stay. The kitchen has a large refrigerator and oven and a good supply of cooking utensils. Very clean. We will definitely stay again next trip!!! Thank you for having us.PS there is currently a lot of road work outside the hotel. It didn’t bother us at all because we were out all day, but if you’re a complainer, stay elsewhere.

This hotel is in a great location, easily walkable to Waikiki Beach. The condo was quite small for 4 people but fine for 2. It was well equipped with beautiful views and very little noise. We enjoyed the rooftop pool as well. The lobby is minimal but the staff was quite helpful.

We spent a week here looking out onto Waikiki beach a truely spectacular view.Our room was clean and comfortable. It had all the amenities we required including air conditioning. We had access to a free shuttle to a major shopping centre and it was only a two minute walk to the beach.Alamo car rentals was a two minute walk and we were right in the hub of shopping bars and restaurants.We loved our stay and recommend this as a good Place to hangout in Waikiki.

we stayed here and the location is very convenient, short walk to the beach and all the restaurants. The room was comfortable and cleaned every day. We had a room with a kitchenette which we found handy for breakfast.

Arriving in the foyer you would think that this is a 1/2 star hotel. It's very old and basic. The outside of the building was not much better. We had to wait upstairs in the guest deck on the 30 floor. It was not much better either The views from the pool deck cheered us up a bit but the pool was tiny and dated. When we got into the room we were very surprised. It was brilliant! Modern, clean and spacious. It has tremendous views and included a small kitchenette. The bath and balcony were tiny but the set-up of the room suited our needs. It just goes to show you cannot judge a book by it'd cover.

Great location,room contained everything needed, was clean and also quiet,friendly staff. Second time stay would not hesitate to go again.a lovely way to holiday.handy little Japanese cafe with a good variety of food,two blocks from beach and endless shopping along the beachfront.

We stayed in apartment 2501 which is privately owned and was near perfect. The location was good with a two block walk to the beach. It was clean and well equipped. Shops and restaurants were within a few minutes walk and we had a good view of diamond head and a limited view of the beach.Any negatives? It was quite noisy being in the centre of town and near a major road. There were lots of sirens and traffic noise and, what seemed to be, kids throwing fireworks. The air conditioning was quite noisy so we were reluctant to run it at night but we couldn't leave the windows open due to traffic noise. So quite hot! We managed with fans. Would I stay there again? Definitely.

I was here for 4 nights and it was "OK" nothing special or amazing. The room was average. I was more pissed about a "resort fee" which means beach towels and a chair which was old and half broken. The wifi sucked. The pool was really gross it looked like it wasn't cleaned in months. Air conditioner in the room couldn't keep the room cold.

Nice appartments, close to everything, pretty clean, However just becareful as room to room does differ!We stayed on 12th floor and my daughters directly opposit us.....our room was nice and cool, if we left fans and AC on but my daughters room was always SO hot!!! Staff were kind if they realised Something was not right and were helpful in many ways on several occasions. Location is ideal and beautiful rooftop fireworks display however you have to enquire about everything.....staff will not advise of anything UNLESS YOU ASK FIRST!!Pool was small not like picture very deceiving but big enough for the amount of time we used it!No water provided in rooms only in lobby and until 8pm only, However i asked Would i stay there again? Yes if price was reasonable!

We have just returned from our 3rd stay at Pacific Monarch and we look forward to the next time we can visit this property. We booked a Partial Ocean View room. These rooms have a queen bed, super comfortable, a lounge that can convert to a double bed if required. There is a kitchenette with everything you would want. A table and four chairs fit nicely into this room. Our room was in the 18th floor and we saw a little ocean from our Lani. You can’t sit on the Lani but the sliding doors open along the length of the room giving it an airy feel. We used the ceiling fan rather than the air con that blew a bit of dust when we turned it on. The fan and open doors were adequate even with the record temperature that Waikiki experienced at that time. The rooms are serviced daily by very friendly staff. Everyone we came in contact with make you feel not only welcome but like returning family. The location of the hotel is perfect, not even a 5 min walk from Waikiki Beach. An ABc store is about 2 mins away for all items you would need. Sadly the local Foodland store has recently closed so we made the trek to Walmart for grocery items for the two weeks, a little cheaper than the abc store. The Resort Fee entitles you to beach chairs, beach towels, newspapers daily and a weekly reception on the roof top area with other holiday makers and residents. This reception is friendly, cocktails beautiful and savory and sweet treats to eat. Mahalo Aqua Pacific Monarch for yet another wonderful stay. We will return.

This is our second time visiting Honolulu and we thought it was best to try another hotel near Wakiki beach. We ended up booking this establishment which was not cheap by any means for a WHOLE 7 nights. We arrived on an early flight from Australia at 6am. Being 7 months pregnant, i had emailed them ahead and requested an early check in and their reservations team said it should be fine. When we arrived the receptionist said there was nothing available but they would check us in after an hour. Little did we know that this was when our nightmare started at this place. After waiting and waiting and with no concern and communication to us at all they checked us in at 1pm. No hospitality there at all or any apology. They just didn't care at all. I even begged and pleaded with them as my feet had ballooned to double the size because of the pregnancy and the long flight but they just couldn't be bothered with us at all.Secondly, the online pictures do not look like anything in real life. Just a run down hotel with very dated and yucky toilets. The TV's in the rooms are from the 70's and with the noisiest ceiling fan you can imagine. Being the middle of summer i just had to use the fan because it was stinking hot but i couldn't sleep all night because of the noise. Imagine coming back from a vaction more tired than when you left because of lack of sleep.Thirdly, the reception is always under staffed and they are always overwhelmed so usually customer service is compromised because they are just trying to get through the day.It was always a very unpleasant wait at reception if you needed anything because they would always be busy.Lastly, the pool area is disgusting and dated. It looks nothing like the pictures online. What a waste. We had to go to a neighbour hotel and pay to swim there because this pool was disgusting with old dated furniture. "Yuck".Honestly this is the worst $3000 i have spent in my entire life. The whole holiday just ended up being a dump because the accommodation was very very bad. Please spend your money elsewhere and DO NOT stay here.

This hotel is great value. It's a 1-2 minute stroll to the beach. The room was very clean with nice but not luxurious fittings. We were at the back of the building but had great views of the Honolulu skyline, the hills behinds, and from the balcony we could see a big piece of ocean.The full kitchen was really helpful for cooking for family with food allergies. The Food Pantry supermarket is only a couple of blocks away. It's also very convenient to the Alamo Car Hire lot which is in the same city block.Bedding was really comfortable, and we appreciated the daily servicing. Staff were very helpful and courteous. The airconditioning was an 'in wall' evaporative air conditioner in the sitting room. It struggled to cool the whole apartment, but the ceiling fan in the bedroom was great. We opened the windows and balcony doors when we were in the apartment, letting in beautiful breezes.

hotel lobby is nice and beautiful, great location 1-2 blocks from Waikiki beach. close to the mall and many restaurants. also close to grocery store. Condo has kitchen, we ate breakfast in the room. save us lot of money.

I am extremely happy with my stay at this hotel. It is only one block from the beach. The ocean views are real ocean views. The one-bedroom apartment we were in had a full kitchen, all modern and very clean. Painted newly. It has a Huge Lanai overlooking the sea. Just gorgeous views. The hotel room service is the best To None.! They are extremely responsive, within five minutes, fixing any problem or bringing extra supplies to the room. The staff are outstanding and extremely friendly and helpful. I will definitely be back.

This hotel is very close to the beach. In case you are travelling with family or you want access to your kind of food, go for the rooms with the kitchenette. Also, opt for the rooms with the ocean view. The bathrooms are small, a bit untidy and have old fittings. There is no restaurant which belongs exclusively to the hotel. However, all eatries are very close by. The shuttle service to the shopping mall is a bit erratic. The staff at the front desk are helpful. I think this hotel is actually value for money.

This place is great, we stayed for 9 days in room 2201 and the view and the staff was great, room was perfect for us , we had a couch , dining room table and a comfy bed, the kitchen had a 2 burner stove, fridge, and all the dishes you need to cook anything you want, they do have a shuttle to take you to Ala-Moana which is a huge mall and I suggest you get a map for it cause you can get lost in it, it’s that big. Or you can get on a bus and purchase a day pass for $5:50 a person on (the bus) and it will take you anywhere you want to go, well worth it. There is a place called Hawaii tour and travel we used to book our tours that is a block down the street for this hotel they are very reasonably priced and pick up location for the tours are just a block down the street, so this was very convenient. We look forward to coming back in a couple years and will definitely stay here again. Thank you so much Aqua Pacific Monarch. These are just a couple photos from our lanai balcony. Beautiful view!

went with family. planned a year in advance. would recommend to anyone. people were really nice and enjoyable. a couple of blocks from the beach. ABC stores on almost every corner with anything you need.

This hotel needs a lot of upgrades it’s old and dated, the carpets need to be replaced and a good paint job. There is no hotel owned parking you pay extra and it’s next doorThe pool is small but adequate but there should be some umbrellas for shade.There is only one very small ac unit in the rooms it’s not enough and our room never got below 80 degrees even with the ac running 100% all the time. Who builds a hotel in Hawaii with out central air conditioning????On the plus side the location is very good and the staff is great very helpful and informative.The rooms are small but efficient and for three of us it was ok The view of the ocean was very good ask for an upper room on ocean side Over all we recommend but hopefully you enjoy hot rooms

This hotel is in need of much modernisation throughout. The rooms are old fashioned, dated and tired even by taking into account the traditional Hawaiian theme that many of the hotels in Waikiki seem to aspire to. That being said, my husband and I thoroughly loved our stay here. The room was well equipped with kitchen area and balcony which was great as we could sit on the couch with the patio doors wide open enjoying the tropical breeze and the heat. The pool area was very small but great for sunbathing. The hotel staff were mainly friendly and attentive to our requirements. There are self laundry facilities on site which is handy however the parking garage isn’t owned by the hotel and is expensive and not secure if you chose to have a car while there. The location of the hotel is excellent as it is within about 2 minutes walking distance to the beach and the main shopping street of Kalākaua Avenue. If you’re looking for plush this isn’t the hotel for you but if you’re looking for a reasonable priced clean base to stay then I’d recommend.

The Pacific Monarch is in a busy and safe area of Waikiki. It is close to Waikiki Beach, International Market Place, Pharmacies,Food stores,and restaurants. It is on the regular bus route which can take you just about anywhere on the Island of Oahu. The pool on the top of the hotel is quite large with a great view. There are studios where you can prepare some of your own meals if you are watching your pocketbook.I think the hotel is a little tired but clean and great employees who make your day. There was nowhere for me to put the date of Nov 2017 when I stayed there so had to click on Nov 2018.I definitely would stay there again.

We stayed fro 8 nights in an appartment with ocean view on the 31st fooor. It had a living room with a sofa bed, a fully equipped kitchen, a separate bedroom, a bathroom and a very spacious balcony. The bed was very comfortable, and also the sofabed was good according to our kids (ages 21 and 24). There was a rather old table with four comfortable chairs on the balcony, so enjoyed our breakfast there, which we brought from a nearby supermarket. The view from our balcony was breathtaking: e.g., the sunset, the fading ligh (blue hour), the lights of the hotels at Waikiki Beach, Waikiki at night, the sunrise over the mountains, a rainbow. The noise from traffic etc. was much less than we had expected, so we could leave the doors to the balcony open. We did noit use the air condition. On top level there is a pool with lounge chairs and a great view. We only used the pool once in the evening, as we preferred the beaches. The beach was close by, as well as many restaurants, bars, shopping centers, shpos and supermarkets. A shuttle to the Ala Moana Shopping Center is for free and parts right across the street. Hula shows are for free at the beach and at the International Shopping Center nearby. Many public busses, which take you to almost every place on Oahu, depart just across the street form the hotel.

The reception and cleaning staff were wonderful. The room dated but immaculate. The cleaners do a absolutely brilliant job. There are food trucks a short 5 mins walk away and the meals we got there were delicious. Only 1 lift was working for 3 days then the second lift was fixed and made things a heck of a lot better, but still had to wait in boiling hot corridors for lifts to come. Very old aircon in lounge and only a fan in the bedroom. Need to have another fan for the lounge, if they can't afford to put in decent airconditioning.

I have to say it’s very clean & the lady on the front desk is awesome she was so nice. As well as the other team that works there always having a laugh with us. The bed wasn’t bad but the pillows were lumpy as they come I’ve never seen a pillows like that. If you are staying for a while buy a pillow from Ross. The window rattler aircon is right next to the bed, so it is really noisy for a light sleeper & blows air straight on you. But if you angle the bedside table right it won’t blow on you  The ocean view is really nice I didn’t expect to get such a nice view being two blocks back from the beach. Woke up one morning to the power being off but when we returned it was back on. No big issue for us. They have three lifts and two of them broke down for the last three days. There were lines all the way through reception, trying to get to the roof for the pool took an hour and forget it if you were trying to get back to your room after 9pm. The frustrating bit was communication on the lifts being down unless you went down to reception and saw the signs. I understand things break but a call or even a sign on every floor would have helped. The roof top pool and spa was pretty cool to watch the Friday fireworks from heads up the spa button is around the corner . Parking isnt owner by the hotel. its $30 a day but it’s literally connected to the hotel and super easy to access. Make sure you put extra tape on the ticket or you will get towed. The shower took me a while to work out haha you have to pull the tap out don’t freak out you won’t break it but the first few times it was a little scary. Water pressure was so good it took my tan off & the temp no issues at all. If all you are looking for is a place to sleep, shower & being close to everything for that price you really can’t fault it at all! Thank you for having us! Hope the lifts are fixed

This was our first time at this hotel....and probably our last. The staff were really lovely and helpful. I felt extremely sorry for them as they were abused by some people about only one of three lifts operating. Yes the wait to get in and out of the building was long and took up to 30 minutes at times. It was very frustrating but it was quite obviously out of the staffs control. Plus it was the weekend which made matters worse. Apart from this very big issue, I have to say our room was lovely and the view was breathtaking! The entire hotel may need money spent on it to spruce it up a bit, but our room was very clean and comfortable. And when I asked for a refund of the $25 a day resort fee, the staff member was more than happy to provide the refund and acknowledged that it was impossible to enjoy the pool etc if half our time was spent waiting for the elevator. If the elevator wasn’t such an issue I would have given it one extra star, as the location is perfect.

This was my third visit to Pacific Monarch and was so disappointed in the decline of services and the premises in general. We were on the 19th floor and as only 1 of the 3 lifts were operating it was a nightmare every time we went out or returned. Overcrowded and the remaining lift shuddered and creaked so everyone was nervous until the doors opened. Luckily we were able to use the stairs but the elderly and disabled were not considered. The place looked worn out the only positive was the staff who unfortunately has to deal with difficulties without any support from management who did not bother to deal with a very precarious situation. They should be sacked!

This is in the perfect location! 1 block from beach, the food trucks, tour buses pick up at end of block! The staff was wonderful! The whole wall was glass with a sliding glass door onto the deck with a view of the ocean! Near bike, moped and car rentals. Has a pool on the roof, a work out room and a room to hold larger gatherings and great laundry facilities. Would definitely recommend staying here!

Staying at the Pacific Monarch, I have a Studio Suite with a partial ocean view on the 23rd floor. The bed was extremely comfortable, the room large with a full kitchen. I was able to enjoy Breakfast in my room!! Staff is very helpful & friendly! Location is one block from the beach and surrounded by all conveniences with the Bus stopping out front.The only negative on the room is the lack of a balcony. Only the 1 bedrooms offer a balcony!!

We've spend 10 days in Waikiki in the Aqua Pacific Monarch and our idea was to live in a small but centrally located apartment with a small kitchen so we could prepare our own meals if we wanted to. Also we are both not typically huge fans of hotel breakfast as it typically is over-priced compared to what you really get. With that in mind we picked the Monarch and were not at all disappointed. The apartment was big enough to not feel squeezed into a lil box so once you got out of the bed the day started at the breakfast table (coffee machine had been activated before :-)) with a large cup of self-made Kona coffee and a simple white toast with cheese. (Be aware that the ABC Stores in the neighborhood massively overcharge you on the basic stuff even - so it's worth to get to one of the supermarkets near by and get your stuff there)The Monarch is in walking distance to all the important spots in Waikiki. Even Diamond Head would be in reach if you don't mind starting your hike through the suburbs of Waikiki... All rooms were comfortably equipped, daily fresh towels if you wanted them, beach towels, TV (which we only used once). Personell were all super friendly.

We stayed in a studio with kitchenette and partial Ocean Views and found it very spacious. It was handy with the kitchenette as it had a hotplate, microwave, reasonable size bar fridge, we had a couple of convenience meals, from the ABC shop nearby, at night in our room and sat and looked at the night lights while we ate, the microwave was handy for that. We also made our own breakfasts most of the time to save money a bit, again the kitchenette was handy for that. We were on the 22nd floor as was another travelling party with us, but they had a one bedroom unit (they had a child with them) and had full ocean view, but as it was at the end of the building it got hot in the afternoon. Ours had a nice breeze and saw just as much of the ocean. Another party of ours was on the 7th floor with supposed same as us, but they had no view whatsoever, except into the dilapidated noisy units next door. The city itself was very noisy with the sounds echoing around the buildings, but if you close the windows and put on the airconditioning, it is noisy, and blasts cold air straight onto the bed where you are sleeping. As it was tail end of winter the nights were pleasant, thus aircon wasn't required.

I recently stayed at the Aqua Pacific Monarch and was very happy with our room and accomodation.Honolulu accomodation from my research is quite expensive and this location proved to be good value for money. The staff are very friendly and helpful.We booked a One bedroom Full ocean view room and were situated on the 22nd Floor.The room decor is dated but that is very common with Accomodation in Honolulu from what I can tell. It was very clean which is what counts. If you are having a family vacation to Honolulu then I would recommend this hotel definitely.

VERY UNCLEAN HOTEL there were cockroaches in our room and they also sprayed against cockroaches while we were there, which should have helped but didn’t and instead created major fumes in our room that left us light headed. When we complained they allowed us to move rooms, but the new room had pee all over the toilet seat and a hole in the wall to the balcony with bird poop in it. We came here with a young baby and are looking for other hotels for the rest of our stay due to the major lack of hygiene in the hotel. I would not recommend this as a safe environment for young children.

Stayed here recently. The hotel is nice. The view from our room was great. Location was amazing and only 2 blocks from Waikiki Beach. Lots of restaurants, bars, and shopping all nearby. My only gripe is the parking garage. which is serviced as a separate entity from the hotel. I believe it is monitored by ABM parking. Stayed a whole week at this hotel and prepaid for a weeks parking pass. Everyday we entered the garage I would show my parking pass to the attendant and also walked down and spoke to the attendant and provided all of our vehicle info. Make, Model, Color, License plate, my name. etc....Even though we saw the same two workers all week. On the last day they towed my car. When I drove in showed the garage attendant my parking pass, but accidentally placed my pass in my center console instead of the dash. Car got towed. Even though the guy knew which car we drove had all our car info. Still got towed. Cost $242.50 to get it out and even the tow yard was just a sketchy business. Only took cash and that it. This experience made it very off putting for me. I wouldn't be surprised if the two companies gave kick backs to to people who call in the tows. Even though I liked the hotel. This parking experience has made me bitter about ever staying at this location.

We enjoyed our 4 night stay at Aqua Pacific Monarch.Apartments well appointed,in good location 200m from Wailiki beach and near transport.However we had an ocean view apartment looking at the sea which got very hot as morning and midday sun came straight in.The small window mounted air conditioner in the living area was all there was and was not up to the task.There is only a ceiling fan in the bedroom.The days were around 28 deg.C and the rooms were hot even though we drew the heavy drapes across the windows.Best to pick a room NOT on ocean or Diamond Head side of building as these rooms get most of the hot sun.The roof top pool was great and the staff helpful and courteous.There are also laundry facilities on the property and Food Pantry supermarket is 300m away

We spent a week at the Aqua Pacific Monarch and enjoyed our stay. The hotel is a bit older but is very clean and the room and bed were comfortable. The 32nd floor view was incredible and as others have said, the staff are all very helpful and friendly. We didn't use the rooftop pool as my wife is afraid of heights but it appeared to be clean and well maintained. The location is great, just two short blocks from the beach and a ten minute walk to the Honolulu Zoo. There is a huge selection of resturants within a few minutes walk in most price ranges. There is a grocery store a few minutes away, and an ABC convenience store a block away. We will be staying at the Aqua Pacific again the next time we are in Honolulu.

Spent 13 nights here - wasn't sure what to expect after reading the review. We were in unit 803 which I highly recommend - nicely appointed, spotlessly clean, large outdoor balcony, good view of Waikiki Beach (which is less than two blocks away). Ideal side of the building to be on, as the balcony mostly doesn't get sun nor does the bedroom (which opens onto a mini-balcony) so it stays cool - we never needed aircon on. And we could leave windows in the living area open at night. There is an onsite laundry and a free shuttle service to Ala Moana. Easy walk to everything but not quite in the mad bustle of the main street. Always something to look at from the balcony. Didn't use the pool as it was very unappealing and windy up there. Excellent Japanese restaurant next door and plenty of food options (including supermarket) near by. Check out the food trucks down the road - well worth a visit.

Return visit and were appalled with the 1 bedroom apartment we were offered (we'd booked and paid 6 months in advance). Curtains were falling apart and the sofa was old - booking for 3 people for 11 nights meant that the sofa HAD to be comfortable. We were shown 4 other appts before we settled on an apartment with a small air con tucked behind the entertainment unit with no curtailing above it to keep the sun and heat out. We were on the morning sun side of the building so the apartment was too hot to be in between 8am and 6pm. The sofa was comfortable at least but the bedroom was insufferably hot as no AC. Staff were friendly but could do nothing but sympathise. Cleaning was good. Resort fee was quoted at $20/night when booked but was $25 when we arrived. Free DVDS could not be used in the lounge room (only area even remotely cool enough for 3 adults to watch a show) as there was no DVD player!!! Very expensive wifi and beach towel fee!!!!! We will never, ever stay here again which is a shame but our holiday money is not easy to come by and we feel that we were taken advantage of. 11 nights at no special rate, booked well in advance, return customers - shabby hotel and apartment owners gouging. Plenty of other properties in the Aqua-Aston group to take advantage of the free loop bus. We spoke to other holiday makers and they too were very disappointed at how run down the building had become. We stayed in early 2017 and had a 1 bedroom unit with 2 split system AC units, DVD player in lounge room, blackout drapes and no louvers.

We brought a group down from Canada to run the Honolulu Marathon, and as we had kids coming on the trip we chose Aqua Pacific Monarch for the kitchenette. Us, as well as our guests were very disappointed when we arrived and entered the room. Although the staff are VERY friendly and helpful, the hotel is VERY dated, the rooms are small, the kitchen is very small, and the air conditioning is EXCEPTIONALLY loud and only cools beside the bed. The curtains have holes in them, and although I know it’s Honolulu, it is VERY loud due to the slatted window the air conditioner is in. I could hear everything outside and got no sleep the entire week. Keep in mind the photos on the website are mainly of the ONE Bedroom Suites, the studios DO NOT have a patio, just a small strip you can stand on, the partial ocean views (see photo) are beyond a bunch of buildings that you can barely see, and it is not as bright and new as the photos look. They are very misleading which is unfortunate. This hotel needs some TLC, if you are looking for like a 2 star hotel this is the place for you, but if definitely did not feel like a resort or a holiday to us, desire having to pay resort fees everyday (not sure for what?)

Return visit. Glad we came back. Exceptionally friendly staff all around. The room was very clean. The kitchen dishes, small appliances, coffeemaker, toaster, rice cooker, microwave, kitchen utensils were spotless. The bed/ pillows were to die for perfect, super comfy. We like this hotel as it is one block from Waikiki beach between Kuhio and Kalakaua streets (the two main roads) and is so central to everything. Once you get to the top floor of the hotel you will find the spacious amenities room. Living room sofas with TV, sm. kitchen, sink, fridge & 8 sets of tables with 4 chairs each. The spectacular roof top pool requires you to walk up another flight of stairs. There is no elevator to get to the rooftop pool. Our room on the 32nd floor had a 1 foot balcony only, (but had large sliding glass doors that opened up all the way providing a wonderful tropical breeze) so if a balcony with furniture is important to you verify that in your reservation. When you check out, if you have a late flight, the hotel will hold your bags. They will graciously give you a key allowing access to use the amenities room, shower room and pool (ask for pool towels if you need them). This is not a high end fancy hotel, but the exceptional customer service will give you that experience.

Weve stayed here each time we visited Waikiki. Great location, walking distance to everything. Reception staff have always been friendly. Housekeeping this year needs improvement as they often knock at 8.30am to do our rooms. When we asked why this early, they complained they have too much rooms to do!The biggest bonus was the free shuttle to Ala Moana, and the friendly shuttle driver, Earl, who gave us tips on where to shop, times etc. The hotel didn’t have a concierge and reception staff did not know much about what’s going on the island for tourist tips. Earl was a treasure!Our 1st room had a big locked pantry which made it difficult to get around the room but reception quickly moved us elsewhere. It seems that some people own the condominiums and get them rented out but leave their things there. The hotel should do something about this. The biggest downside was the noise from the union rally from another hotel, which is no fault of Aqua Pacific Monarch. But these selfish people was making so much ruckus day and night that it ruined everyone’s relaxing holiday.

Close to the beach and the grocery store. They have arranged my transportation to the airport for us. The hotel staff is amazing. I would recommend this place to anyone. I have stayed there twice and will go backp

Great locationThe windows don't seal - glass louvres - it is a very noisy area especially from 5.30am so we had very little sleep. The first room we were offered reeked of smoke. The rooms have a very old air conditioning unit that is too noisy to leave on at night and not very effective.

Rooms were clean & tidy, housekeeping was a bit hit & miss regarding what times rooms were serviced and what was done. Staff were friendly. Unfortunately pool was closed for 4 days whilst we were there, but when checking out we spoke with staff about this & received a discount on our stay for those days. Location is great, just a couple of blocks from the beach and shops just around the corner. The hotel also has a half hourly shuttle to & from Ala Moana Center

My partner & I stayed in this hotel for a week. It is very close to the beach. There is a great supermarket nearby called The Food Pantry. Groceries are very expensive in Oahu as everything is imported, eg. bread = $8, milk = $4, half a dozen eggs = $7! There are loads of stores called ABC stores around too where you can pick up various bits you might require. Just before you come to The Food Pantry, there are some wonderful food wagons with outdoor seating. Food is great & cheap. We actually ate there 4 nights for dinner, we liked it so much. Our favourite was the Blue Water Shrimp & Seafood wagon. We both got steak there one night. It was served with rice, sweetcorn & salad. It cost $30 for the two meals & it was one of the nicest meals we had on out trip. The hotel is clean & all the staff are very friendly. Beach towels are supplied for guests to bring to the beach. The bed was comfortable & the kitchen was well equipped. Cleaning staff serviced the apartment everyday. Lovely refreshing lemon water is available in the lobby. The pool area is nice. The air conditioning in the apartment is not good though. It is EXTREMELY loud & it doesn't really cool the room. I was used to the noise by the end of the week but it does sound like a jumbo jet!! The room was so hot. The fridge also wasn't great either, it froze everything we put in it, including the milk!We were looking for a late check out on the day of departure as we had an evening flight but the hotel could only give us an extra hour. I was a little bit disappointed with this as I have never been refused a late check out before. I don't mind paying for late check out. It worked out ok in the end though as the hotel has a hospitality lounge with shower facilities beside it. The hotel also minded our luggage so could go to the beach for the afternoon & enjoy our last sunset on Waikiki beach (which is amazing by the way). All in all we had an enjoyable stay at this hotel.

We had a lovely room. Bed was terribly hard and a topper was organised with no fuss. Lady on check in was efficient and helpful. Room had kitchenette and fridge and was spacious. Very close to everything in Waikiki and a block from the beach. Great value for money.

We stayed here for 4 nights have been here 6 years ago nothing had changed the hotel is totally outdated the air conditioning is as old and useless as ever there are no cafes no restaurant facilities the staff are really nice when we stayed it was really hot so needless to say we would never stay here again

We stayed here for 3 nights post our cruise. Check in was easy and staff very helpful. The room was adequate for our needs although the air conditioner was quite noisy which made good sleep difficult. The room did have a view and was clean.

Nice apartment but cooking options limited through lack of utensils. Lemon-flavoured water dispenser in the lobby was a very welcome touch. Some frustration with the door key-card which lost its memory on more than one occasion.

This hotel is very outdated. The rooms are small and not overly clean.We had a 1 bedroom apartment, and were upgraded to an ocean view.We didn't sleep well as the a/c in the lounge was too loud to allow us to sleep on the sofa bed, and the bedroom was too hot as it didn't have an a/c.The sofa looked as though it hadn't been cleaned in years. The bedroom itself was so small that it was difficult to get the ironing board out of the closet, and certainly no room to set it up in the room. Lots of bruised shins from hitting the bed when trying to walk around it.The balcony looked fine, but the a/c was so noisy it was rendered unusable.The shower was mouldy and also had the hair of past guests on the tiles and in the plug hole.The staff a really nice and helpful.The free shuttle around Waikiki to Ala Moana was very useful.The pool was closed for half of our stay, and an alternative offered at a sister hotel, but we didn't use it as it wasn't very inviting, even during a heatwave.All up, cleanliness is an issue and the property desperately needs an update and a thorough clean.

We had a 1BR ocean view condo for the week. Staff was great, condo was OK, except for the A/C. It was set on 60 degrees. It did not shut off the entire week. It got down to 73 in the morning, up to 80 in the afternoon. We had our ‘ocean view’ blinds closed all week, to keep the heat out. There was no ventilation. Even with the bedroom fan on constantly, it was still hot in the bedroom. The rooftop pool was nice, not crowded. It had a great view. Because of the AC issues, I would not recommend.

Only 2 short blocks from the beach and Kalakaua Avenue. Short walking distance to restaurants and shopping, very convenient for bus stop locations. Hotel has a complimentary shuttle that takes you to Ala Moana Shopping Centre and back. Friendly front desk staff. Musubi Cafe (various Japanese take-out food) is conveniently located next to the lobby. Only improvement needed is better air conditioning units in the suites!Have stayed here several times and will be returning in October 2018.

The location was perfect - view of Diamond Head and the ocean from our balcony, just two blocks from the beach, ABC store at the corner, lots of restaurant options.Our suite was so convenient: compact kitchen, dining area and lounge, adequate bedroom and bath. Accommodation was not deluxe, but was very clean and comfortable.The staff was excellent. We were always greeted with heartfelt alohas and in particular Danny and Cherlita at the front desk were always ready to answer our questions and offer suggestions to make our stay even better.

Only rooms with 2x single beds available when I checked in at 8pm and since travelling alone, the concierge said “you don’t need a double bed” and giggled. Then in the morning Danny was very rude explaining the hold charge and ammenities fee. Pay the extra $30 and go down the road and stay somewhere else. Pool and sauna areas both very old, carpeted floors and slight smell.

I would happily recommend this place to stay. I was visiting with friends who had stayed here before. The location is convenient, and the view was nice. I particularly enjoyed having a decent sized balcony. great for afternoon reading and drinks!

Aqua Pacific Monarch is only 2 block walk to the sands of Waikiki.The hotel is older than most close by resorts but the rental condos are great with clean rooms, Hawaiian decor wonderful views from your balcony.The local bus system is opposite the hotel so you can get a quick ride to Ala Moana mall and Ward centre.

We ended up loving the hotel but there was definitely a bumpy start. Arrival was fine with our apartment being ready despite our early flight. The reception staff member was really lovely and the process was efficient. Our day unfortunately went downhill when we saw the room. I was crushed. WE were allocated a room on the Penthouse Floor. Unlike the other rooms, our room was behind a separate door that led to two apartments. The apartment was horrible. The only plus side was that it was two bedrooms but the main bedroom was so hot that it was almost unusable as there was only a small fan. The bathroom was worse though. It was honestly a death trap. I don’t know how they can rent out an apartment with that sort of shower. It was clear that the space had previously had a large hot tub in it. The hot tub was long gone but rather than Reno the bathroom, it looked like it had been converted to a shower even though the pipes were still sticking out from the previous plumbing. To make matters worse, you had to climb up a step ladder to get in and out of the shower. It was unbelievably dangerous to have to do that in a wet space. I also had to clean the entire apartment on arrival as it was filthy. To the absolute credit of the staff, they were very accomodating with our request for a room change. We spent the first night feeling miserable and worries about our kids using the shower but the rest of the week was great. Our new room was exactly like the pictures (the first one was nothing like what I expected), and we really loved the location of the hotel. Staff were friendly and the pool area was great. You really can’t beat the location due to the proximity to the beach. Our apartment also had a fantastic view and a lovely big balcony with a table and chairs for outdoor dining. Everything in the second apartment was clean and in good working order. My only regret is that we spent the first night in a substantially sub par (and dangerous) apartment.

If you want The Hilton, pay for The Hilton. If you want a reasonably priced, clean, comfortable hotel in the best location, stay here! We enjoyed every minute of our stay here, didn't have any problem with the noise (?), and found every member of staff courteous and happy to help. We would book here again in a heartbeat.

We stayed for a night between flights and presumably were therefore not offered one of the better rooms. Ours was on a lower floor and there was plenty of mould on the curtain linings, the bathtub was cracked and the aircon was old, needed earplugs to sleep through and was not up to the job of cooling the room on a hot summer day. Louver windows, normally not visible behind curtains, hadn't been cleaned in a while. Other than those areas the room was clean and the beds comfortable. A balcony was only about 2 foot wide and unfurnished. On the plus side, there was a full kitchen including a proper oven, and the hotel was two blocks from the shore. We arrived on an early flight and were able to use a communal sparsely furnished area on the top floor to get changed and repack for the day until our room became available. There are free shuttles to the Ala Moana shopping center. Ours took half an hour to arrive and took another 25 minutes to get there via a very circuitous route. But still, free. Rooms 6 and 7 on each floor face the city and are likely noisier, especially on floors below 10. Everything on Waikiki is very expensive and this isn't the only property in the area that benefits from the popularity of the location and limits investment to maximise profit. Found the staff extremely helpful and friendly and the chap at reception remembered my name despite having met us only once the day before, which was impressive. Transport advice was good. Overall, OK for a night but we would not be back for a longer stay and would probably avoid Waikiki as the value for money proposition isn't that great.

Stayed in the Aqua Pacific Monarch with my wife for our honeymoon in August 2018, and we couldn't have asked for a better place! Here's why:Location: 2 short blocks from a less-crowed area of the Waikiki beach, literally a block from an ABC store (like almost everywhere in Waikiki), and has the best Musubi place in Oahu basically in the lobby of the hotel (Musubi Cafe Iyasume).Rooms: All condos, so all very different I'm sure. However, ours was on the 30th floor with an ocean view, and had a great little patio that a perfect place from which to watch the Aloha Friday fireworks.Staff: Super attentive, and very friendly. In particular, a staff member named Daniel seemed to always be there to lend a great restaurant recommendation or provide prompt service for our room. There was one day we didn't get our room serviced, and they responded my immediately apologizing, cleaning the room, and sending up a gift basket!Would love to stay here again, and definitely would recommend!

Well located for shops, restaurants and the beach, great views over the city, roof top pool, comfy roomsThere was plenty of linen and towels supplied, plus coffee etc. also beach towels. We really enjoyed our visit

This is a great hotel; it’s only a two minute walk from the beach, has its own rooftop pool and provides a free shuttle to the nearby shopping mall. All the staff I interacted with were lovely and check in/out was quick and easy. The hotel is very secure with key card access required. Beach towels are available at the front desk for the pool or the beach. The hotel also provides a shuttle (a fee applies) to the airport. I’ve travelled 50 states in 6 months and Hawaii is the only place I’ve been where the bus drivers won’t allow luggage on their buses and what’s worse is that some allow it and some don’t which can make for a very distressing situation; luckily the hotel were able to get me onto a shuttle at the last minute and I’m very grateful to all the staff who helped me. The rooms are clean with lovely coconut smelling toiletries. There’s a safe in the room to protect valuables and there’s also a kitchenette area which is perfect for making breakfast before a busy day. The only downside is that the fridges don’t include mini freezers so my ice cream melted straight away (I didn’t realise before I bought it). The bed was comfortable and BED BUG FREE and the shower had good pressure, although it was a little stiff to turn on. There’s a little balcony to stand out on where you can see views of the city and the street leading down to the beach. The view from the roof is beautiful! I enjoyed my stay here and I would definitely come back again in the future. It was very reasonably priced, clean and comfortable for my week long stay and in close proximity to everything I needed including bus routes and restaurants!

The best value for money, hotel is basic but its everything you need. The staff were super super friendly and nothing was a hassle if asked for advice, always greeted us with a smile.....every single day. The room was great, we had the basic room with a view, it had everything we needed, fridge to keep the drinks cold, heaps of room for all our things, TV to watch movies at night (so many channels), bathroom was compact, nice and clean. The air conditioning is loud in the room, but my husband is hard of hearing and I luckily sleep through anything so it didn't bother us. Room was nice and cool when we finally came back from our days adventuring. Supermarket close by, yummy caravan eatery's just up the road (next to the supermarket corner), we hired a car just up the road from hotel and they were great and we had to use the car park building which is in the hotel, it was $30 for 24 hours which we found fine as there were two couples and we just halved it, I read so many bad reviews about the parking before we arrived, but they were friendly, no issues there. This was our first time to Hawaii and OMG I just LOVE Hawaii. We will be back and we will be staying at this hotel again it was everything we needed and more. I actually think the staff deserve a pay rise as they are sensational and it would be sad to see them go :-) Thanks for everything, cant wait to return!!!!

We had a great stay at this hotel for a week in a 1 bedroom apartment. It was clean, the kitchen was well equipped, all the staff were very helpful, nice balcony with table and chairs, bed and sofa bed were comfortable. Basically it has everything we needed for our stay. It has a wonderful location too, only a couple of small blocks back from the beach and an ABC store very close by. We’d definitely stay here again. I do have one negative comment and that is the noisy aircon.

Felt like walking through an old episode of 5-0 (with Jack Lord!) but in a cool way. Looks like Aqua are trading on this classic feel with their hotels and it fits the Waikiki vibe for us tourists.We were grateful for being upgraded to the one bed with a huge lanai. It was on a lower floor (8) so there was noise from Kuhio Ave, but the days we were there windy and reckon the higher floors would mean it too breezy to leave a door open let alone step outside for any time.Surrounded by load of places to eat - one block from the beach, and the full kitchen with coffee maker, full sized fridge and even a full stove - was just like your own apartment.

We enjoyed our stay at Aqua Pacific Monarch and the service from reception staff in particular was excellent. The rooms are nicely appointed, and we enjoyed the view of the city and partial view of the ocean. The hotel is in a very central location. Hawaii is a very big city, with lots and lots of highrise buildings within a very small city area. Everything in the city is super expensive, and having the ability to make some quick/simple breakfast snack items for yourself was very welcome, as our room had both a microwave, coffee dripfilter as well as a cooktop and dining area in the room. I particularly enjoyed opening the balcony door, but watch out for the seagulls flying in!The pool area on rooftop was quite small however, extremely windy. You were unable to sit outside without glasses, towel, book etc blowing away even though there is fencing around the area. If there are children (or noisy adults) around, it is not a relaxing area. The hotel provided a happy hour with some snacks and drinks available in an upstairs room, which was quite nice and friendly, but was not well attended as there are some 500 rooms in this building. We enjoyed our stay.

Very helpful staff, rooms were excellent, clean, so close to Waikiki beach. Free shuttle service to shops and other points of interest. Near bus stops. Great views, great swimming pool. Have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

We stayed in a partial ocean-view room from May 30-June 4. We thought the room was nice. Hey its nothing fancy but its comfortable. Full kitchen was great, really handy to have. Couch was big and the pull out sofa bed wasn't too bad. The bed was nice and comfy. Great view and so close to the beach (approx 2 blocks back) At the end of the street you come out at the beach by the Duke statue so a great location. Worth the upgrade to the partial oceanview due to the view (otherwise you are looking at other buildings/ the road!) and the balcony which is a great size. The lead in rooms have tiny balconies. The air con is noisy but we only used it when we went out to make the room cold. The pool is nice. They have a spa too. View from the pool deck is lovely. Bathroom is an ok size.We were only on the 9th floor but didnt find road noise too excessive. Sure theres a bit as you are in the city so its to be expected.Pretty much its not 5 star fancy but you wouldnt expect it for the price. I think its the pick of the bunch in that price range. Front desk were helpful for us.

This hotel has a parking garage. Be very careful they have a towing company they contract with that literally has people walking around looking for cars to tow. We were 10 minutes over our time and it cost $300. Mind you we had paid $40 for parking. Our car was towed to a very bad section of town. The managers said sorry not my fault.

Situated in the heart of Waikiki makes for a short walking access to the beach, shopping, restaurants, supermarket and buses. Our room had the convenience a fully equipped kitchenette and there is laundry facilities for $3 a wash. There is a terrific view over the ocean, beach, city and mountains from the rooftop where there is also a pool and spa. Staff are friendly and helpful, we wouldn't hesitate in returning to this hotel.

This hotel was so bad we can almost laugh about it now we’ve been home a week.Obviously we weren’t expecting the Ritz but the very minimum you expect from a hotel is to be able to sleep. We didn’t, because there was a high pitched alarm type sound in our room all night. The type that penetrates your dreams, wakes you up, stops.... and then just as you manage to drift off it starts up again (rinse, repeat, all night long).At about 4am the delivery trucks on the street outside start working and despite being on the 17th floor it sounded as if we were right down on the street with them. The air conditioner is about 20 years old and also noisy. So no, we didn’t get any sleep AT ALL. When we checked in we were told that we were there on their ‘cocktail reception’ night. So we headed up to the ‘hospitality room’ and found a run-down looking room with guests sat around a boom box. ‘Appetisers’ were a bowl of chips, some unpeeled carrots and some grapes. The ‘cocktail’ was a plastic cup of sprite with a slice of orange. The rooms are dated, filthy and noisey. The lifts stop at every single floor (30 something). The front desk staff are rude and unhelpful. The only positive is that we didn’t see any cockroaches.

I stayed at Aqua Pacific for 9 days in May, with my sister and daughter. We had a kitchenette studio. Large spacious room. The room was clean on arrival, no complaints. Location is great, so close to the beach. Heaps of restaurants close by. Also very short walk up the road is food pantry (supermarket) which is open late. Location is excellent for moderate priced hotel. The views from the roof are amazing. The pool is adequate for a quick swim. The hotel reception staff are friendly. This is a chilled out hotel good if you are staying a long time.

Friendly front office. Location awesome. Great for people watching. Block and a half from beach. Close to restaurants, shops and transport. Room dated and it would be nice to have a little bar area bythe pool for nibbles and drinks.View was good too as could see the sea and beach. Thank you for your hospitality

We had a lovely stay at this hotel recently three of us traveled together we had an apartment with one bedroom twin beds and a very large comfortable sofa bed in the living area a large balcony with ocean views and a kitchenette my only issue would be that on checking in the staff could’ve been a little more forthcoming with information as to the pass for the shopping trolley bus and timetables etc . Otherwise we thoroughly enjoyed our stay.

Hotel very convenient located close to everything the only one to have a complimentary drinks on a Friday the only thing is the card to your room always needs to be reset air conditioning noisy needs turning off at night but room has a fan

This visit was part of a destination wedding and visiting a family member and since it was only one night and my daughter had stayed at the sister hotel next door Aqua Bamboo Waikiki in the past (we couldn't get a reservation for 3 people for the date we wanted-all booked), I booked to stay at the Aqua Pacific Monarch Hotel for one night so we could be two blocks to the beach and of course location is everything! Pros:* two blocks from Waikiki Beach, * very clean as far as I could see as we had a kitchenette in our room, clean bathroom and neatly thick folded bath towels with the face towels shaped as shells!* Pillows were comfy!* Musubi Cafe Iyasume on the street level in the hotel! * Free beach towel per person with towel card provided by front desk. * front desk and housekeeping very helpful and friendlyCons: * Noisy air conditioner, noise from the street was very loud, and bedroom ceiling fan kept clicking. I thought I could use the noise as white noise like a sound machine, but it was hard to sleep soundly. * $30.00 for parking per day in the adjoining garage (not part of the hotel) Normally if I'm going to go all out and come to Hawaii, I would stay in a 4 star but for just one night, I could handle it. Life is short so enjoy it as much as you can!

We arrived after an extremely long journey from the U.K. and were pleasantly surprised to be told we had been upgraded to a partial ocean view, this was much appreciated as the view was great from our balcony and room on the fourteenth floor. The room was spacious and functional, and although we didn't really use the kitchen facilities, the refrigerator was handy for keeping drinks cool. The water was lovely and hot, there was an abundance of towels and the cleaners visited every day. Wi fi was ok, it could be a little slow at times, but hey we're on holiday so no rush! The bed was comfortable and we slept well, despite the sounds of the city. As other reviews have noted, the biggest selling point for this hotel is the location. A short walk to the beach and all the main attractions of Waikiki, it's just fab. The resort fee included the safe, pool towels, wi fi, DVD hire and a shuttle bus to a nearby shopping mall - we didn't take advantage of this so can't comment. For anyone travelling on a budget, there are some amazing places for cheap eats close by, including the cafe at the hotel entrance which does amazing ahi poke bowls. All the hotel staff were courteous and pleasant. We would also thoroughly recommend walking up to Diamond Head, the Mai Tai sunset cruise and the full island bus tour with Roberts.

Great location of this condo. 1 1/2 blocks to the best people watching beach in Waikiki. Breakfast, lunch, dinner and food markets within steps of the front lobby. Shopping within a blocks. View from the balcony is awesome, pool deck is even better. Beds are very comfortable. Bathroom and kitchenette are suficiant. Chairs, umbrella, boogie boards, snorkel gear all waiting for you in the closet. Small safe in the closet. 2 small condition issues are the sink in the bathroom doesn’t drain properly and the drapes are really in terrible condition. They need to be removed. The unit decorations are a little dated but that didn’t get in the way of this very functional unit. Staff was so very nice. Only one little issue with a front desk staff trying to discourage us from parking our rental car at the condo. She tried to get us to park else where. We parked at the condo and didn’t have a single problem. Great unit, will be back soon

We stayed at the Aqua Pacific Monarch for a week as a family of 5. It’s location is great it is only two blocks from the beach. The hotel provides complementary beach towels and there is a complimentary shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre. The rooftop pool has amazing views of the beach and the kids loved it. Definitely a good place to stay as a family with a lot of restaurants near by. There is also a market at nearby Kings Village that sells amazing pastries. Would happily stay here again.

A clean hotel with a great location, 5 mins to the beach, had a kitchen which saved on breakfasts and option to cook a meal. Bed was comfortable but pillows need improving. Need handles to get in and out of the shower which is over the bath. Sofa, kitchen table & chairs. lanai was small. We faced east so was a bit bright in the morning. Great to be able to have open windows/doors or air conditioning. Would stay here again.

We were upgraded to Kitchenette, huge stove and full size fridge, separate bedroom and bathroom. We were on the 11th floor with a limited view of the ocean. Checked out to go to the Big Island and came back the next evening to a new room. Studio with smaller kitchenette. Beds in the main room but on the 28th floor with amazing views. Facilities are good and would definitely stay here again.

My main issue was the a/c was built into a wndow at floor level right next to the bed (1504). Super noisy when on and very hot in the evening/night when off. Street noise also bad even on the fifteenth floor. I would never stay in the room again. No eating facilities in house. Just a short walk to the beach. Nice lemon infused water!

Great, great location. Just two short, easy blocks away from Waikiki beach. Friendly & helpful service. Nice clean rooms & bathrooms. Yes, the furniture, layout, window type air conditioning unit may be dated but i think this is the appeal of Hawaii. A nice, chill retro vibe.

The Aqua Pacific Monarch cannot be placed any more strategically in Waikiki. Close to all the amenities, iconic beach and shopping centers. The rooms are very spacious, clean and tidy. The staff is amazingly friendly and helpful about anything local. I would certainly recommend staying here as a hotel is only for putting your head down at night after enjoying the amazing sights of Oahu!

We were staying at Aqua Pacific Monarch in November 2017 for a week. Great location, near the strip and beaches. Nice, clean, cozy apartment with all amenities ( sauna, swimming pool on the roof ) with gorgeous view. Very friendly staff. Thank you guys. Hope we come back again. Sincerely. Albert and Marina.

Our room wasn’t very modern, but it was nice, had a small kitchenette, and the bed was comfortable. Staff was friendly and the roof pool was nice, but the “amenities fee” of $25 was not worth what they “provided” they gave you a card where you could check out dvd’s and WiFi was “included.” There was always cold lemon water in the lobby which was s nice touch, but parking was $30 a day in the hotels own parking ramp. The location was pretty good, overall not a bad place to stay but everything was very expensive.

I got an Airbnb in Pacific Monarch and was amazing. Definitely, it is the best location near all stores, restaurant and etc. It's a cute studio, very clean, comfortable bed and nice pool area. (Pool is small but great view). I'd definitely recommend it. (I don't know about the entire hotel if it's all like the aribnb room).

This is our 2nd stay at this hotel - both times we paid for the full ocean view and I have to say certainly worth it - even for the balcony size which seats a 4 seater outdoor setting. Hotel is a little dates but always clean and rooms cleaned and towels changed daily. As we were in the 1 bedroom and had full kitchen facilities it was nice to make our own breakfast every day. Any tours that did not pick us up from hotel the pick up was 1 street away. From our hotel we can walk to everything we need - supermarket, bars, restaurants etc - always felt safe in this location - no matter what time of night we were walking home. The amenity fee is worth it even just for Wi-Fi and the free beach towels everyday! I totally recommend.

The. room w as clean,a little bit dated decor,ev erthing worked fine,stove,microwave,fridge,& gabarader,,.we were on the 13 th floor,had ma I'd service every day,had a small but warm roof top pool ,& hot tub. On the 33 Rd floor,was a bit windy up there on 33 Rd floor! Our balcony was only about 24 inches wide,hardly wide enough to put a chair out there . Just standing room only. The hotel staff was very helpful a nything you asked the were right there to help or to answer your questions, the location was great a block from the beach,& grocery store as well as the farmers market for fresh produce. I would return to stay again,

Hotel is close to beach and all Waikiki hot spots . Handy shuttle that runs to Alamoana shopping center every 1/2 hour the cost fo this is included in you resort fee.The hotel itself is quite dated buy is quite adequate if your just looking for somewhere to put your head down, House keeping staff are really wonderful however front line staff need to sharpen their customer service skills.
