Waitomo Caves, New Zealand

review_body: Long overdue review. I stayed during late sept early oct 2017. I arrived well before check in time and was pleasantly surprised when told my room was ready. Check in was nice and simple and as I had booked direct all of the extra items promised with a direct booking where present and accounted for. For myself coming from Australia we don’t have “amenities fee” but I was well informed when I did my booking so this did not bother at all as I had already accounted for the fee during the booking process.I found all the staff whom I had interactions with present, helpful and approachable. Overall great customer service. Housekeeping standards were of a high standard and room was clean and fresh. A side note some of the furniture in the room is a little outdated but seeing as I was in Hawaii I didn’t really send that much time in my room.The best part about aqua pacific is the location. Central Waikiki is going to be noisy there is no getting around that but when you are a 5 minute walk from beach, restaurants,bars and shopping it balances out well. My one other note is that the Aqua Pacific unlike some larger chains was super secure As there are no bars/ restaurant s located beyond the front desk you required a room key to get past the front desk area and as a solo female traveller this particular aspect really appealed to me.I would absolutely stay at the Aqua Pacific again!

Clean and tidy apartments, in a quiet side-road just minutes away from Waikiki beach and the bustling shopping/eating scene. Apartments are well-apportioned - comes with small kitchen, cutlery, microwave, dining desk, side-desk and a sofa bed. There are additional charges for amenities though, so do note the extras. Plenty of eateries within easy walking distance - the Korean grill/takeaway across the road is amazing.

View and room were wonderful. Only a few minor complaints, noisy air conditioner, very bright light on clock (had to cover it every night), too much furniture in the bedroom making it small and the excessive resort fee. Close to amenities and Waikiki shops. Staff very friendly and helpful.

If you want to stay in Waikiki this hotel is a good one. We were four and had a studio room on the 28th floor. Amazing view on the city the hills and the sea. We enjoyed the rooftop swimming pool and spa, which good use a new engine though (awful whistling of the bubble device). Room with kitchenette clean, good mattress and small stores not too far. Just remember Nothing is cheap in Waikiki.

I was in a nice room in the hotel. Staff was great. Didn't care for the additional fees for things I didn't use. Parking exorbitant.Beach is a quick walk. Shopping at just a couple blocks away.Overall, a really nice place, but Waikiki just didn't do it for me. Too touristy.

Clean & tidy apartments. Although self contained, there wasn't really much in the kitchen so it was difficult to do much more than breakfast and basic meals at the apartment. The staff were excellent and the views were amazing. Such a great location, only about a three minute walk to the beach and so close to shops and restaurants. The pool area was being renovated so hopefully they will make that more inviting. The pool is tiny and as such was warmer than bath water. Yuck!

Staff was friendly. Location is within walking distance to beach, shopping and dinning. Rooms are outdated, but acceptable. Parking is $30/night, make sure you follow their rules such as displaying your paid ticket clearly and not parking on the “lines,” otherwise you will 100% get towed!!!

New York City, New York

review_body: This hotel is tired, needs to be renovated which is being done atm.It’s in a great position, one block from the beach, a 10 minute ( slow) walk to the international Market, Cheesecake Factory and lots of great restaurants and shops. Roof top pool, spa and sauna with great views of Honolulu. Free shuttle to Ala Moana every 30 minutes.We are on the 23rd floor and the only down side to seating here is the noise in the mornings. Very noisy from 6am onwards. I would definitely stay here again but would ask for a quieter room if there is one. If you are looking for a nice stay, not luxury I would recommend the Pacific Monarch.

Great hotel! I booked through hotwire and got a one bedroom suite with full kitchen and dining area and walk out balcony or lanai that had a table and chairs for sitting. Loved sitting there for breakfast in the morning! I was on the 11th floor with a partial view of the ocean (the Hyatt hotel blocked the views, but you can still get a pretty nice view) and city.The bed is very comfortable, the sofa was not as comfortable and small, but I guess you are not spending that much time on the sofa anyway. The A/C is a built in unit which was rather loud, but I never used it. I just opened the balcony door and let the cool air in (it is not that humid/hot in January) and left it ajar when I was out and that was good enough. At night, I just used the ceiling fan in the bedroom. The hotel itself is very clean and the staff very friendly. No need to book a hotel at the Hyatt or other posh hotels which will costs you more $$$. They provide beach towels and beach chairs and a shuttle to the Ala Moana mall. All this is included in the daily amenity fee of $20. The hotel has a Japanese café and a restaurant which are both very good and at reasonable prices. Across the street you can get a poké bowl and Korean BBQ. Not only is the hotel very good but the location is top notch! The hotel is just minutes away from the beach and walking distance to the main strip and is situated on Kuhio Avenue where there’s lots of small restaurants, takeout places and food trucks. I would recommend to eat here and not at those fancy restaurants on the main strip to save money. The only negative is that the laundry facilities could be better. They only have 3 washers and they are rather old. I think they should invest in updating the washers. It costs $3 each to wash and dry. Tip: use coins to pay for your wash as I and another guest was having difficulty in using the credit card for payment. It was declined several times for no rhyme or reason. All in all, I had an excellent stay at the Pacific Monarch and will stay there again when I come back!

I stayed here with my family in a partial ocean view apartment over Christmas 2017 for 2 weeks. We arrived on a 6am flight and were pleasantly surprised that our room was ready for us when we arrived in Waikiki although it wasn’t the room we had booked and we were moved the next day to a one bedroom with twin beds as per our booking. The view from the 24th floor is spectacular although the balcony got quite windy at times. We could see the sea, city and Diamond Head.Location to Waikiki Beach and the views are the best features of this hotel. The beachfront is a 2 minute walk. The apartment is compact, decor is quite nice if a little outdated, kitchen facilities were good, but the bathroom is tiny and the sofa smelt stale. Our toilet blocked several times, but it was dealt with quickly each time. Rooms were serviced daily.Laundry facilities are on level 3, 2 out of the 4 washing machines were out of order during our stay which was a bit frustrating.The rooftop pool is nice to get away from the crowds at the beach. The pool is small and warm and there’s a spa too. Again all a bit dated, but the 360 degree views are spectacular. Beach towels were provided at reception which is always handy. Staff were friendly and helpful at all times and I believe reception is open 24 hours.There is a courtesy bus which runs to Ala Moana shopping centre each day, every half an hour.To sum up, perfectly acceptable accommodation in a fantastic location, everything on your doorstep.Thanks Aqua Pacific.

My family & I stayed here between the 19th DEC to the 28th DEC. location about 40m from Waikiki beach. Close to all the major shops & restaurants. Room was nice. Does need better lighting. Wasnt enough vanity space to have make up bag on so used mirror in living area. But lighting was only good if curtains were open. Shower bath taps were confusing. Bed was very comfortable. No Oven in our room. but luckily our families rooms had oven room(908) Lifts took a long time to get. There was 3 of them but not enough for the amount of ppl wanting to use at the same time. Friendly staff. We had a small view of the ocean. Overall it was a nice place to stay and convenient.

Myself and my family stayed here for 2 weeks in December and had a great time here. We had a kitchen apartment with a partial sea view which was excellent, the hotel was a 5 minute walk from the beach. The hotel also offers beach towels, free shuttle bus to the shopping centre ( Ala Moana center) that runs until 9 o'clock at night which is great as the movies are 10 minutes walk from the centre. The hotel also has a rooftop pool,spa and sauna that was great for those lazy days just relaxing in the sun.the staff are great also very helpful from the font desk to the room service staff fantastic, I would definitely recommend this hotel as it's value for money and if I return to Hawaii again this is where I will stay.

Based on the reviews, I chose to stay here for 6 nights. It end up being a big disappointment. I’ll start with the good parts: 1) location is what you pay for. It’s close to the beach, and there are plenty of restaurants and shops within the walking distance. 2) their queen size bed is bigger than a normal king size bed. 3) most staff are nice. The biggest deal breaker for me is the noise of this hotel. We live in the 23 floors and shut all the windows. We could still hear the noise from the street, e.g. cars passing, bus stopping, and people laughing from the street. The hotel sent someone to check the room, and they said the windows was shut properly and every room in the hotel is like this. If you mind noise, STAY AWAY FROM THIS HOTEL. Problem #2: they only have one type of pillow, which is very tall for me. Most hotels I stayed at have at lease one high and one low pillow to choose from. If you don’t like their only pillow option, you’re out of luck. Other small problems: 1) When I called the front desk, they don’t seem to know where I’m calling from (inside or outside of the hotel, not even mentioning knowing about the room number). I thought hotels at this price would already have a system in place. 2) There were times when I called the front desk, I felt they were rushing to hang up the phone. I asked questions like “do you have rooms with queen size bed available for tonight”, and the front desk said he doesn’t know. I found it hard to believe. 3) They make the system unnecessary complicated. I got room keys, towels keys and dvd rental keys. You need the towel keys to exchange for clean beach towels at the front desk. 4) there’s no salt or cooking oil in the kitchen, which I thought were the basic condiment for a kitchen. The hotel is old and simple, which I don’t mind. But the noise and their only pillow option will make me not to come back again.

Stayed with my parents for my dad's 80th. Great spot and view. Staff were friendly and used the kitchen each morning for breakfast. Situated between the International Marketplace and the Honolulu Zoo.

My husband and I stayed here for 6 nights on our honeymoon. We had a city view apartment on the 23rd floor and it was fantastic! We could even see part of the ocean.From check in to check out the service was excellent and nothing was too big for the staff to help us. Very friendly, knowledgeable staff and our room was immaculate! Couldn't have picked a better place to stay with the beach 100 metres from the hotel and right in the heart of Waikiki. You can also see the Friday night fireworks from the rooftop! Would highly recommend for such a great price!

We stayed for a week in a one bedroom ocean view suite. It lacked nothing except perhaps a decent air conditioner. Fortunately the weather was cool enough not to need one. As the inadequate unit was in the lounge room only, I would seriously consider staying elsewhere in the hotter months. The sleep was very comfortable. The kitchen had everything we needed to cook for ourselves and also had a full size fridge. We were on the 20th floor and it was noisy at times with sirens and general traffic noise. We could also hear those above and below us at times. Most of the staff were lovely and helpful. We arrived early morning and made use of the hospitality room near the rooftop pool where we had a shower with towels provided by the front desk. Our room was ready early and we were allowed in. We were very close to numerous shops (ABC and others) that stocked anything you may need - food, alcohol, gifts, toiletries etc. Also close by was a tour bus pick up sight. The beach was only about 2 minutes walk away as were numerous restaurants and food vans. Also close by is a vehicle rental sight. I would definitely stay here again.

I will be here for 2 weeks. It is a good view the bed is awesome it's a double u can not move on the couch bed at all it squeaks so easily the cover rubs between the plastic bed holder thing and it sounds horrible

had a 7 night stay on the 22 floor, great view of the city and partial of the beach, spectacular at night. The hotel is in a great location, walk to nearly everything and plenty of food within minutes. It is an older hotel but well maintained and the staff are were all very helpful. Pleasure to stay at in the middle of everything.

Room was on level 31. Provided great customer service. Didnt have any problems whatssoever and would stay there again. Great location, walking distance to shops, restaurants and beach. Staff all friendly. Big shout out to ROBERT at reception who first checked us in only level 9 and then said he could take up up to a higher level if we checked out the following day and checked in as they were really busy and didnt have any other rooms available at that time. Great hotel.

Stayed here in November with my wife and 2 kids, Rooms are adequate to sleep and have a quick rest in the middle of the day if need be .. at the end of the day who goes on a holiday to stay in their rooms all day .. friendly and helpful staff and probably the best view from a hotel pool in all of Waikiki. Would certainly stay here again.

Currently on second last day of ten night stay. Have no complaints. Have stayed in Waikiki several times before and well will def come back here. Booked partial ocean view studio direct with hotel and got upgraded to one bedroom apartment on arrival. furniture on the balcony is old but it did the trick, and when we could sit out there it was lvpely, winds were really strong. I slept on the so far bed, which was as comfy as sofa beds can be . Location is the selling point. Road the bus from across the road everyday. Pool area isnt huge but the beach is not five mins walk away. Food pantry just up the road for supplies. kitchen is small but your on holiday and it has all the utensils etc you need and a full size fridge is a bonus. Overall staff very friendly, nothing a hassle and yes we will be back.

Stayed here for a week in November with my family in a 1 bedroom apartment. The rooms are so small! Felt like we were on top of each other the whole time. Kitchen and bathrooms are basic but functional. I didn't like that the Balcony only had one lock on it, we were on the 30th floor and I was terrified my 2 year old could unlock it from her height. They need a dead lock up higher. Pool is on the roof it's nice but cold all the time. Service was average. One day the house keeper barged into our room after only knocking once - I was half dressed and it was like she couldn't understand English when I asked her to leave as my daughter was sleeping! All in all location is good- 2 blocks back from the beach. 5 min walk to places like the International Market Place. Next time we would stay somewhere like the Sheraton which is better equipped for families.

Room was good, nothing to complain about other than maybe some street noice at night however we got used to it after a while. Location of this hotel is great, we basically walked wherever we needed to go. Was close for the trolley bus stops and also close for all shopping and restaurants.

After reading the reviews prior to my trip I wasn't sure what to expect from this hotel but we were not disappointed. The staff on arrival were extremely friendly and polite and explained all the services that were available with the "Amenities Fee" - Shuttle to Alo Moana Shopping Mall, DVD Rental, Beach Towel and Chairs and a list of other things. They also clearly explained about the parking which we didn't need but was good to know just in case we kept our rental car overnight. When we checked in there were only rooms with single beds but the lady was very helpful and contacted us to advise that there would be a queen room available a few days later and we were moved to that room which was great. The view was fabulous from the room, we had two rooms and each on different sides of the building, one with a great sunset 2306 and the other of the ocean and diamond head 3207. During our stay we were well accommodated in the room with the amenities, the aircon can be loud but it didn't disturb us when sleeping, comfortable beds and clean bedding, the rooms are serviced daily but floors aren't cleaned daily as we had sand in one area that remained the whole stay. From what I could gather the apartments are privately owned by individuals and serviced by the Aqua Group so they all have a different look and the upkeep is quite different as well i'm guessing based on what the owner has been prepared to do with their property. The kitchen cabinets in room 2306 could do with a bit of renovating whereas the ones in 3207 were quite new so for that I can't fault the hotel as I think they are doing a great job with what they have. The location is FANTASTIC, a short walk to the beach front, two ABC stores nearby and a Food Pantry in short distance for snacks and drinks and so close to all the restaurants. Just when we were leaving a North Shore Food Truck had opened on Kuhio Avenue also a very very short walk that I suggest you try and across from the hotel there is a ME BBQ little restaurant which has breakfast at a great price and the food is delicious. We had a great stay at the Aqua Pacific Monarch, It's not 5*, rooms could do with some work but the value for money, staff friendliness and location you could not fault.

A basic hotel centrally located in Waikiki. Hotel is older, clean and friendly staff. 2 blocks from the beach. The only real issue is the parking associated to the hotel which is not run by the hotel. Parking lot owners appear to be tow happy. Would recommend as basic accommodation for a family trip.

We stayed for 5 nights before joining the Pride Of America cruise ship and had a brilliant time. The Pacific Monarch is ideally situated one block back from the beach in line with the Duke’s statue. We were on the 28th floor with a ocean view apartment. The views were fantastic and the location was ideal at the right end of Waikiki, away from the larger hotels at the western end. The apartment was very comfy with a great bed and balcony with outstanding views. The kitchen allowed us to make breakfasts but the Monarch is within easy walking distance of all the best restaurants along the beach front. The only negative was that the window rattler air conditioner struggled to cool the unit, but the fan over the bed was great.

Waikiki Beach and the Aqua Pacific Monarch was our first stop on Anniversary trip to Hawaii. Danny and the rest of the staff were welcoming, friendly and always willing to answer questions. The hotel is a little older and could use some work in some areas, which they are currently doing. What it lacks in being older, it makes up for in friendliness and location. We were within walking distance of Waikiki Beach, shopping and dining. If staying in the Waikiki Beach area I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here. No you do not have the “resort” feel, but who stays in their room in Hawaii! Plus check out the view!

My wife and I checked in late. The man who checked us in was very nice and the check in experience was fast and efficient. Security is good. At night there is a security guard in the lobby. You also need your room key to access the elevators.We were upgraded to the 29th floor. The view was beautiful and I could not stop looking out the window. We had a one bedroom. It was small, but we did not really need it to be any bigger. The wifi was really fast. You get free movies and video game use, but we did not travel to Hawaii for that. The room is cleaned every day.The hotel is old, but they did do some updates that doesn't make it feel old. I would recommend it to anyone. Its location is ideal and you can easily walk to anywhere in Waikiki without any problem.

I have stayed in Waikiki many times and this hotel is by far the best I have encountered. Clean, brilliantly located, great staff, awesome amenities, excellent for a longer stays. As another reviewer said "feels like home". There is a bit of renovation going on at the moment but it never interfered with our stay. Will be my go to place for future visits for sure!

I stayed at Luanda last time and loved it. This is another Aqua resort so I thought I would be treated respectfully. The man at the front desk was disrespectful and humiliated me and my daughter in front of people. I will 've complaining to Aqua headquarters and avoid staying at any Aqua Hotel unless Aqua takes care of this situation. No one who comes in should be treated so rudely. The hallways and carpet are dirty.

The first impression was great, but was disappointed that our room was not ready. After being on a flight all night, we just wanted to check in, change cloths and go for a swim. The web site said we had access to a holding room, so we could refresh, but that didn't happen. We had to go for a walk for an hour and half, then went back to check in. the room was very tidy, and had everything that we needed. It was a self contained apartment, and had all the cooking needs, except a dishwasher. We went upstairs to go for a swim in the rooftop pool, and found the water very hot, and the pool was so full of chlorine, that we couldn't breath. I am an asthmatic, so was unable to swim there again. The hotel was very good, the staff very friendly, and the proximity to everything was excellent. I would stay there again.

Spent 3 nights in Honolulu at this hotel. It looks like a converted condo buildiing to me. It is still under renovation in certain areas. This hotel is 2 blocks from Waikiki beach. The location is excellent. There is a free shuttle that runs every half hour during the day, and stops at shopping areas and some hotels. The staff is excellent and the hotel clean. They know our needs as cruisers and travellers. They let us store our luggage on the last day until we got back from a tour at 5:30 p.m. They made us comfortable after a long day, in the lobby with access to bathrooms and a change area, until our shuttle came to take us to the airport. We had a one bedroom, with kitchenette, and balcony. We would definitely stay here again.

We enjoyed a week at the Aqua Pacific Monarch. When we arrived, we knew that there were going to be renovations so we were prepared, but at check in we were told that our room had balcony access, when we got to the room it did not as it was closed for renovations. We asked to be moved to one that did have a balcony - we had two children and a surfing husband so wanted space - and they were able to accommodate us, although unfortunately on a lower floor. We were unable to use the pool due to renovations as well but had access to the pool next door which was amazing and the beach was so close, we hardly spent any time at the pool anyway. We loved that the place was within walking distance to shops, supermarkets, restaurants, the zoo, and plenty of other things - perfect location. It is definitely not luxury, but comfortable and the staff were helpful. Weather at this time of year is perfect!

Spent 4 days here. Had a partial ocean view room---could see the ocean between 2 high rise buildings. Beautiful view from the rooftop deck. Nice pool but disappointed the jacuzzi was closed. Looks like they are doing repairs. Friendly helpful staff. Our room was on the 10th floor close to elevator but didn't hear any noise. Had a nice clean room with king bed, sitting area, dining table and small kitchen. Was able to cook a few meals. Balcony and windows all along one side of room. Too bad it was too humid to sit out and enjoy. Bathroom is clean but dated. Had one wall a/c unit that ran constantly. Nice location. Close to bus, beach, shopping and dining. Refreshing lemon water in lobby.

We have just returned from 3 weeks at the Aqua Pacific Monarch and loved it. It is great value for money. We requested a high floor and to be on the same floor as our friends. They were able to accommodate both requests which really helped make our holiday great. We were on opposite sides of the building so if it was windy on one side we could use the balcony on the other side. We spent a lot of time on the roomy balcony.Our room was serviced every day with lots of shopping rubbish removed for us. The pool had reopened and was great.Cherita at the front desk was always helpful especially with bus cheat sheets.Danny was awesome and always friendly and helpful and worked his magic in loading a ridiculous amount of bags into our taxi to the airport. The Monarch is so handy to all the things you could need in Waikiki.Thanks again for a great time. We will definitely be back.

We had a 1 bedroom suite. It was great and served the purpose. All appliances worked and made breakfast a breeze. And given the proximity to Waikiki beach (1.5 blocks / 2 min walk), this place was great. Amenities in the hotel were not great, the rooftop pool is a waste of time. Being on the roof, it heats up quickly. But you get beach towels and beach chairs (be sure to ask for them - they don't advertise it!). There is a resort fee - $20USD/day. Wifi is included in that fee. No onsite parking. There is an attached garage that charges $30USD per day. If you have a car, park a few blocks from the hotel at Waikiki Banyan parking Garage. It's $20USD per day or $80 USD per week.

Arrived room on 13th floor tick slight ocean view tick two single beds not what we asked for next morning requested a different bed double or queen told not possible but will look for a new room new room found first floor above the car park double bed in corner 12 inches from my pillow was the A/C unit which had to be on all night there was no other fan Windows only open 8 inches outside the sliding doors painters are working all day going up and down the side of the building so doors had to be closed the only cool part of the room was undeneath the bed where the A/C BLEW on checking out mentioned the problems fell on deaf ears they just gave the a/c for the amenities fee and see you later . We never complained earlier as we were told there were no other rooms available for what we paid a night and the service we received we will not be returning. I thought returning guests deserved better treatment

When we arrived we were informed that we had been upgraded to a partially Oceanview room.the checking was very quick. Staff were very professional very friendly very informative of the facilities within the hotel and surrounding area. Our room was very spacious well equipped. We had a great view from the ocean from our balcony. Unfortunately the balcony has no outside seating as it's very narrow so really didn't get to appreciate that view unless you stood there for a long time. The hotel is going. Through renovations at the moment. The hotel inform you days and events if any of the upgrades are to effect with notices in the left and around the hotel. The security is very good you need your room key to swipe in to get to the left or anything external doors leading out to the laundry or to the car park. The hotel is only two blocks away from the beach great location for families and people that just want to relax on the beach. There is also a rooftop pool small but ideal for those who really don't like the beach which is only two blocks away. There are lots of restaurants and bars a short walk from the hotel. The hotel has one restaurants and cafe within the grounds which cater for the Japanese tourist or anybody that likes Japanese food

Firstly, I like to say something positive about the facility. The location is really great within an easy 2 to 3-minute walk of the Waikiki Beach. There are lots of things to do with easy reach of the hotel. Ok that's enough... The hotel condo rooms are really showing their age with very average furnishings, poor air conditioning (had to buy a small fan from Walmart just to circulate the air in the room). Bathroom was really average and dirty with poor quality and partially working faucets. The hotel was also found with 'questionable' residents as we found some of them handcuffed and being taken out of the hotel elevator by the local cops. And just to completely stuff up our stay at the hotel, our rental car was towed away, even though we had purchased a 2-hour parking ticket that was placed on our dash. Despite paying the $10 parking fee and despite the car being parked within the allowable time period, the car was towed away because the scamming tow company personnel said they couldn't see the parking ticket so they towed my vehicle. It cost me $35 in a taxi fare to go and collect my car, plus $227 (in cash - only) for the towing and storage fees. When I got to the tow company, I opened the car and found the parking ticket on my seat (obviously moved during the tow). When I showed them that I had a legitimate parking ticket, they didn't give a stuff and just said that their representative couldn't see the ticket so the car was towed. This is absolutely bull#$%! and I was so disappointed because I had to pay the $227 to get my car released from their impound. This has never happened to me anywhere else in the world during the many years of international business and leisure travel. So a small warning: if you want to stay in a really average hotel and if you intend on hiring a car and having it towed away for no reason whatsoever, then come-along and stay at the Aqua Pacific Monarch Hotel.You'll be glad you did!!!Alternatively, find some where better to stay, because as long as people stay here and put up with this sort of crap, then nothing will change. Only when there are no residents coming to the hotel and no one parking their cars in the hotel car park, will cause the hotel management do something to fix these issues.

Rooms are too small for a family of four. Rooms were not cleaned properly. Rubbish wasn't removed each day. Bathroom were not cleaned properly. Beds were extremely uncomfortable. Pool was being repaired at the time. Air conditioner was extremely noisy!!

I was convinced by others saying that it was a very good hotel, but upon arriving I was very dissappointed in my stay. The air conditioning is so tiny, tucked away in one corner of the living room, the bedrooms had no air conditioning nor a tv. The swimming pool on the roof top is still unavailable to use since its rennovations. The shower tub is all cracked, the hallway carpets look worn out and dirty. The bath towels had stained marks. Above all they charge US$18 per night for aminities when we hardly use any of them. Hotel shares a public parking which cost $30 per night. So far all I found pleasing was the location, apart from that I am not totally satisfied in my stay. Got to look at other hotels next time.

I'd normally opt for a house on a quiet beach over this kind of setting, but my kids were game for a change of pace and wanted to surf Waikiki. We got a great deal and split up into two city view rooms. You could peer around for a glimpse of ocean, but mostly we were looking out on the time warp that is Waikiki... which was actually kind of cool. Brady Bunch and Elvis came to mind. Rooms were fine. Beds pretty comfortable. Small kitchenette and giant sliding doors that made the room feel larger. Each room had a pull-out sofa and plenty of space as hotel rooms go. We had two rooms separated by the elevator bank. Initially, I was worried about the noise, but there was not issue. One the 8th floor there was some street noise, but I didn't find it disruptive.The location is ideal. A block from Waikiki beach. There's a surf shop on the next corner where my son rented boards every day. The surfers were right in front of where we entered the beach, as were some hula shows. Shops and restaurants are all around and steps away. I liked that we were nestled in a corner of old school Waikiki, but a block or so away from high end shops and restaurants.Two setbacks for us were the $30/day parking and the fact that the rooftop pool was under construction. I had been repeatedly reassured when I made the reservation that the construction would be finished by the time I arrived and that was not the case. They did give us passes to a neighboring pool, but we had been looking forward to watching the fireworks from up there. Staff was courteous, but there's some room to grow in the customer service arena. I get the impression that they're on the defensive and may regularly deal with "issues" that come up.In all, we were happy with our stay.

We were in vacation at this property in June 2017.At the beginning we hesitate to book this hotel because of the renovations, but that turned out that didn't bothered us. We booked a standard room but we got a partial ocean view because this part was in renovation so that was a nice upgrade, we could see the beach area from 6th floor which is the first occupied floor after the parking area, so you can't get a room lower than 6th floor.. For sure higher the room better the view.The room was equipped with a full kitchen, all you need to cook, stove, microwave, dishes, coffe maker, slow cooker. We had a suite with a nice bathroom and balcony around the suite. Rooms were serviced daily, fresh towels, toiletries and cleaned up.Rooms have a noisy old style AC, fridge, safe, TV, playstation and you can borrow games to play if that is what you want to do in vacation. The swimming pool from top floor was closed due to renovations but we got a pass to use the neighbour's pool. The parking below the hotel is a public parking and costs $30 per day. Hotel is in a very good location, 2 blocks away from beach, close to a lot of ABC stores, restaurants, zoo, and aquarium. The staff was not that friendly some how indifferent. They have a shuttle service between Ala Moana mall and hotel but is not so useful, because its unpredictable we lost an hour waiting for this service asking front desk every 10 minutes when is the shuttle gonna be here. So in this time we could reach there walking. There are few local buses that have stops close by and cost $2.50 and are more reliable.

I and 2 friend stayed in room 1006 for 10 nights in July 2017. We had a one bedroom flat. The bedroom had 2 single beds and a couch that pulled out to a queen size bed.Our room included a small kitchenette with a full size stove and refrigerator. There was also a microwave. The kitchenette was fully stocked with cutlery and utensils. We were very pleased to be able to make our own breakfasts and the occasional dinner.Whilst the hotel is not new it is well equipped, the staff are very friendly and helpful. The room was very well cleaned each day with the linen on the single beds being changed every 3 days, however the linen on the pull out bed was not changed at all during our stay, This may be because the person using this bed made it herself each day and folded the bed away.The bathroom is small but neat and tidy. There is a guest laundry on level 3 and a roof top pool, which was unavailable during our stay (it was being refurbished) but the hotel next door allowed use of its pool to us.This hotel is 1 block back from the main beach, 2 blocks from The Food Pantry (for groceries) and close to everything.I highly recommend this hotel. I would be more than happy to stay here again.

We had a short 3 might stay in Waikiki and chose this hotel for the price and location. There were 8 of is in 3 different rooms. Our room was an ocean view room with a queen size bed in a separate room. The View from the 14th floor was outstanding. Condo style room with full kitchen. Clean comfortable and killer view. Two blocks from the middle of Waikiki beach. Parking at this hotel is run by an independent company with many bad review and comments. We asked at the front desk and they recommended we park at their sister property two blocks down the street at the Waikiki Banyan. The pool area was under construction but we were given passes to use the pool at the hotel next door. They have movies and videos games available for use as well. The staff and management were all outstanding and very welcoming! We would definitely stay here again.

Booked with friends for a holiday unfortunately the main reason for choosing this hotel was the rooftop pool about 6 weeks from our due date to leave we received notification they had closed the pool for renovation. Our wonderful friends decided to change hotels ,we made the decision to stay all i can say is wow they upgraded us to a penthouse we are so grateful as for the pool it was no drama all you do is walk out of the door turn right walk two blocks and there is the most beautiful ocean i have seen .dont forget to visit the abc stores for all your supplies also the resort is self catering .If we ever return to Hawaii ...hopefully i will stay again i give this hotel 10 /10 many kind thanks Aqua Pacific Monarch

We were there for a convention/family vacation. We stayed at the Ambassador Hotel for a night and then last minute decided to move to a much better option because the Ambassador was not good at all. Rooms here were clean, comfortable, full kitchen with coffee/tea. One block away from Waikiki beach, many restaurants, street food, ABC stores, etc. Two blocks away there is a boulevard where you can park for free but spots are very hard to find. The cost for parking at the hotel is outrageous... $30US per night!!!! Crazy expensive. Overall, great hotel.

This resort is a fantastic location for couples or families. It is one of the closest to the beach with a separate bedroom. This hotel was located in the heart of Waikiki Beach only two blocks back from the beach. The unit was a good size possessing a lounge room (with sofa lounge), bedroom, fully equipped kitchen and a great view. The hotel has a great pool and spa on the roof (40 something floor) and a large lounge area on the floor below the pool area. The hotel is also strict on security which is comforting. All the staff were friendly and willing to assist and any manner possible. The resort was one block from our Pearl Harbor tour 'pickup'. Wifi, newspapers are included in the resort fee.We would all be very happy to return to this resort!

Excellent hotel for the price with the few negatives far outweighed by the positives. Spacious condo 1 bedroom with full kitchen. Light and airy. Pool not open due to work. Could swim next door but very small pool. Beach only 2 blocks away though. Air conditioner could not keep the condo below about 80 even though running all the time.Clean, very helpful staff. Towels provided for beach or pool. Excellent location. Bus stop across the street. 2 blocks from Duke Statue so in the real center of Waikiki.

This hotel is located near the beach and for the price, it's value for money. The rooms are well maintained but certain rooms facing the setting sun will make the room hot despite the aircondition switched on.The one setback for this hotel is actually the friendlies of the front desk. The people of Hawaii are very friendly but the front desk staffs of this hotel seems unhappy with what they are doing. Apart from one big sized staff, the rest makes you feel that approaching them seems bothersome.

The good thing is we're 2 blocks from the ocean but I would rather stay a few more blocks away for a better room. In the first room we were put in the Sofa bed was broken so we had to move. In the 2nd room the A/C was broken so we froze because it was stuck at 60 Degrees for 3 days before they could replace it. The shower was outdated 20 years ago, bathroom super small no counter space. No shower liner. No TV in bedroom! WTF? Chairs in kitchen so hard and uncomfortable. Very outdated decor. The pictures on their website look way better than it is. Yes you can watch a DVD on a PlayStation but no Netflix or HBO. Can't see yourself in the mirror because there are only small mirrors- it would be easy to hang a full length mirror! If you are a college kid then this would work but for a family- no thank you!

Arrived this condo mid-afternoon, Monday July 3, 2017. When we checked in we were told by the man at the counter. we were not one of their guests and our contact Mary would arrive soon to show us to our condo. After a solid half hour wait, a woman arrived and said Mary would not be coming, gave us an envelope and said our pool and hot tub are closed, we don't have an ETA, you can guest pass for the Aqua Bamboo next door and use their pool. We took our envelope, got on the elevator and went up to the27th floor. When we opened the door the room was so hot from the heat coming through the windows, it felt as if the heat had been left on. We quickly closed the black out drapes in both units and looked for the control to turn on the A/C. It only took a moment to discover that the advertised A/C is are 2 small window units, one in each condo that sits on the floor in the corner and is vented through the outside. There ceiling fans in the main living area and each bedroom, but the small size A/C units can barely keep up with the heat so the bedrooms, never cool down. The Queen size beds are soft and you roll to the center of them. The 2 couches make into beds and they too are heavily used, you feel the bar and springs while laying on them. They do supply 2 double air mattresses that we discovered. We folded up the sofa beds and used the air mattresses.The unit was not really clean when we arrived. There was not enough drinking cups in either unit to accommodate our group of 7, so we went to the Food Pantry and purchased cups. There are several spots in the condo that have patches on the walls. and 2703 has a hole in the wall. There is also a magnetic bottle opener on the fridge that you can clearly see has poked several holes in the wall when the door to the fridge is opened. I took photos of the damage as I did not want to be accused of doing it. The bathroom is tiny and hot.The view is amazing from 27 floors up, but you are a short walk to the beach, and the area can get a bit sketchy after dark.This was not an easy booking, I had originally booked with Sarah McClendon who transferred it to Mary McClaflin. It took several phone calls. emails etc. to get a confirmation of final payment. After several weeks of attempts to contact, her daughter sent me an email that said, we got your check. THIS is what I used to check in. Never did see or speak to Mary. We stayed 1 night of a 4 night stay! Would not stay or recommend these units to anyone.Would stay through the Monarch Hotel but would NEVER book either of these units again.

Traveled 5th June - 12th June 2017. Arrived at the hotel at 0700 and wasn't expecting our room to be ready so early - but it was! Blown away, was very grateful after a long trip from Australia with a longish layover. One small hiccup was that we booked 2 singles beds, and a sofa, as was travelling as a party of 3 with my 2 sons. For some reason they had booked us a queen size instead of the singles, but the issue was quickly sorted - so best confirm before you arrive. The location of the hotel was great, we were on the 26th floor, great views of the hills and ocean, our balcony was constantly windy, so we didn't really sit out there, but was good to have the sliding door open for the fresh air. Beds comfortable, maid service very good - clean fluffy towels daily, beds made, toiletries replaced, Air con did not work very well, but with the breeze, wasn't an issue for us. Helpful friendly reception staff, free shuttle handy, public bus stop across the road - $2.50 to Pearl Harbour. We preferred The Food Pantry just down the road over the touristy ABC stores. We liked having the little kitchen in our room as was good to have a full size fridge, and my boys (17 & 22) liked having a lazy breakfast before we ventured out. The pool wasn't open when we were there, due to maintenance, but not an issue, as used the beach & we could of used next doors pool if we wanted. I would return to the Aqua Pacific Monarch, it is not 5 star, but is clean, comfortable and well priced for what you get. Enjoy!

We have just had our second stay at the pacific monarch. When we initially checked in we were in a very dated apartment with two single beds- which my husbands feet hung off the end of. A quick call to reception and Daniel arranged for us to he moved to an apartment with a queen bed on a similar level the following day, which we were much happier in. There are works going on but we were never inconvenienced by these and the pool is closed until the end of July- you have access to the pool at the aqua resort next door- but why would you use the pool when you are a block from the beach??!! We had a great afternoon meeting staff and other guests at the managers reception. We will definitely stay again on our next visit (but know now to specify our bedding requirements).

This hotel is one block away from Waikiki beach. The rooms are nice and have a functional kitchen. We had a partial ocean view room and although you could see the ocean from the balcony, it was less than what I would have thought. The parking is extra and is owned by a seperate company.

Just got home from 6 nights in Waikiki for our honeymoon. We chose one specifically with a nice pool and a kitchenette to cook most of our own meals, and found the room very equipped and the grocery only a block away. The room was very spacious, the bed is sooooo comfy and the lanai is amazing. We had a corner room and could see the city one direction, the ocean the other. We spent a lot of time on the lanai! The location is excellent at just a block from the beach and shops and food close by, and a farmers market just a block away 3x a week. Its fairly quiet on the 29th floor- loved leaving the door to the lanai open at bedtime and waking to hearing the birds chirping and waves on the beach. The building itself was clean and the room was to, except for the floors. The floor tile and grouting in the room needed a serious cleaning....Other negatives- $18/day for "resort fee" which is for such amenities as a closed pool (that was never mentioned until check-in! Given a "pass" to a hotel next door, but the pool/hot tub there wasn't large enough to even accommodate that hotel besides ours also) laundry room that is $3 a load (why not free, since its listed an "amenity" you are already paying for?), a newspaper to a place I don't live, towels for a pool they don't have, a shuttle service that when you ask to use it you and encouraged to instead pay $2.50/person to ride the bus, tap water with lemons and paper cups in the lobby (not everyone LIKES lemon in the water) and free movies (who comes to Hawaii to sit in their room and watch movies?) plus wi-fi....I could have bought a LOT of extra data that I could have used beyond the hotel for the $114 in resort fees for nothing I could use. There is a very nice large room on the roof that has furniture/TV and sink that would a great place for friends to meet on a rainy day and hang out. I loved the room, except for the floors needing cleaned, and loved the hotel except for paying resort fees for things that are not usable or accessible. Not cool at all to not let people know the pool will be closed until check-in!

Returned to Aqua Pacific Monarch , stayed in one bedroom ocean view suite.Great location , short stroll to Waikiki Beach and shopsService was excellent , but we didn't need helpThe hotel provides a regular free shuttle to the Ala Moana shopping centre , which you can use for shopping or a stopping point before walking to the Neal S Blaisdell Centre or the Honolulu Museum of Art.close by is The Food Pantry for grocery shopping , and on certain afternoons there is a farmers market at Kings Village which is also closeOn this trip the hotel was undergoing renovations and the rooftop pool was closed , we were not inconvenienced by the work and were able to use the next door sister hotels poolOverall we had a great stay and will return

A very well worn in accomodation place. Yes it's old, however they say their doing it up.Our room was hot and air condition was useless, hard to sleep at night luckily there was a fan in the bedroom. Bed was hard but somewhat comfortable.Good size bathroom and having a kitchen was a bonus. Wifi was good and strong.The staff here are very friendly and helpful. Sadly they allow the homeless to sleep on their lounges down stairs which I found quite disturbing

We stayed for 4 nights at The Aqua Pacific Monarch June 14-18th.Positives about the place are - Check in staff on first day were friendly and did let us check in a bit early (at 13.30 as our room was ready). Good location - just a stones throw from Waikiki beach, many good restaurants nearby. Also great cheap cafe bar onsite.The room was large with Sofa, dining table, wardrobe, kitchenette with microwave, hob and fridge. The kitchen was well equipped for a small studio with toaster, kettle, cutlery and crockery. So easy to do self catering if you want. The shower in the bathroom was strong with plentiful hot water. Clean - the room was cleaned daily. Towels were changed daily and toiletries topped up. Cleaning staff were good and very polite and friendly.Beach towels available for free hire.Lovely free little welcome drink do with snacks on the Wednesday (every Wednesday) at 4.30 pm.Great value for the area for what you get, (but by no means holiday luxury!)Negatives - Some staff at front desk not overly friendly. Only 3 lifts so sometimes you wait a bit, but never more than a few minutes. Room decor - looks like it hasn't been updated since the 70s. Aircon - tucked in the corner by the sofa so not hugely efficient. Balcony - OMG!! Please do not go on the balcony if you've had a drink, or rent this room if you have kids. Very dangerous. The parking is expensive and nowhere else to park nearby. 30 USD a day.Traffic noise - lots of noise from about 6 am onwards. We were on 16th floor.THE WORST..... we were not told anything about building works. These have been ongoing since April and are scheduled till August. I booked only a week before arrival. My main reason for booking the hotel was the rooftop pool and hot tub! All of which CLOSED. We were only told this upon check in. You do get a pass to use a sister hotel's pool, we didn't bother as people we spoke to said it was small and ground level. Really disappointed! There are builders scaling the outside of the building too so beware if you book a room with a view. We met a couple who couldn't go on their balcony and had specifically paid extra for their room. They said there was lots of building rubbish on their balcony and part way through their stay a sign was put up saying not to go on it. No warning whatsoever.So that's my review. I reckon at the price most of the positives outweigh the negatives if you are on a budget, but check the pool is open before you book.Waikiki itself we were disappointed in. It was a bit like Benidorm. Lots of high rise buildings and very commercial, busy traffic. We didn't find people overly friendly. I'd probably stay somewhere Kailua if I'd researched better.A good tip. We missed the fireworks on Friday due to our position on the beach. You must go right along to the far end way past the outrigger. So I reckon the tips saying aim for the beach cafe are spot on. I read on one site you could see the fireworks if your toes were in the sand - absolute rubbish! You can hear them though.

This hotel is a little aged..... no lavish foyer, but our room was huge. It had a kitchenette, well equipped and every thing was working and clean! The air conditioner is fitted in the window and was rattling so had to turn off at night ( efficient for daytime use) but the ceiling fan was sufficient to keep it comfortable at night. I don't think that it is sound proofed like modern hotels, we were disturbed by garbage trucks etc in early hours. It's location is ideal , just one block back from the Duke on Waikiki beach. It is reasonably priced. I recommend this hotel for its convenient location , friendly, obliging staff, and the ability to self cater. I will also ask to be not next to the lift, they were a little disturbing but not overbearing!

We actually found the Pacific Monarch on Trip advisor, 6 years ago! My husband had just retired, & we were looking for a place, close to the beach, in the Waikiki area. We love Hawaii & had been visiting over the last several years, but only to stay 2 weeks at a time! Now, we were able to spend 6 weeks in beautiful Hawaii! We got a 1 bedroom, small kitchen, partial ocean view room at the Pacific Monarch! It was perfect for us! It is in a great location, 2 blocks from Waikiki beach, several restaurants & shopping all around! We walk everywhere we can! When we go out to the Ala Moana Shopping Center, a must see, we get on The Bus right across the street! So convenient! We can't say enough about the staff either! We love them all! From the front desk, to housekeeping, & Maintenance, they have become our Ohana (family)! We miss them all! Danny, Daniel, Keiko, Cheryl,& Erica at the front desk! Whatever we need, they will make sure we are taken care of! Always a greeting of "Aloha" every day! This coming Feb., will be the 7th year we are returning to the Pacific Monarch! We always make our reservations for the next year, before we return to MN! Whatever type of room you are looking for, they have it, whether you are staying 1 week, or many weeks! Also, a great pool area on the roof, with awesome views of the ocean & the area! We can't wait to get back there in Feb. 2018!

We up graded to a one bed apartment as we did not want the workman to have access to our room as they are working on the balconies. It was nice and roomy and had a large deck also all the amenities you could ask for the bed was comfy the pillows are all very bumpy , which was a little weird and the only other thing that was a let down was the couch in the lounge area was almost unbearable it was so uncomfortable. The service at the hotel is great the lemon water in lobby was a lovely touch and well used ! Staff are very friendly.

Staff is nice and helpful to the minimal extent. Pool area is not worth anyone's time. Skip it. However, e ended up with a room on the 28th(?) floor and the indoor outdoor room design made a GREAT addition to our trip. Stay here but request a high floor.

We used Waikiki as a rest break after six weeks travelling mainland USA. When we first arrived at this hotel we were a little doubtful about how it might shape up.First impressions of the room gave us the feeling that it was rather tired and needed an upgrade.One of the swipe keys didn’t work and this was a continual annoyance throughout our four-night stay.This hotel is very well located to all amenities. We were on the 9th floor and had a one bedroom apartment style room.Our agent had booked a king bed but the bed was only a queen size, but still very comfortable. We had a little balcony access from the bedroom as well as a larger area with a great breakfast table and chairs from the lounge, which was ideal. The view wasn’t all that spectacular as we looked to the apartments in the next building and down onto Kuhio Avenue. The kitchen and lounge area was quite roomy with a very good tv and free wifi.The staff were very friendly and the service was excellent. They have an arrangement with a daily free shuttle service operating every half hour or so to take you around the city, and drop you off wherever you wished, and picked you up from the drop off point back to the hotel. That is a great service.The apartment had a microwave, kettle, coffee machine, large full-size fridge, and ample cutlery with plates and saucers. Coffee, sugar or creamer were always on hand.One thing that we really liked was the Paya brand soaps and shampoos. We tracked down the manufacturer and had some imported back to Australia. So refreshing and smelt like the islands.It’s just one block off the main beach and a little older than the flashier establishments, but we would recommend to anyone.When we hit mainland USA next year, on the way back we’ll book the Aqua Monarch Pacific again and ask for a room higher up, facing the beach.

My travel agent explained that essential maintenance work was being conducted, but as this was only during working hours, when one should be exploring, and sightseeing, I saw no problems (and there were no problems) I do get annoyed when I hear people complain that the sheets were only 1000 thread count and not 1500. A room should be properly temperature controlled, decent amenities, and bug free, clean bedding. In my opinion, the APM vastly exceeds the above, for reasonable pricing and its just two blocks from the beach. Along with top reception staff, made a great stay. :)

I loved the location of this hotel as it was in walking distance to everything and the staff were super friendly and helpful, especially the cleaning staff. The room was perfect for us with the air conditioner, kitchen, wifi and tv. Would stay here again when I go back to Hawaii.

Our first impression was bad as the bell desk people had no interest in helping us when we arrived. No smile, an annoyed look at the baggage we brought & no help whatsoever. However Dan at the front desk was fantastic! He took his time and was very helpful. He was very friendly and accommodating. He assigned us a fantastic room and was very genuine throughout our entire stay. Thank you for helping us make our trip to Hawaii memorable. Exceptional location, service and value. I would not hesitate to recommend the Pacific Monarch for your stay in Waikiki.

We stayed a total of 9 nights here at Pacific Monarch between May and June 2017 We originally booked a studio partial ocean view, but because we booked directly with the hotel we got a free room upgrade to a 1 bedroom ocean view room. Whilst I appreciate that we were given a bigger room with a better view, it was disappointing that we couldn’t actually have our blinds open for most of the day as the hotel is having construction done to it, and as a result work men are constantly moving up and down outside your room. We were warned about this at check in however it was not disclosed at the time of booking, which would have made us consider changing hotels. It was annoying to know that you had paid a lot of money to stay in a better room with a view…but couldn’t enjoy it without giving up your privacy. The kitchen was great! Allowed us to save some money by having some of our meals in the room. Bed was a bit too hard for our liking but the rest of the room, and bathroom was really good. As part of the USD18 a day resort fee, you get use of the free shuttle bus that runs between the Aqua hotels to Ala Moana, which was extremely handy, as the shuttle arrives every 30 minutes. In addition to the shuttle service, the hotel gives you a movie rental card which allows you to rent some movies and PS3 games from the roof top. This was a really unexpected and enjoyable aspect of our stay. Because my partner was sick with the flu for 2 days it gave him some entertainment.Even though we were on the 13th floor (room 1302) next time I will be requesting a room on a higher level as you cannot sleep with your windows open at night because of the amount of nice coming from the street level. This was annoying because the aircon does not work very well, and I would strongly suggest that the hotel look at upgrading them. I would stay at this hotel again but would double check first to see if any construction was going on first. I would also strongly insist on having a room on the higher floors.

This is a get more than you pay for hotelFront desk very helpful Rooms cleaned daily Nothing to worry about just enjoy your hoidayWe are back there in septemberBus stops outside front door Short walk to beach and cafes

We stayed 2 adults, and 1 teenager at this hotel for a week during Christmas 2016. Very nice and helpful people at the service desk.Nice and clean room on 14th floor. We booked appartment with extra bedroom at a price of around 250,- USD per night. Well equipped kitchen. Nice terrasse with small view to Waikiki Beach, where the surfers started out every morning at 7.00 o'clock :-).Several ABC shops in the vicinity, where we bought food etc.Nice spa and swimmingpool on the roof of the hotel.We can warmly recommend this hotel.

We were upgraded from a studio to a one bedroom (but without the partial ocean view) which gave us more space and big balcony. The housekeeping was excellent and all the staff were very helpful. The kitchenette was fully equipped and the bed was comfortable with a quiet fan in bedroom. We found the area quite noisy being on a main road (no double glazing) but that would be normal for Waikiki. We only used the shuttle once and found The Bus (right outside) was the best choice going to many areas and only $2.50 a ride (the ticket could also be used a second time on the same day for no extra charge). Good Wifi. Pool area pleasant with great view (being upgraded).
user_name:
Robyn B
Auckland Central, New Zealand

review_body: Waikiki Beach is 2 blocks away from the hotel. We were on the 13 floor with partial view of the beach area.The room came with a patio with table and 4 chairs. There was always a breeze.The suite consisted of dining area, kitchen, with full size fridge, separate bedroom, with access to the patio and of course a bath room with combo tub & shower.The room was neat and clean, maid service was good also. We had a defective smoke alarm which was corrected immediately by maintenace.Restaurants and shopping district are within walking distance.The hotel offers a free shuttle to the Ana Moana shopping center. It is supposed to be the largest outdoor shopping mall in the world.Staff was very helpful in helping us use the public transportation system to get around on Oahu.

Location was great. Fire evacuation systems need to be adhered.Staff were pretty goodRooms were outdated and a bit cluttered with dust collectors. If rooms were de-cluttered would make a big difference.

This was my fifth time staying in Waikiki. Each time has been a different hotel. This one was by far the best experience and as a bonus was easily the most inexpensive. I stayed here for 8 nights. I arrived at 11am on a Saturday. The lady at the front desk greeted me and told me she'll check me straight in( hasn't happened to me in Hawaii before). I was on the 15th floor. When I saw the elevator and hallway they were a bit run down so I thought uh oh but that was as bad as it got(which isn't even bad). Everything else was really great. The room itself had a very good kitchenette which included a microwave, coffee machine, bar fridge and all the bowls/plates/cutlery and glasses etc you need. There was a two person couch, dining table and a tav that had so many channels I couldn't even count them. The wifi was nice and fast and never droppped out. The bed was huge and so comfortable. The room was very spacious and opened out and the view had quite a good view of the ocean (remember I'm only halfway up the hotel)The pool area on the rooftop is a must. The views from up there are amazing. It's just a shame there is one hotel that blocks the sun from the sunset or it would be the most perfect view. There was a bus stop right across the street Waikiki beach is about a block away( it took me about a minute to get there) and they have a free shuttle to ala Moana. The staff were always very helpful on the front desk and the housekeeping staff were always friendly and very thankful. I would/will definitely stay here again

large spacious 1 bedroom with kitchenette and balcony safe and secure place with friendly staff. thanks for the experience. we walked everywhere from here. family of 4 with one in a wheelchair the extra room was well appreciated

We chose this hotel based on recommendation and because it had self catering facilities.Pros- close to beach and amenities- supermarket bus etcFriendly staffRoof top pool where you can get a view of the fireworks on Friday evenings at 7.45Clean Small and personal wi fiDVD hireIncluded in a reasonable resort fee.Kitchen was well resourced Cons- minor glitches with the room key system. Air conditioner is small but we used Hawaiian AC open windows and allow the trade winds to do their job.It can be quite noisy with street noise though even on the 30th floor. This is an older hotel and not top shelf but we had a wonderful 8 night stay in a corner room one bedroom apartment with views to both mountains and ocean.We will definitely book again if we return. Mahalo. Ps the welcome drinks on Wednesday was very pleasant and appreciated.

We've just come back from 2 weeks in Hawaii. We spent our 2nd week at Aqua Pacific Monarch. Whilst some areas need a bit of a refresh (pool area and a couple of chairs in the room needing some screws tightened), our room was great. The queen bed was so comfortable and even the queen sofa bed was ok. The reception staff of Erica, Cherly and Danny were fabulous with no request too much trouble from restaurant suggestions to printing out emails for us. Location is great being centrally located. Loved the view from the roof. Would definitely stay there again.

New South Wales, Australia

review_body: We were upgraded from a studio to a one bedroom suite, which was spacious, well equipped and comfortable, with a large sunny balcony. We had a clear view of the ocean a few hundred metres/yards away. The furniture was dated, but excellent quality. The bed was very comfortable, with a new mattress. The Korean restaurant across the street has cheap, but delicious omelettes. Great value.

We certainly enjoyed the location of this hotel being a block from beach with super beautiful views if you get a room with mountain and ocean view, just paradise.Hotel staff friendly and room was comfortable. Hotel is older but well maintained. Great value. Restaurants and shopping close by. Definitely would stay again!

We stayed at this hotel for four nights. The best about the hotel is the location - it is just one block from Waikiki beach, there are a lot of shops and ABC stores around the hotel. We booked the room some months in advance through the hotel website and I specifically asked for a room with one queen size bed as we were celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. We arrived at about 3pm and were told that the only room they could give us has two single beds. There was no chance to get a different room. We got a room with a queen size bed the next morning. The room was clean, the bathroom was rather small. There is a pool on the rooftop and you get beach towels at the front desk. You can park the car in a car park next to the hotel.

I am currently staying here. So far my trip has been less then pleasant. I rent 100-200 nights a year and have for 8 years. I am currently on starting the Keto Diet. I searched by kitchenettes and found them reasonably priced. So I called an asked the price for booking and if they had a grill. Yes to parking ($30) and yes to Grill. Upon arrival, I check in and after payment when I asked about the parking I get a long speech about how it isn't theirs, they are really strict, if you run your card twice it charges twice, it is in their building but nothing to do with them. Fine, I will go find street parking. Then I am informed it is only twin beds. I didn't request this nor have I been anywhere that even used twins instead of full size in years. Fine. I said, well I don't know if I want to sleep in a twin bed, I might make other accommodations. That's when they really pissed me off. The desk agent jumped and said, "Well these are non refundable reservations". 1) not true 2) It is Expedia you can release my funds 3) I am a Gold status member. They have refunded or eaten the cost at every hotel I have had to cancel for 8 years. If my flight is canceled due to weather and you refuse to release my FRESH reservation, they still refund me.I decide to check out the room. The sad part is, the room and amenities are really nice. So I decide to give it a shot. I go and get all my groceries and luggage in and go for a walk. I come back ready for dinner and go to the front desk to ask where the grill is. Then I informed that there is no grill. I explained I had been told there was when I called ahead before booking. The response was, where did you call? I said I called the front building location and pressed one for reservations. I am then told that is not the right desk. None of my interaction would I remotely describe as hospitable. I am here on work not vacation. I don't care about Waikiki I am here all the time. I care about being away from home, paying a $150 a night to be made to feel like it is entrapment. To be snapped at that it is non-refundable as soon as I utter that I might not be satisfied with the reservation. A reasonable response would of been...A smile, and I understand, we can certainly notify you if another room comes available. Unbelievable. I hope the management monitors the reviews. I will be leaving the same review elsewhere.
