Devin N
Denver, Colorado, United States

review_body: It's good place with family. And not to far to go the beach. Everything had what you need. We had in maybe 11 floors it's so much amazing you can see all hotels and see the ocean. Now when I want to go there I see it's so expensive for a week.

The staff at the Pacific Monarch were fabulous. Friendly, helpful and always cheery. However, the hotel is pretty dated as far as technology goes. The keycards only worked 50% of the time and I wasn't the only one that had to go to the front desk on numerous occasions to get the room keys re-keyed.Also, the AC in the room was pitiful. We had 3 people in one room and the only cool air to be found was if you stood directly in front of the AC, which was tucked away behind one of the beds and low to the ground. Believe me, we were sweating plenty sitting around the room.Other than that, the stay was great. Oh, and their free wifi was impressively fast!

Only two short blocks from the beach, the Aqua Pacific Monarch hotel offers easy access by car or on foot. Spacious rooms and a rooftop pool & hot tub on the 33rd floor, the views from the rooftop & most rooms is spectacular.We were warmly greeted on arrival and assisted in every possible way. The absence of a hotel-associates restaurant was a minor concern.Overall, good value for your money.

Perfect, budget friendly, clean, nothing fancy but all you need, would book again, close to everything, safe, very efficient, balcony with view, nice pool, had breakfast in room, two stove eyes, microwave, coffee maker, fridge, save money on snacks and breakfast

Just what we wanted,kitchenette,sofa couch for kids,just a block from the beach and shops,great location, free shuttle to Ala Moana.Helpful staff, rooms were clean.Gorgeous views from rooftop pool Would stay again

Location is perfect, 1 block to the beach ( Duke Statue) supermarket 1 blockreception staff were awesome and super helpful nothing was too much to askRoom 3207 had a perfect partial view of the beach with a great size balcony.This room has a full kitchen with oven, stove top and microwaveSep bedroom that has a door to the balcony

We stayed at the hotel in the beginning of March. When we booked the hotel, we requested to get a room higher up and we got a room on the 29th floor so it was nice and the view was great. The location of the hotel is good, just a couple of blocks from the beach, the closest ABC store was just one block away. We used the local bus and the bus stop is just outside of the hotel on the other side of the street. We had a room with a kitchenette. The kitchen had everything we could need; there were pots and pans, cutlery, glasses, plates, coffeemaker and even a rice cooker. The room was bigger than we expected and it was very clean. The housekeeping staff came by every day, if we were at our room, they asked if we needed the room cleaned or if we needed new towels, coffee or anything. The staff at the hotel was very nice and helpful. We were warmly welcomed when we arrived. The hotel has complimentary shuttle service to Ala Moana shopping center, you get beach towels from the hotel and they provide complimentary movie rentals. On the roof of the hotel is a swimming pool with chairs for sun bathing. The pool area was clean and nice, note that there is no staff or lifeguards at the pool area. There was a safe in the room, which I find very good.

We stayed at this hotel from Feb. 21 to Mar. 7, this hotel was very clean and very friendly staff, everything was just great, our room was on the 8 floor with a partial ocean view, and the view at night was incredible, i would stay here again but would request to be up on a higher level just because of the street noise. Loved every minute of our stay in Waikiki,

My first trip to Hawaii with my wife who had been there many years ago, and she thought that I would like this place. Before I tell you about my overall experience let me tell you about this hotel. This hotel is very well located to all amenities. We were on the 22nd floor (apartment style hotel) in a one double bedroom apartment, very comfortable with a balcony access from the bedroom as well as the lounge. The view was spectacular looking at Waikiki beach with the waves rolling in, and the surfers waiting to catch the waves. The overall view from the balcony was just great.The staff were very friendly and the service was excellent. The Aqua Pacific Monarch had a daily free shuttle service operating every half hour or so to take you around the city, and drop you off wherever you wished, and picked you up from the drop off point back to the hotel. The apartment had a microwave, kettle, coffee making gadget, fridge, and cutlery with plates and saucers and the usual stuff that one would have at home. They did not stint on the coffee, sugar or crema.Yes, this is a hotel I would recommend to anyone.

It was an easy stay and quite comfortable beds. Could've had a fridge that worked and had marks all over the bed. Also found some property that wasn't ours which obviously wasn't cleaned out from the last people. Nice staff.

Heard this place got an upgrade. Stayed here a while back and it did get that upgrade. Pros:Beach,shopping, food pantry, ABC stores are all in walking distance of the hotel which is a plus.Housekeeping are really nice. They even ask you if you need anything before you even ask : )Maintenance guys are on it.Front desk people are so welcoming.We didnt park at this properties lot due to the high volume of negative comments. So we parked next door at Aqua Bamboo. Hassle freeCons:1 bedroom needs to upgrade to central AC instead of the cheapo CityMill brand AC units. Instead use the Resort fee money to get central ACs. Just saying... The AC only blows in the living room and not in the room. Room only has a ceiling fan. (Bearable at night but during the day while the suns coming up is like a sauna)Stairs leaving to the pool area smells so musky They need to gut all that nasty carpet out ASAP. Coming out the elevator again an old musky smell.Upon checking out. Lady at the front desk who shall remain nameless but is a Supervisor OK that everything was good to go. She had asked about our pool towels. We mentioned ALL 3 was back in our room. She hands back the key card and ask to go back up stairs and bring down the towels. Hahaha what a joke as if were gonna steal these towels. As a supervisor (lady ) its rude on your part. You should know better! Next time state it on your flyers that you hand out to your guest at arrival about bringing down used towels hahaha

The hotel sits 2 blocks from the beach, and is central to everything we were looking for. There was a young man who worked the desk (I didn't get his name but he was FANTASTIC!) introduced me to Uber, and Aloha2go.com. Nice quiet place, we had room 2901 and loved our room. there is a pool and Jacuzzi on the roof perfect for watching sunsets, and we never had to walk more than 2 blocks to get a pickup for a tour. and of course, we were surrounded by ABC stores lol. see the pics.

Only good thing about this hotel is its location. Close to the water. With single glased wondows I had a chance to experience Honolulu downtown noise from 6am until 11pm. Also there is a 24/7 noise from the cooling towers and aircons from buildings next door.Furniture is antique . Hotel maintenance is not great I guess it is in service of maximising the profit. Cleaining is not that great but it is acceptable. Found dirty wall stains left from previous visitors. Space around room aircon is fixed with now rotten plywood. My suggestion to management is to replace this rotten wood and repair or replace jalousie windows because it is not the best typeof windows for downtown Honolulu. Anyhow after our complain that room is to noisy we just got "We are very sory" and that was it. Be ready to sleep with ear plugs.

We stayed here as we really wanted a place that offered self catering facilities. When we arrived the staff were amazing - our flight landed at 630am and we dropped our bags off and had access to the rooftop pool and amenities room which was great. Our room was spacious and the bed was comfortable. We were only a block away from the beach and a grocery store, and the bus stop was just across the road. Amazing restaurants were only a minutes walk away. There was a free frequent shuttle to the Ala Moana Centre Would definitely stay here again as it offers comfort, great staff and proximity to everything that you need.

We booked this for location despite some bad reviews. We needed to be close to my inlaws who were at Moana Surfrider after a cruise. Our room was spacious for two. Full size bed (if it was Queen sized I would be surprised). Bed was NOT comfortable. As a matter of fact there was a wooden platform that the mattress sits on but mattress was too small for the platform and both my husband and myself crashed into it so many times we both got bruises. There was a couch and dressers and large closet. Fridge, Microwave and tiny coffee pot. There was a VERY small bathroom with what seemed like a cruise ship shower. SO SMALL. It appeared clean however another reviewer posted about roaches so I was really skeeved out and worried. I saw a tiny roach only but my husband told me he saw and killed two when I wasn't looking in order to save my sleep. We were on the 9th floor - it smelled like sour milk in the hall and the key card entry to the elevator and the rooms was terrible. It took like 20 tries to get the keys to work, mine never did.The people at the front desk were very nice. They explained the parking situation very well. We were nervous about parking but we followed instructions exactly as he told us. We paid $25 a day for our rental car - just make sure you tape the paid parking in your window clearly displayed. The location can't be beat. It is such an easy walk to everything but these need updated BAD! We won't stay here again due to the roaches / cost of parking I would rather do AirBnB but if you do stay here, bring your own raid, spray every crevice first of all and put roach trap in bathroom. For the price we have stayed in cleaner hotels with bigger showers in Waikiki

I would definItely stay at this hotel again. Nice and close to the ocean. We had the kitchenette suite which was quite nice. With the pool on the roof, it gives you a great lookout.Great overall. We will be back.

Needs major updates. No gym, nice staff, some dingy carpets, pool is terrible. No computers for use, lots of street noise, but that's Honolulu. Close to everything, ABC'S on every corner. Housekeeping was weak, but fresh towels on request. Mid range hotel. We won't stay here again

We had a kitchette our room was more than adequate. We were up high so the view we had was amazing . The staff was also there for anything we needed, very friendly. The highlight of our trip was to Pearl Harbour,and the Polynesian cultural centre.There is a lot of high end stores for your shopping pleasure. And we never had to rent a car ..

This hotel is literally a street away from the beach it's less than 5 min walk, it's also close to the zoo, shopping centres. Prime location. Room was nice and clean, we were upgraded so that was an awesome bonus. The pool view is amazing would recommend this hotel for the price it's pretty awesome. Staff is also so friendly.

We stayed here 4 nights. Nice location about a block from the beach. Very friendly and helpful staff. It is a little dated but they keep things up well. Free beach towels you can check out. Our room had a big balcony, no view of the ocean though. Small kitchen, living room area, table and chairs, good a/c. The only real negative: a lot of street noise. It didn't really bother me all that much. Good value for what we paid.

We had a one bedroom corner apartment on the 17th floor. The view was amazing! The hotel itself is a little bit dated. The room was small to my liking because we could hardly move once the sofa bed was spread out. The air con was noisy so we could not have it on during the night. The bedroom has only a ceiling fan which needs regular dusting because once turned on, my allergies from the dust flared up!. We did not use it in the end. The hotel lobby is much open to the road on both sides so it's a bit like a marketplace. You can smell the toilet deodoriser/disinfectant while in the hotel lobby (there is a toilet near the elevator lobby) which is not pleasant. However, this hotel has a great location; very accessible to restaurants, shopping, and the beach. There were also a lot of families who were booked there making it a family friendly hotel. The staff were also friendly.

This is one of the best locations in the area. It is very central, lots of great restaurants and shopping near by. Waikiki's famous lounging and surf beach is a minute walk from the door. The higher rooms have amazing beach views at a reasonable price for the area. The hotel itself is a little dated, but it is clean, and staff are generally friendly, although if you book from an owner direct, be aware of lost room keys, as the staff are much less friendly about replacing keys.The pool is nice. Decent place for the price.

i stayed in this hotel for 3 nights. loved almost everything about it. we got a room with partial ocean view, which was great. the room was clean and nice. only hope the ac can be quieter. but other than that i like the room a lot. it was cute with a kitchenette and living area. staff was nice and warm, from the guy who checked us in to any of them we encounter in the hallway. location was great.very close to the shopping area. and was convenient with several abc stores nearby. shops and restaurants are within walking distance.

We stayed 12 nights at the Aqua Pacific Monarch from 26 Nov until 8 December 2016.From our initial booking enquiries until our checkout the service was first class. We stayed with our 16 yr old son in a one bedroom suite overlooking Waikiki beach. We requested a high unit and were put on the 26th floor which gave wonderful views. The unit was spacious with a huge deck that we lived on. The fold out sofa was extremely comfortable. Having a kitchen with a full size fridge, large oven, microwave, rice cooker and marble bench tops was a luxury. The Hotel is only 3 mins walk to Waikiki beach and you pick up beach towels and chairs from the front desk anytime. There is lemon iced water all day long in the foyer and unlimited DVDs to borrow free.The resort is in a fabulous location to everything and nothing is a problem with any member of staff. We had a mix up with a wake up call during our stay and the Manager, Raymond Yoshimura refunded our resort fee for the entire 12 night stay. We have never ever received such unbelievable service anywhere in the world. We were overwhelmed with such a generous refund. Thank you so much Raymond and we are saving our dollars and cannot wait to return to the Aqua Pacific Monarch !!!Waikiki is a wonderful place for families with lots to do - surfing, snorkelling, hiking, shopping ( Ross in Seaside St) hiring a car and driving to the North Shore, waterfalls and relaxation. Something for every age.

We recently enjoyed our first visit to Honolulu - Waikiki . The Aqua Pacific Monarch was like home from the first minutes of our very late night arrival to the last moments of our slightly traumatic departure. It was exciting to see the lobby renovations progressing each morning and the seamless way the staff met and greeted guests with a cheerful Aloha. Our unit (906) was clean, comfortable and just right for the two of us. Sadly we developed a cold / flu on the last few days, but once again the staff .. in particular the cleaning and maintenance group on the 9th floor and Raymond . Came to our aide when I collapsed , even allowing us to stay in our room for free until, to re-cooperate before our late night flight. We will "come home again. Mahala Patricia and Paul

Stayed at the aqua pacific monarch in early December 2016. This was booked through my travel agent so we were not sure.I have to say it was fantastic, it's in a very good location, close to Waikiki beach and all transportation.It is a bit tired looking but at the end of the day it serviced our needs. Great view of the beach from our balcony, and from the roof top pool deck.Staff were excellent, could not fault them.We had a 1 bedroom apartment with full stove, fridge.I can highly recommend this hotel, it was great value for money also. When I go back to Honolulu I will definitely be staying here.

Pros:The quick and efficient service during check in, staff at reception were all very friendly and helpful. Some of the furniture in the room seem a little worn such as the sofa bed and furniture but other than that all was clean and comfortable including the bathroom. Hotel also provides hourly shuttle to Ala Moana with pick up and drop off at all Aqua hotels in Waikiki area so we could actually drop off at places where there are other Aqua hotels! Last shuttle from Ala Moana is at 9pm.A nice inexpensive Japanese restaurant just behind this hotel. A Japanese cafe / convenience store within hotel lobby.Cons:None except there was no safe in the room.

I stayed at the Aqua Pacific Monarch for a week in November; I had stayed there previously eleven years ago. I did notice that it had been refurbished and looks great. The location is perfect in Waikiki: the bus stop is right outside, so close to the beach and close to a lot of eateries. The staff are wonderful and so nice and helpful. A Honolulu Star Advertiser is provided daily from the lobby. Beach towels are available for use you just have to exchange a beach towel card which is provided at check in for a towel each time. I had a one bedroom room with kitchen, city facing view. The room was large with a full kitchen which I did not use to cook, I just used the fridge which was great. The bedroom had a queen sized bed and there was a lot of room. The bathroom was a good size and was next to the bedroom, a great set up. I will stay at the Aqua Pacific Monarch again for sure.

We booked this hotel on recommendation and quite enjoyed our stay here .Nothing fancy but clean and spacious studio / balcony and city views on our side .Every worked as expected , room staff excellent and 2 streets away from the beach . bus stop in front . For convenience to beach shops and transport its hard to beat .Front desk very good with particular mention of Mieko who seems to know it all . Very efficient pleasant lady !This hotel served us well , we enjoyed our stay .

Great location, great stuff, affordable prices, best for many you payed, but we had bad studio. First we got one on 20th floor. It was nice, well equipped, modern furniture but close to elevator. I could not sleep because of elevator’s noise and we ask for change. Our new unit was on 18th floor and it was bed. Owner of this condo obviously does not like to spend much on it. Let us start with bed. Average quality (or less ) mattress and spring box are mounted on some fanny, plastic, hardly standing platform, each move makes too much noise, and you are never sure it is not going to collapse. Fortunately, we are not heavy persons, otherwise sleeping on this bed would be real art. Owner occupied half space in wardrobe closet by posting big cupboard with his stuff. There is not enough space for your clothes. Sofa is ragged, kitchenette is below minimum with dishware. Bathroom is small and old, (no bathtub ) with narrow space between lavatory and wall, bigger people could have problem turning around. Still, stuff is keeping it clean coming in every day, and that is why they deserve all compliments. View is fantastic, we enjoyed sunset sitting in our room. Roof pool is small, entertainment room on highest floor is not equipped non furnished well. IWILL DEFINITLY COME AGAIN, BUT NOT IN THIS 18-TH FLOOR STUDIO

The good bits.... ** Location - perfect, just two short blocks away from Waikiki Beach and the bus stop outside caters for a range of Bus routes. ** Facilities - great for families, just a bit 'old' and could probably do with a refurb to modernise it. ** Customer service - friendly and helpful. ** Rates - affordable. ** View - magnificent (we had the ocean view room). ** Surrounding food options - make sure you eat at Jinroku downstairs, the fillet was to die for and overall the food was great.The not-so-good bits... **Complimentary Cocktail Hour every Wednesday isn't always an hour long. We arrived 10 minutes before it was supposed to end and they had already packed everything up (even though there were guests still sitting around having a drink) and so we didn't get our free drink. A bit disappointing as the previous week, it was cancelled due to Thanksgiving so we were looking forward to having a drink in the Hospitality Room. ** Hotel shuttle to Ala Moana was a bit erratic and not reliable for when you want to go or return. I'd suggest catching The Bus or driving if you want to get there faster when you want to go. ** Air conditioning is positioned low on the ground in the living room so the cold didn't circulate well and you had to crank it up to really feel the impact. ** The fan in the bedroom wasn't enough to cool you down.

Decent little hotel with efficiency rooms and good location for price; nothing fancy here, no ocean view and not a resort. The ‘Studio Kitchenette’ room was big with a sitting area, desk, kitchen table and little galley kitchen with sink, electric stove top and fridge. There was also a narrow balcony to step outside for some air, but no room for sitting. The AC was strong for the room, but was a small ‘home’ window unit and not central AC. Biggest complaint is that the AC unit was situated as such, that it was blowing directly into my face while sleeping. The unit was about 2 feet from the bed and aimed right at the pillows. This is a really bad design. I also noted others on TA have made the same comment.The parking is attached to the hotel but run by a separate company. Just follow the precise instructions from the Front Desk and you won’t have any problems. The spots are very small, so a compact car would help if staying here. Once the parking fee is paid, you may come and go as you please.The hotel provides beach towels and little beach chairs. The beach is a quick 5 minute walk from the hotel. The lobby was under construction, but we did not have any noise issues.

This hotel is absolutely great for those who want to be close to the action and beach without the high cost. Yes the rooms are a bit dated however it is very clean and had everything you need. Every employee we encountered was very friendly and happy to help.

Location is perfect, about 2 blocks from the beach. A little noisy at night due to cars and motorcycles (maybe higher floors are better - I was on the 8th floor) Huge room, very comfortable, with a kitchen (microwave, fridge, stove, dishes, pots and pans, just everything!) so you can buy things at the ABC stores and have breakfast in your room. Perfect for families. Pool, sauna, amenity room. The staff was great, although sometimes it took a while to get our beach towels since it´s the same front desk guys who do this and they are usually busy. Not a luxury hotel, but perfect for a beach location. Loved it!

Booked the aqua pacific monarch for a one night stay in Waikiki before heading to the big island for 4 nights. Great rooms. Very close to Waikiki beach and entertainment and foods.Shuttles to activities available and shuttle to Pearl Harbor. Good reasonably priced stay! Our room had Great views of the ocean, city and mountains!

We have been to Waikiki many times stayed at various hotels of different ratings this hotel is right up there value for money is what you get here From the staff at the desk to the cleaning staff deserve a big thank you they are all so helpful and polite nothing is a problem rooms are very clean and well maintained we had a phone which did not work they waived the resort fee which was a pleasant surprise great public relations once again thanks again to everyone at the AQUA PACIFIC MONARCH

This is the perfect place to stay for those who want a great location on Waikiki without having to pay a fortune. We asked for beach views and kitchenette which we got. Very clean, great service from the front desk and literally a two minute walk to the beach, shops and restaurants.

We could not have picked a better place. We really had to rely on reviews for our first visit to Hawaii. We selected this place because it had a kitchenette and we were glad we did. It was very convenient to have some place to have breakfast or an afternoon snack. We had seen some negative comments online about the noise but the Waikiki area of Honolulu is a busy and noisy city. We were on the 29th floor and if you have the large 10' patio doors open you are going to hear city noise. The place was clean. The cleaning staff made up the room every day and kept is well stocked with coffee and toiletries. The front desk staff was very helpful and courteous. The pool and hot tub on the roof was great but beware that any rooftop area is going to be windy on any day. If you choose to spend some time on the beach, don't forget to ask for the beach chairs. They loan them to you at no cost. On our last day we had to check out at noon but our flight didn't leave until 1030pm. We checked our luggage at the desk and went on a catamaran excursion. When we returned they gave us towels and access to the pool and the shower on the upper floors. It made for a great last day. We were warned in advance that there would be some renovations in the lobby area during our stay. We were not inconvenienced one bit. That should be done in early December. Oh, and most important, we found a great little Mexican restaurant just down the street that was great for happy hour.

Firstly be careful and get what you pre paid for.. When they say we upgraded you don't be afraid to see the room. I paid for a Partial ocean view room with Kitchenette and they UPGRADED me to a 1 Bedroom / Living room. Yes it did have a separate bedroom with 2 single beds in it.. The living room had a double bed in it. It was on the 6th floor and overlooked the car park and had a small long balcony that you would never go on.. It had dirty old drapes that had small holes in them and the room was smelly, hot and dusty old. When I changed rooms I got given a room on the 16th Floor.. Yes I had my my partial ocean views.. worth it.. its Outdated and needs work done to rooms. The blinds don't close properly and the air conditioning struggles to cool. Hopefully the there is a ceiling fan in your room. You get what you pay for... yes it was conveniently located to the beach.. It does have a shuttle service. The pool on the roof is small.. the resort fee was $15 USD and considering the internet work very good it was worth paying that fee. I would still recommend it for people on a budget.

Our room had a balcony , lovely to sit there and catch the afternoon breeze with a drink and some nibbles. Very quiet room, comfortable bed, and perfect kitchenette. Just a couple of minutes walk to Waikiki. Close to an excellent shopping centre. Bus going past the door. I'd go back there any day!

We stayed 10 nights in the Aqua Pacific Monarch. The staff were all very nice and knowledgeable (especially Daniel) except for a little mix up at the beginning when we were told we would have to pay the resort fee and I had already paid it in my original booking, but this got sorted swiftly. The studio on the 10th floor was lovely and spacious. We had a balcony with table and chairs, a kitchenette, dinning room and table, TV, air dryer, air The air conn was noisy in the living room )none in the bedroom only a fan) but it kept the room at a nice temperature and the noise did not put us off, we slept very well there.We had full use of oven, hob, kettle, microwave, rice cooker (did not try it), toaster, fridge.The tea, coffee, sugar and bathroom shower gel, etc were replenish everyday (they did not always give us enough sugar). We did cook in a couple of nights, if you want to shop we recommend going to the Food Pantry which is about 10 minutes walk which a proper supermarket with fresh fruits, meat and fish or ABC store 2 min away but a lot less choice and more expensive.The sheets were supposed to be replaced every three days I don't think this was the case but it was not an issue and I am sure if we'd ask they would have done it.Towels can be replaced everyday if required.Overall the place looked a little dated but it was all very clean.We also use the pool and the hot tub on the roof which was very enjoyable, the pool is rather small so can quickly get over crowded. The hot tub had a timer on the side of the building (you had to know it was there as not obvious) and was very hot and powerful bubbles, very relaxing. You will also get great 360 views of the surrounding from the roof top.We also used the free shuttle to Ala Moana a couple of times, ideal to go shopping or connect with local buses for a trip around the island.I would definitely recommend this hotel as it is literally 5 min from the beach and it is all you can expect and more.

Stayed in a 31st floor condo at this mixed use hotel. Had a view of both the mountains and the sea, which was nice. The hotel itself is probably 3 star at best - basic facilities and reasonably clean. However it's a great price, and it's only a couple of blocks from the beach. The Korean cafe across from the lobby does great food.

Fantastic family friendly place to stay. Very clean rooms. We had a room with kitchen and it was very clean and fully stocked with all the essentials. They have easy access to pool towels and are so friendly and happy to help with any questions about the area and things to do. The concierge in the sister hotel next door was fabulous with helping us book activities and gave options of many and recommended what they thought best suited our family! It's a very short walk to the beach and not far from the supermarket and has many ABC stores located near by also. We would definitely stay here again!

After a two month trip traveling around the States, my husband and I decided Honolulu would be a great end to our trip and to celebrate my birthday. We have stayed at many hotels during our trip (very up market to average) and I have to say, I love everything about this hotel. The room is clean and well equipped with everything you need to be self sufficient & comfortable, a pool and spa on the rooftop, it's about a three minute walk from the beautiful Waikiki beach, shops, restaurants... And the view from our room is beautiful. There are a few things that could do with a bit of a facelift, but nothing that is of concern. What I love most of all about this hotel is how happy and friendly everyone is, you feel welcome from the moment you walk in the door. We travel a lot and finding accommodation that ticks all the comfort/clean boxes is hard enough, but to find that and such lovely staff is a bonus. I'll be sad to leave on the 29th, but will definitely be back and recommend.Pacific Monarch don't ever lose that friendly feel! MAHALO xo

Stayed here for 10 days on holiday. It could do with a bit of a revamp- the shower was a bit old and our air con leaked and make the carpet wet.. The bed was a bit small (double) but other than that it was a great stay. Awesome location just 2 mins from the beach. The rooms were clean and housekeeping does a good job everyday, bed and pillows were comfy.View from roof at night is amazing.Id definately stay here again.

This is the third time we have stayed here, and we'll always come back! The staff are fabulous, especially Erica (who quickly fixed my booking mistake not too long before we arrived!) and Keiko, Danny, Daniel & Cherly! A one bedroom works really well - plenty of space and light! it's worth paying extra to have a sea view, always something interesting to watch! It's a five minute walk to the beach, shopping, restaurants and Food Pantry, where you can buy ready made meals, fresh food to cook, snacks, drinks, wine, everything pretty much!

We stayed here for 5 nights, very handy spot, just a stroll from the beach, clean, towels changed every day, bit dated but very affordable. Our room had a view of beach and water Through the buildings in front of us. Would recomend.

We stayed for 8 nights end of August 16. We had booked a room with balcony and kitchenette, and preferred a sea view. We got what was requested, though sea view was through two other buildings (we were on floor 11). Great .location - only about 150 meters to the sandy beach of Waikiki.Though the hotel is not new, it is extremely comfortable, and well set up. Excellent room, single bedroom off the lounge and kitchenette. Great bathroom with one of the few really effective extractor fans - steam free here. Lovely bed - very comfortable. The kitchen and lounge were spacious and fully equipped. Full size stove, microwave, fridge freezer, and all the items needed to cook and eat. Good size TV, comfy couch and nice table and chairs. Excellent lighting throughout. As I said - the hotel is not new, but it shows a very high standard of maintenance. Everything works, and is very clean - not showing wear and tear as hotels sometimes do. All facilities were excellent - pool & jaccuzzi on the roof, good lifts (3).Staff were the best - the reception area (Dan was a standout here), the room service staff, and any others we met were all smiling, helpful and courteous. We did not hesitate to tip (though as Kiwis this is new to us). Good service certainly deserved a reward.We did note that Wifi, and Telephone, papers etc attracted an extra charge (not optional), and felt that this could have been added into the room rate anyway.Aircon was rather loud, and was a "plug in" type in the wall - it seemed to keep up and was in the lounge only. This did not prove an issue as the bedroom had a very effective ceiling fan and air circulated nicely - we got used to the noise of the aircon quite quickly - no bother at all. Daytime temps were 30 to 32 deg C, and nights about 28C. Parking was available but costly.So - all in all an extremely nice stay, and would certainly stay again. Felt like home.

2nd time in 12 months. What I like about this hotel:+ is that its only 1 block to the beach on the quite end of Waikiki+ they are studio rooms & for one person they are big+ rooms have lounge + dining table + kitchen+ I always get a studio partial ocean view but can also see spectacular mountains+ the building is old but the rooms not+ pool on roof is small but great+ front staff are very helpfulMy holiday is always a mixture of work & pleasure & the room is so relaxed to work in unlike most hotel rooms. The room can sleep 3 but for two people its the best value. I have investigated alot of hotels in this area & they are all the same poky rooms, this is different & I highly recommend

On arrival not a good impression looked pretty basic then open the door on your room and the space the extras really good.Twin beds,table and chairs,sofa,fully equipped kitchen with fridge,microwave,cook top,with all utensils.dvd player with choice of DVDs.Great location can see the water a short walk supermarket a couple of minutes for anyone staying more than a few days this place has it all

Stayed here for 7 nights after a 4week trip around USA. Was a perfect place to stay, close to the beach. Close to food panty supermarket and not too far to an ABC store...you will understand once you have been to honolulu. Hotel was pefectly fine and met all our needs. Free shuttle to shopping mall, they have beach towels you can use. Roof top pool also was nice. Place appears to be having alot of tidy up/repair/updating touches done to it which were very unintrusive. Will be interesting to see what its like next time we go as i will be staying here again. Its not your fancy Hilton resort but its also friendly on the budget so more money for shopping. Would recommend to anyone.

We have just arrived home after 8 days staying here. We had 2 young children so affordability, facilities (microwave, stove etc) plus location was important. Location is perfect for the cost... Not far from the heart of Waikiki and also the beach which is great for little ones. Although the rooms are very dated and could do with a much needed reno to liven them up, carpet coming away, our toilet door jammed shut and took a big thud to open. General furniture and décor needs updating. If this was done it would def be the place to stay for us. My MIL room was a lot nicer so maybe some have been done? In saying this, the rooms were very clean (which I always look for). The staff were lovely, helpful and accommodating. The pool and spa area is nothing special... but definitely suited us for what we needed. Would def recommend to people on a budget who want to be close to everything. And agree with other reviews, the air con was very noisy... but you can't really sleep with the door open as it is too noisy with the street right there. But we just sleep when we get home! :)

We stayed there for 5 days over the summer. It was my wife, me and 1 year old. I chose this hotel as it was the best 3 star hotel that I found that didn't raise any red flags when i was reading it's other reviews. Overall, I would say I was pleased with what we found. There is a mini fridge, kitchenette and dining table in our room. The location is perfect. There is a well known local restaurant where you can get your sushi balls in the morning, a shuttle that takes you to the shopping center, and it was very close to Waikiki beach. We also did the Polynesian Cultural Center, and the shuttle to pickup for that excursion is also just a block down the road. The staff was great and attentive. There are some things that are the norm for hotels in that area which turn me off. All the hotels around there charge an amenity fee on top of the base rate. I think fees like that are questionable as there are things like the PS3 in all the rooms that go completely unused. They have a free DVD rental box, but who rents DVDs on vacation? I wouldn't recommend renting a car for this hotel as it's close enough to things you won't need it, and parking is sparse and expensive. My only complaint is that the air conditioning unit is right next to the bed, so you have to make some adjustments to comfortably sleep with cold air blowing in your direction.

Well located a couple of blocks back from Waikiki beach the rooms are spacious but it's an older design. Clean with, in our room 1201, an air conditioner that blasted cold air directly against your head as you lay in bed. Not the most efficient AC for the size of room. Two single beds which wouldn't be my preference but I don't know if that was standard. Staff were friendly & there is a good well priced Korean BBQ eatery just across the road. There's a roof top pool with excellent views of the beach & 360 degree views but you need to get towels from the lobby. This wouldn't be my first pick in accomodation in the future but for budget conscious travellers it may suit.

We stayed a week at the Pacific Monarch and thought it was great.It's only a couple of blocks back from the beach right in the Waikiki area. There are a couple of 'ABC' general stores very close by and a 'Food Pantry' supermarket within 5 minutes walk. There's also an 'Alamo' car rental almost next door. We walked to Diamond Head (1 hour) in one direction and Ala Moana shopping centre (30 minutes) in the other. There is actually a free shuttle to Ala Moana for PM guests. There's a bus stop over the road where we caught public transport to Pearl Harbour.Our room (partial sea view studio) was excellent. Spacious bedroom/dining/lounge area, reasonable little kitchen and separate bathroom. Kitchen was well fitted out with kettle, toaster, coffee maker, microwave and a two-ring cooktop.The view was great (28th floor). Mainly towards the city but to one side you could see Waikiki beach and towards the other the mountains. The balcony was only narrow but you could slide the doors right back and it felt like the whole apartment was outdoors.There's a rooftop pool but we only used that once, preferring to go to the beach. The hotel provides towels you can take to the beach.The PM was probably built in the 1970s, so it's a bit past its heyday but that didn't matter. It's well presented, well located and the staff are friendly.

First Hawaii trip and we stayed at Aqua Pacific Waikiki. The hotel was good, staff was friendly, room was clean (very important), but we were a little disappointed in numerous unforeseen charges. There were parking charges per day (typical at any hotel in Waikiki), but upon leaving we were hit with other charges that we feel we should not have had to pay. A call to the hotel after we were already home to question the charges, and we were pretty much told there is nothing that can be done. It was a little disappointing as such a beautiful trip left a bad taste in our mouth. The way we remedy is to not stay in Waikiki anymore!

My husband & I & other family members every trip continue to stay at the Pacific Monarch. The location could not be better, the rooms and rooftop pool are great -but the staff really stand out especially o Keiko, Danny and Cheryle. They are always so happy and treat all the guests royally....always smiling and saying Aloha. We will notstay anywhere else. The Murrays

I would definitely return to the Aqua Pacific Monarch. The many positive reviews I read prior to booking did it justice. Ideal location moments from the beach, fabulous views from the Ocean View Room on the 31st floor for a reasonable price. Every single staff member we encountered on our 9 night stay was super friendly and helpful. Although the hotel is looking perhaps a little tired, I felt for its 3 star rating, it was fabulous. If you want new, perfect and modern, then go elsewhere (and pay much more) I loved that it has an older, 70s authentic vibe in reception. Our 1 bedroom ocean view was completely perfect for the 4 of us. Kids on the pull-out couch, us in the surprisingly comfortable bed. I have a very expensive mattress at home which we have only had since October and we slept better at the Aqua Pacific. The room was clean and the daily servicing was more than I expected. Two minor things, when I booked I specifically requested twin beds in the bedroom as part of the booking process through hotels.com. Under additionals I asked for a high-floor room. We got the high floor room which I was very grateful for as it does get very loud on the streets below, especially when the garbage truck comes every single morning at 5am! However the room had a queen bed in it. When I called I was told it was not a guarantee and they had no twin rooms available. While I understand requests cannot be guaranteed (something it said in the part where I asked for the high-floor room) I thought when making the actual booking and given the option of being able to choose queen or 2 twins, this would be a definite. Maybe that's just a hotels.com thing. In the end it didn't matter. Our air conditioning wouldn't turn off one evening so I called and was told he would be 10mins. One hour later, I was still sitting on the bed waiting while my children slept in the lounge. We ended up pulling the plug out of the wall and restarting it in the morning which did the trick. Small things which definitely did not taint our stay at the Aqua Pacific. If we go back to Waikiki in the future, I will most definitely look into staying here again.

Pros: 1. Very near the beach. The beach is crowded, but that’s Waikiki.2. Great ocean view from high floors. Not sure about lower floors.3. Convenient location to dining and shopping at all price levels.4. Extras ($15/day): Ice water dispenser in the lobby (refreshing!), DVD rentals, shuttle to Ala Moana, daily Honolulu Star newspaper, in-room coffee (blech), in-room safe, Wi-Fi, beach towels and chairs. Of these, we did not rent DVDs or use the shuttle or chairs. The beach towels were convenient. However, see cons #5 below5. Kitchenette (stove, micro, fridge, toaster, plates/utensils)6. Excellent housekeeping. Sign says they encourage re-using bathroom towels, and to place them on the floor if you want them replaced. We hung ours on the rack, but they replaced them daily anyway. Housekeeping staff was wonderfully courteous and efficient.7. Front desk staff was welcoming, courteous, and helpful.8. Good rates. ($135 to $190) but you get what you pay for. See below  And now for the cons:1. The Amazing Parking Lot Illusion. The connected parking lot structure is $25 per day. The front desk clerk actually advised us NOT to park in that lot. This is nearly verbatim what she said: “We don’t own the lot, and some of our guests have had their cars towed by the lot owners, even though they paid. It’s something about the parking pass not being displayed properly. You will have to go retrieve your car and pay the towing expenses.” I’m not making this up. The desk clerk recommended parking at the lot associated with Waikiki Banyan (201 Ohua Ave.) about 3 blocks away ($20 per day). So, it was always 3 blocks to our car (or from the car to the hotel). It wasn’t a long trek, and it was worth it not to worry about the car being towed. But what an unreasonable inconvenience.2. Impractical Air Conditioning (one-bedrooms only, not studio). Ours was a one-bedroom with a separate living area. The air conditioning was a small rectangular unit you would commonly buy at the hardware store and install through a window. It was mounted through the wall (not window) at floor level in the living area. It was noisy, but that would be expected. It cooled the room sufficiently. The problem is that there was no A/C unit in the bedroom, and the cooled air does not move from the living area to the bedroom. Result: hot bedroom. To cool the bedroom, we relied solely on the ceiling fan and sliding glass door to balcony. Had to sleep with the door open, and it was pretty noisy, even on the 31st floor.3. No Workable Rollaway Bed Option. They have rollaways and cribs. Our reservation stated that the cost for these was $25 per night, but on arrival the desk clerk insisted that it was $30 per night. It was a moot point, since there was no space for the rollaway. The bedroom had barely enough room to walk (just a few feet at sides and foot of bed), and the living area could not fit a rollaway unless the dining table and chairs were pushed into the corner of the room. But then there’d be no room to walk. Take careful a look at the pictures on the web site. That is literally all the floor space. 4. The Pool… Wait, Hot Tub… No, the Pool. The pool is on the roof. It’s tiny and shallow, which would be good for small children. But don’t try to swim in it. During our stay, the water was HOT. About 90 degrees. Solar power at work.5. The “Extras.” The $15 daily extras fee is mandatory. You must pay it. Well then put it in the room charge instead of trying to fake us out! Also, they list the in-room coffee, wi-fi, in-room safe as part of the extras. These should be included in the room charge. The DVDs and towels/chairs and newspaper I can understand. But the safe and the crummy coffee?  CONCLUSIONOn a budget, the Aqua Pacific Monarch is decent value. There are inconveniences, but not enough to ruin the trip. You come to Honolulu for the beaches and the island, not to spend a lot of time in the hotel. If traveling on a budget I might consider staying here again, but I will probably pay an extra $30 per night to stay someplace without the cons listed above.

This is our third visit and eight years since we last visited. It is not a grand or lavish hotel and from the outside not eye catching. However if you want a nice friendly and well priced room in Waikiki then this one is for you. It is an easy three minute walk to the beach, across the road is great quality food and surf board hire. The pool is on the roof and has magic views.The hotel now has a small service charge but for this you now get towels, free shuttle and internet. The staff are highly friendly and it was so great to see Danny still there. He is always happy and will do anything to make the stay more enjoyable. Two tips get a room with an ocean view, the balconies are large and a great spot to chill. Allow extra time around 0900 for the lifts they are not the quickest.

We stayed in the kitchenette. It wasn't very big, but it was comfortable. Beds were nice, view was fantastic. It's nothing fancy, but it was only a few blocks from the beach, and it was clean. Front desk was incredibly friendly and helpful. They even had a movie/relax room where our group had a pizza party our last night. The rooftop pool is pretty cool, not very big, but nice. I even used the laundry facilities and they were fine for our purposes. They pretty much have everything you need for a comfortable stay and are close to restaurants, shops, and groceries.

Wonderful customer service and personal attention from Raymond the manager. Responding to a few issues when we arrived like Wifi not working, he waived the hospitality fee for the duration of our 10 day stay when he heard about them. He also at our request gave us great restaurant advice. Then on our departure our booked and paid for shuttle didn't turn up…distressed and in danger of missing our flight back to Sydney Raymond got his people to organise a taxi for us to the airport and even picked up the bill. Not often you get that sort of concern and support from hotels. Well done Pacific Monarch you contributed greatly to our Hawaiian vacation.

This hotel is located in a great area, central to mostly everything in Waikiki. Staff is very friendly and they have Iyasume Masubi right in the hotel lobby (major plus for our family). The rooms were spacious and we liked that there was a fridge, microwave, plates etc. which made it easy with our baby. As with any hotel, just a few cons. Non centralized AC (air would only be in living room, rest of the rooms had a fan but it did not keep us cool), furniture is a bit outdated and hardwood, with sharp edges (not baby friendly; our baby hit her head several times). Mattress was uneven, making it hard to sleep comfortably. Things to note: (1) Their parking garage is open to the public at $25/day. They make it a point to have your receipt visible on car dash, otherwise they will TOW YOUR CAR. Apparently happens quite frequently. (2) Complimentary shuttle runs from 6AM to 9PM that can take you all around town (3) You can rent movies (similar to Netflix) and playstation games (4) There is a fee if you do not return the beach towel cards. I believe it is $20 for each lost card.

Perfect location for those wishing to visit Waikiki and not pay out a huge money. It is what I would call mid range costing. The building itself presents well from the street, however the lobby area and rooms, while very clean are in need of an update. Having said that we would not hesitate to stay here again and we would happily recommend it. The rooms have kitchenettes complete with a full size, excellent fridge, dining table , sofa bed and a more than adequate living area. We were upgraded to an ocean view room and it had a separate bedroom and a large lanai complete with an outdoor table with a seating for four. The partial ocean view our friends had was one big room but similarly equipped. The staff are extremely friendly and nothing is a problem. You are greeted with a smile and Aloha everytime you see someone. There are three lifts that service all floors and they are fairly quick. You have an ABC store close by and the Food Pantry supermarket across the street and a block down. The walk to the beach is 2 mins straight down to the Dukes Statue on Waikiki Beach, perfect. Our room was mainly carpet but our friends were fully tiled, a much better idea and more serviceable. On the downside, the air conditioning units are extremely small and situated in the living room so is of little help during the night in the bedroom. The bedroom had a sliding door onto the lanai and a ceiling fan, the breeze was beautiful, the noise from the streets below horrendous . However after a couple of nights we were used to it and slept well. A couple of little things we noticed were the absence of coasters, as the furniture was all wood we went out and collected coasters to use in the room. Considering everything we would stay here again without a doubt, after all if you are looking for 5 star stay in one of the over priced beach front properties. Thank you Pacific Monarch for a wonder stay.

We stayed at the Aqua Pacific Monarch in April for three weeks and it was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. We had a superb room with a wonderful view and found the staff so helpful and friendly. The hotel is well-priced and clean too. I also must point out the very very comfortable beds - something so many hotels get wrong. The location is really central and handy to everything. Staying here really contributed to our holiday and made it one to remember. Thanks to everyone at Aqua Pacific especially Daniel Cherly and Keiko. We cannot wait to return!

I booked a room seven months in advance through Expedia and specifically requested a room with a queen bed but was given a room with two twin beds. Please consider elsewhere if you want a nice vacation in Hawaii.

We booked a one bedroom ocean view with kitchen. We were lucky enough to be able to get into our room early. The views from the 22nd floor were well worth the money. It was a spacious apartment style facility with separate bedroom and bathroom, with a combined, kitchen, dining and lounge area. it had a large refrigerator, a coffee maker, a full size cooktop and oven with sufficient cutlery and crockery. Had you wanted to cook there were inadequate pots. I would have asked for them if I had intended to cook.I didn't know what the ABC stores were until we arrived. You can buy takeaway food of different types, soft drinks, alcohol, clothing souvenirs and much more. The Food Pantry is also another place to buy in supplies.We booked a 7 day Waikiki Trolley Pass (hop on hop off bus) before we left home andone of the main bus stops is only a block away which was great.There is only air conditioning in the lounge which does not cool the bedroom. However, there is an overhead fan in the bedroom.It is certainly not 5 star, but it was clean, in a good location and the staff were helpful and friendly. I would recommend a stay here.

As we had a wedding to attend to, we had a group booking of approximately 15 persons. The itinerary clearly stipulated that all family were to remain as close together as possible. This did not happen as most of us were scattered throughout several levels! Whilst some of us had partial ocean views written on the itinerary (and paid for!), we did not get this. A few of us had views of buildings next door which was quite disappointing! The staff did not appear friendly nor were they willing to rectify this issue!In terms of location, it was great. Good as a base and exploring further of the city. I wouldn't say that the hotel was fantastic, but as mentioned, budget hotel in good location. However if your after something more extravagant and resort like, then there are other hotels you can look into! After all, Hawaii is expensive but all depends what budget you you're after.

We stayed 2 weeks in total. First week we were on the 7th floor and found it difficult to sleep at night due to the street traffic noise and the air conditioner was too noisy to have on during the night. The second week we were on the 27th floor and it was fantastic. It was quiet and we had a view of the ocean from the balcony. We didn't need to use the air conditioner which was much quieter than the one on the 7th floor as the room was much cooler due to more air circulating because we had the balcony doors open whenever we were in our room.

If we are ever fortunate enough to go back to Oahu, we will definitely be staying here. We had booked a studio with kitchenette but were upgraded to a one bedroom corner unit with a full kitchen. Definitely the way to go! Windows all around and having the kitchen was great. I would pay the extra to get the bigger unit. Friends of ours had the studio and it was still really nice. The one bedroom gives you lots of space though, and not having the air conditioner right next to your bed is a bonus.We knew the location because we had stayed at the Hyatt Regency the previous year. We didn't need anything luxurious again, so this was perfect. It's maybe a five minute walk to Waikiki Beach. Hope to be back in 2017!

My friends and I have stayed at Pacific Monarch 5 times and look forward to coming back again! Friendly staff, Danny is exceptionally helpful, clean, good location, wonderful views. We have not had a bad experience ever! Easy walking distance to the beach, restaurants, shopping, bus stops, groceries. It really has it all! The roof top pool is nice, but can be windy and busy at times. The elevators can be a little slow, but the other travellers are nice to visit with and everyone is having a good time. Why be in a hurry when you're in Hawaii anyway?! Housekeeping ladies are friendly, polite and efficient and are pleasant to chat with. Our shower was broken when we arrived, housekeeping called maintenance and it was fixed in less than 15 minutes! Now that's service!! With a smile! Can't say enough nice about this place.Will be returning next spring! Mahalo!

The Aqua Pacific is in a fantastic location close to the beach, restaurants and shopping. We spent 10 nights in a one bedroom apartment and although the hotel is dated it is clean and the staff are amazing. The roof top pool and spa were great although being up high they do cop the wind. The view from up there is amazing!! We had a fantastic holiday with another family that we traveled with and would definitely stay here again.

From the moment we arrived at 9 am our room was ready we were given everything we needed for our first visit to Hawaii. It's more and everything you may need. Forget anywhere else so central walk to beach hop to bus stop. Nothing is a problem for the team at APM Big thanks will be back love the ambience of your Home /Hotel. Wendy

I've stayed in Waikii many times over the years and up until now, always in a hotel. However, when I as looking to book again I came across this hotel on the same street as the Hilton Waikii Beach hotel where I stayed in 2014. The Aqua is different in that the rooms are all individually owned private apartments but with the added advantage of being serviced just like any top class hotel. I'd read the reviews and decided to book. I arrived on April 4th warmly greeted as if I was an old friend and shown to the most marvelous studio apartment for my 3 week stay. The room was perfect for myself as a solo traveler with a huge bed, sitting area, kitchen facilities and bathroom. It looked spotlessly clean and I have to say that every day the wonderful house keeping staff kept it that way every day. Exceeding the Hilton's rooms I've stayed in previously was the full wall glass sliding doors that led the the balcony, which although narrow, not wide enough for a chair, it was more than adequate for me to watch the world go bye and see them surfing in the ocean just a block away. The facilities gave me far more options for dining and or drinking in my room than I'd had at the Hilton. It also has to be said that whenever I met a member of staff, be it in the elevator or just in the corridor etc, they always had a wonderful sincere smile and a few nice words. I think this hotel gave me excellent value for money and terrific service. I loved it.

We only spent 9 hours in the hotel as we had a early flight however it was in a great location near to shops, restaurants and the beach ( no more than 10 mins walk).The desk was really helpful and we could not believe all the extras we could use.The room was big enough and the bed comfortable and had a great ocean view. The view from the pool was excellent.I would easily recommend this hotel for families or couples who want a good location with easy access to facilities.

Room was great. Stayed in a studio with a kitchenette which had everything we needed. Room was nice, clean and centrally located. Manager Sandra Hashimoto was great and treated us well as it was our anniversary.Only things that were not great was the air conditioner right beside the bed was a bit loud for sleeping and the additional room cleaning fee at checkout.Asides from that, great hotel and would definitely stay again.

Very pleasant and accommodating service at Reception, welcoming and on both times during this trip we arrived early and were able to access our accommodation, which was great.Rooms cleaned to a high standard, kitchenette had everything you need.Ocean views & Balcony.2 blocks from Waikiki, 5 minute walk.Plenty of local restaurants nearby.

we stayed here for five nights and found this place to be very centrally located and the staff were so very helpful. We were lucky to have a full kitchen and a lovely view of the sea. This place has a spa, pool and supplies you beach towels. On arrival you get starters and drinks from the manager as a complimentary welcome. Highly recommend this place

My family enjoyed two weeks of bliss in the comfort of the Aqua Pacific Monarch Hotel. We stayed in a corner, one bedroom with kitchen (partial ocean view) which was perfect for the four of us. We really enjoyed how central the hotel was-it was in the heart of Waikiki, but yet away from the hustle of the main strip. We had a room with a partial view and could see Diamond Head and the Ocean perfectly. The room was clean and the balcony was spacious with a small eating area and two lounging chairs. The staff were all extremely friendly, the hotel "peaceful" and cleaning staff always did a great job. We can't say enough great things about our trip to Waikiki and Aqua Pacific provided the perfect home base for us....everything was practically in walking distance.

We were staying at the Hilton and moved to this hotel. Way cheaper and we liked the quiet atmosphere of the place. Pool and hot tub are small but did the job of a late night swim. Loved that it's rooftop so we could enjoy the breeze in the hot tub. The rooms are perfect! The place could be a bit cleaner for sure though. Towels had some hair on them and the chairs were dirty. I would stay at this hotel again though. Totally worth it.

Really terrible experience ... We had our car towed from the hotel car park one night and missed our pre paid tour ... I have a family here with a 3 month old baby so our time is very limited ... We clearly displayed our ticket as per photo and they said it wasn't visible ... Anyway after a $40 taxi and $200 retrieval fee ... Loss of tour tickets $1803 hours later we got our car back ... Too late ... Hotel says they are not aligned with car park even though you sign a form at hotel check - in .... They should be telling people not to park here .... There are a number of car parks that would happily take the business .... After looking a numerous reviews and speaking to staff there has even been times when the staffs cars have been towed. I was also told "this is not our problem" by staff when I asked for their assistance in this matter.... Really unprofessional ...Please do yourself a favour and don't bother staying here as the management are not accountable - I tried to take this up with the General Manager but I was told on 4 occasions that she was in "meetings". This hotel needs to really man-up and stand up for their guests. I have never been scammed like this before and I have travelled the world ... Crazy ... Thanks for ruining our holiday AQUA Pacific ...

We checked in and were greeted by the friendliest staff. Danny informed us that we had been upgraded from a studio to room 902, a one bedroom with a large deck and great water view. The room was ultra comfortable and clean. Central to everything, a block from the beach. The pool is on the roof with many loungers and all day sun. One would be crazy to stay at a Beachfront hotel. Here, we were treated like family, there was no chaoticness around the pool and lobby and there are grocery stores and excellent restaurants all around. Our red eye departure was accompanied by late check out. I have stayed at a few places in Waikiki. This hotel is the BEST! Mahalo

Great hotel for the price, location is great 2 small blocks from beach. Staff were wonderful right from the start, Thanks Daniel and Robert for your help. Rooms are spacious and have everything need for a comfortable stay. House keeping is good too, even though they come around early. Parking is 25.00 a day. Also 15.00 resort fee covers wi fi, coffee, beach towels etc. Pool is on the roof , but the beach is your calling.

This is a condo hotel located about 3 blocks from the ocean in the middle of Waikiki.The hotel is about 31 stories tall with a rooftop pool, jacuzzi and sunning area. The end units are one bedrooms (about 450 Sq ft) with the non-end units being studios (about 350 sq ft) with kitchenettes. As a full disclosure, I like the studios so much that I bought one recently.The are several things I like about the building and units but I think the thing I am most impressed with is that the studios have one entire wall that is glass looking out onto the city. In addition that wall has sliding glass doors that open about 10-12 feet making it look like the entire one wall is open giving you a wonderful experience with the outside. With the great Hawaii weather relaxing in the unit with the doors completely open is great. The studios also have a lani with is about 3 feet wide going along the entire length of the unit. The one bedrooms have a substantial lanai that can accommodate several pieces of furniture and is on one of the four corners of the building. Many of both the one bedrooms an studios can be rented daily, weekly or monthly. I lave looked and many of the condo hotels in the Waikiki area and highly recommend the Pacific Monarch.

Hawaii was my first overseas trip so I thought it best I go 5 star, but my travelling companion advised, why spend all that money when we will be out of the room so much, just in it to sleep... so I took her advice and it was the best advice spent. The room was always immaculate (don't forget to leave your $1 tip on the pillow for the hard working cleaning staff!), the staff gracious - 24 hour service if you need anything, the staff could not help us enough. Loved the pool on the roof and it is so close to everything - only a walk away. Lots of fellow Aussies stayed at this hotel - it was safe, clean, comfortable with amazing balcony views - it was 5 star without the 5 star price. I can't wait to come back and will never stay anywhere else - without doubt it is my favourite place to stay anywhere, ever. Fabulous!

We love this place !It was our second visit and we had a lovely apartment with amazing views.Mahalo to Erica and Danny who went out of their way to make us feel welcome.The apartment was clean....towels fluffy and white...beds comfortable...Great value , a block from the beach.Love the lemony icy water in the lobby !Hope to return soon !Thank you ! The Nicholsons

We stayed at the Aqua Pacific Monarch for 4 nights. We had several problems with the hotel.1. We had ants in our bathroom and kitchen and after complaining on the 3 day they were gone.2. Our son was sick one night and they came to clean the room but did not off to move us for even one night to clean it properly.3. We were told on check in that our booking was inclusive of video hire and game hire. We were forced to pay this on check out and we were told that we misunderstood.4. We paid for our car park but the visa card wouldn't work in the machine and we where told there is nothing we can do but give you cash and that was no good to us.5. We could not sleep with the airconditioning on as it made to much noise and it was noisy with the balcony door open.6. It also has a level 13 (for those that care)

We stayed here for 5 nights on way back too Australia. We were a block back from the beach and central too everything we needed. The lobby was lovely and the staff happy and helpful upon checkin. Our bags were taken up too our apartment while we checked in, we were upgraded to an apartment a fabulous view - just what we needed after 8 weeks of travel.The apartment was clean and well presented albeit a bit dated but that didn't matter. Swimming pool on roof top, complimentary dvd pass and shuttle too shopping Centre. Cool lemon water in lobby, beach towels and chairs as well.

Quite nice. Was recommended by friends who we overlapped with while on holidays.Pluses-Fair value, very good location, close to beach (maybe 150 - 200m ), near ABC convenience stores, on the local bus route with stop just outside, the daily resort fee includes use of beach / pool towels and even little beach chairs. ( free )private Aqua Hotels shuttle to various places around town, just get on or off at the listed hotels. Great view from balcony, nice staff, lifts are reasonably quick (3 of them), plenty of car parking - never had to drive higher than say 3rd floor. Rental car places a 2 minute walk away. Swipe card security access after hours. Pool on roof 100% perfectly clean, with amazing views. Free Managers mini cocktails one night too. All in all a great place to base yourself if a) you dont want to spent $500 a night for beachfront or b) you dont want to stay way back near the canal, or in some 2 star place.Negs. - not too many, sure its a little 80s ish, but thats normal here.The time of year we visited, the weather was supberb, hot and yet not sticky . We never ran the A/C once....but it was a wall rattler mounted at floor height next to the bed. No issue for us..just saying.The only other thing was the noise. This has nothing to do with the Monarch... it is just a Waikiki thing. It is a very noisey place. With the balcony windows closed its ok...but this town must be where they test police sirens and noisey construction equiptment!There seems to be a never ending procession of Ambulances etc just driving around at about 50km/h with the worlds loudest sirens blaring?From the inside of the hotel the Monarch has done VERY well with regard to noise.We were next to the lift wells...and never heard a single thing. Didnt ever heard any typical hotel door slamming either.Summary = would stay again.Thanks

Pacific monarch is located just one block to the beach almost smack in the middle. just far enough back to not have the main road noise . Although I would recommend using earplugs if you are not used to big cities as there is constant noise going on.We booked a partial open view room which was awesome. I would recommend asking to be as high as possible to clear the couple of buildings in front and if you have the cash get rooms with number 22 or 3 to take advantage of the beach view. The staff here were fantastic. there are beach towels and chairs available. The only down side is that the units only have small noisy air conditioners. this will be our pace of choice if we come back to hawaii.Also they have a free shuttle around to their other hotels and Aloa Moana Shops.

Looking for reasonable priced accommodation, close to the beach then look no further.Note: the rooms are very small. So if travelling with teenagers be prepared.The upside is, a whole floor is dedicated (with great views) to a casual seating / relaxing area where you can go to read a book and chill out. Pool area has some fantastic views, but be careful on windy days.Staff were friendly, but on 2 occasions gave us wrong directions, so we decided to rely on Google to get around. Bus shuttle to the very large shopping centre is a bonus, but can get crowded.Waikiki beach is about 200 metres walk.This was disappointing for an Aussie as I had never been to a beach with so many stones.

This is a great choice for anyone who's trying to have a budget conscious Hawaii vacation. The pool was usually quiet, and the views from the roof are fantastic. There's a large hospitality room with great views and space to read or watch movies. Our room was nice and cozy without being overly small, and the kitchen was well stocked. We had a good city view from our lanai. The location is at the less busy end of Waikiki, close to the zoo and to a large park for kids to run around in. We were very close to the beach, several ABC stores, and lots of restaurants, and the Hyatt is right next door where you can rent a car, get a great coffee, or buy souvenirs or other goods. Staff are courteous but sometimes a little hard to track down: it's a big hotel, and at night they obviously have a smaller staff working. Parking was expensive, but this is typical for Waikiki. One elevator was being upgraded when we visited so getting to and from our room took a while, and our a/c unit was fairly noisy, but these were all minor issues. Overall it was a great stay, and we would definitely stay here again.

It is a condo building, so the rooms are more like small apartments. We booked a studio but were upgraded to a 1-br apartment on the 16th floor. The part-ocean view was enjoyable, rooms were clean and attended daily. Though the open balcony seemed a bit dangerous... The interiour looks dated but - clean and cozy. It came with a full equipped kitchen incl. mid-sized fridge and a huge oven (no oven pans though) which is quite pointless for a vacation I guess.. And the important thing- the doors are silent-proof! rooms are quiet and no noise from neighbours or hall. The only negative thing was that there is no wifi in rooftop pool area. In general we found it a reasonable price-quality deal in the area for the same day booking for around 130 USD per night.

2 blocks to the beach; 2 blocks to ABC storeS (a few!!); has a shuttle; pool on roof gets good sun and has excellent view of ocean; and view of what you can see of Diamond Head thru the tall nearby buildings. Kitchenette; dining table; small balcony. ONLY minor negative would be TV is not set up to be visible from lying in bed.
