review_body: A friend and I (two females) stayed at the Aqua Pacific Monarch in a one Bedroom Ocean view in October. We loved the balcony overlooking the ocean and spent many an evening having a quite drink after a long day, looking over the city and surf. the shuttle bus was excellent (even if a little crowded at times) and the drivers were fantastic, pointing out places to go and giving us a history lesson of the area. the pool was lovely and refreshing however there is not much shade on the roof. The hotel is in a great location and just a short stroll to the beach (approx. 3 minutes). Although the hotel is a little dated so are most of the hotels in the area and I believe that we booked a great hotel for the price. when walking back to the hotel on an evening after dinner/drinks etc we always felt safe which was a concern for us when booking. Other people have mentioned the lack of car parking however we never had an issue and always found a park. The only issue with our room that we had was that the shower/bath did not drain quick enough so on a few occasions you had a slight build up of water. I would definitely stay here again

We stayed at the Aqua Pacific Monarch for 3 nights in October/November 2015. Check in/out was quick and easy with friendly staff. Although we arrived well before check in time our room was ready for us. The location is fantastic, only about a 3 minute walk from the beach, and everything you need (groceries, bus stop, restaurants, shops etc) is within walking distance. The rooms were clean and comfortable, the shower was fantastic with great water pressure (sometimes hard to find in a hotel!) and was great value with a small kitchenette if you want to save some $$ by eating in (especially handy for breakfast). There was no real view from our room but it was very quiet, even on Halloween night. There is an Aqua shuttle that is included in the ‘resort fee’ that runs between various Aqua properties and the Ala Moana shopping centre, however it is often full (only seats about 12 people) and doesn’t appear to run to a set timetable so it's hard to tell if you’ve just missed one or how long you’ll have to wait until the next one comes along. However, I believe you can track its location with a web link, so this would not be an issue for those travelling with ready access to the internet. Compared to other properties in the area the resort fee is ok, $15 per day, but we certainly didn’t get any real use out of most of the ‘benefits’ that are included in the fee (such as dvd rentals and gaming units) but probably would be handy for those with children. The one big downside to our stay was the EXTREMELY loud air-conditioning unit. Ours was located at floor level and I noticed in some of the rooms they are right near the side of the bed. Something to consider if you are a light sleeper and/or like to sleep with the AC on. All in all we were very happy with our stay and would stay again.

The room was like a small apartment, with full kitchen, coffee maker, toaster, plates, pots, pans & utensils. Bedroom was its own room. Everything was clean and we could see the beach from our balcony two blocks away. Staff responded quickly to requests. I would go back there for sure! The pool is on the roof, and the hot tub was nice. Wifi was up & down.

The Pros:Location-one city block from beach.Walk to all restaurants and bars in Waikiki. The check in staff was super friendly and all staff that we came in contact with said hello to us. Had a superb corner room with a great view looking south down the city block to Waikiki beach on one side and of the quaint Kings Village shopping/waikiki & hotels view on the other side, which also allowed an awesome view of the Hilton Hawaiian Village Friday night fireworks.Updated, super clean, spacious room with granite counters kitchen/bathroom.Outfitted for 4 including towels.New hair dryer and bathroom amenities were replenished daily. Kitchen even had rice cooker.Had kitchen table with 4 chairs, queen sofa bed, as well as comfy queen bed/pillows.Spacious balcony with table & 4 chairs.Small closets had sufficient hangers. In room safe keypad safe came with the resort "fee" that almost all Waikiki hotels are charging now.Security is good here, with having to use your key to enter elevators and pool deck.The Cons:Not the fanciest lobby in this 1970's era hotel/condo, but it has sufficient seating if you are waiting for a ride.No big restaurant, but little coffee/tea shop & BBQ place nearby.The tub in the bathroom needed a small cosmetic fix on the outside but that was the only thing that could use improvement and even then it was not a big deal.This is an older Waikiki hotel that has gone through room renovations.The beautiful rooftop pool deck does not have elevator access. You do have to walk up 1 flight of stairs.WE WOULD DEFINITELY STAY HERE AGAIN.

I stayed in this hotel for 3 weeks, from early November until early December 2015. This hotel is mature and obviously undergone a relatively recent reno. The room was outstanding in terms of cleanliness – the kitchenette, fridge and associated area were immaculate (plenty of cutlery and etc. too). The lobby is small, and a snack bar is adjacent which was popular with guests and workers in the area (also a Korean BBQ joint is across the street and Japanese restaurant next door. Security was better than in some of the more “fancy” hotels, where by accident I ended up on residential floors – this hotel requires a key card to access both the lobby washrooms, the elevator lobby, and the rooftop pool. Even my luggage was well looked after even though I had an 8 hour wait before I left for the airport (not just dumped in an open area of the lobby) – early arriving guests had their cases equally well looked after. Too, even after you have booked out staff will provide you with key card for access to washrooms, showers, the sauna and Hospitality Suite.My room, 2905, gave me a pretty view of the ocean and sunsets, and on Friday nights I had a ringside seat to the Hilton Hawaii Village firework display. The room was a lot quieter than many in large hotels, fewer slamming doors and drawer banging at weird hours – My only complaints were parties on 2 Saturdays on the 30th floor. Shouting, scraping chairs and noises that sounded as if someone was about to crash through the ceiling went on until the wee hours. The rest of the time it was quiet. Guests included extended families, honeymooners, retired persons, and young families. There were teens with their parents, but on the whole they were quiet and pleasant, as were the young families with toddlers (many were Japanese).Staff were wonderful, from the front desk to the cleaning and maintenance crews. They speak numerous languages, which considering many of the guests are Japanese and Philippino was obviously appreciated. Staying at the hotel felt more like a visit to a family owned establishment, than one of a chain. Additionally, you get to meet fellow guests and the staff in a charming manager’s social event on Wednesdays (nice munchies and drinks).There are free daily newspapers in the lobby (useful to find out about local events – many free), and a shuttle to the Ala Moana shopping mall. Unfortunately, while I was there, there were 5 days of almost continuous rain and everyone seemed to decide to go shopping – as the Pacific Monarch is almost the last stop on the free shuttle route it was very often full by the time it arrived! However, across the street from the hotel is a bus stop where the No. 8 stops, which goes directly to the mall. If it is wet, the hotel supplies a limited number of umbrellas to guests.Overall the hotel is superb and great value in an expensive resort (there are cheap supermarkets in the vicinity but skip the ubiquitous pricey corner ABC stores). It is barely a 5 minute walk from Waikiki beach. Only downside was some nauseatingly badly behaved tween kids from “down under”. Despite their mother’s efforts they screamed, fought, dove (in a pool varying from 3’ to 5’ deep and prohibiting diving) and did cannon balls that soaked guests sunbathing in the small pool area. A number of guests, despite signs to contrary, took glasses plus bottles of wine and beer, into the pool and hot tub. Some parents also seemed to prefer sleeping than watching their kids, little more than toddlers, in the pool and tub areas – a liability to both the hotel and their careless parents, not to mention worrying more caring guests.As someone with limited mobility, I should mention that the elevator stops one staircase short of the pool deck. There are around a dozen steps from the last elevator stop to the pool deck. It is not wheelchair accessible.

We stayed at the monarch Dec 19 to 29. We were very lucky to have stayed on the 31st floor with great Ocean views. The room was large and the full kitchen came in handy with breakfast and the odd dinner cooked. (The food pantry is just down the road.) All of the staff from front desk to housekeeping to maintenance were extremely helpful and friendly and we could not fault them. They are all a credit to the hotel.The beach is a short walk and there is numerous food outlets near by. The Korean BBQ and the ice shave across the road were incredible. Would highly recommend.

Originally we had booked an apartment that could accommodate my whole family, but six days before we were about to leave I get an email from the owner saying she had double booked us for a few days and couldn't check in until 3 nights later. The only compensation she was offering was to remove the cleaning fee and of course not charge us for the days we weren't going to be staying. This completely annoyed me, and I refuse to give her our business any longer and asked for a refund of what we had paid to date. So that left us scrambling for a place to stay that could accommodate our large party. We eventually decided on Aqua Pacific Monarch based on hotel's location, consistent positive reviews and was within everyone's budget. Positives:- Rooms had a kitchenette which comprised of a electric stove, microwave, fridge and basic utensils for when you can make your own meals. - Fairly spacious room for my two young boys to move and play around in, and plenty of storage space for all our luggages. - The hotel is two short blocks away from the beach. The hotel is close to the nicer side of Waikiki beach where there's more sand real estate, and there was barricades to filter waves, so it was a very child friendly spot to swim. - Some great food joints within hotel's door step, (I strongly recommend that Korean BBQ place across the road) as well as various convenient stores for essentials. Staff were always friendly.- Guest collect beach towels and beach chairs for free from the front desk. We all stayed in studio style room apartment where there was a kitchenette and living room space.Negatives:- Although you can tell the room has elements of modern fixtures it's still quite outdated. The hotel is probably really old so it could do with a complete renovation - but that's just my opinion.- Weak air conditioning. None of the rooms have ducted or built in air conditioners, so there was a unit in one corner of the room that supplied all the cool air. If you're not in the room during the day it's fine, but we kept our thick curtains closed at all times to keep the heat out and cool air in. - Small bathroom with poor ventilation so would steam up quickly when taking hot showers.- Poor lighting in the room.- In our room house keeping was terrible. They would either not come so we'd have to call them to come in and do it, or arrive at 9am when we're still in the room. This happened everyday during our stay. - Although the hotel was close to the beach it was a little bit of a hike to the retailers and popular food joints. I don't mind walking however with young children four blocks to get anywhere can be challenging if a child is not in the mood for walking. - There was a free shuttle bus that would take guests to Ala Moana Mall but it was always full from collecting other guests from other hotels. Plus it only came around every 30 minutes. It was easier and quicker to catch a bus from across the road, buses that included Ala Moana Mall in it's route came every 5 minutes. It was under $3US a ticket from memory.Would I stay at Aqua Pacific Monarch again? No. There's are so many more other accommodation options available in Hawaii. Given we were forced to find an alternative so soon to our departure date, this was what we could find that met everyone's requirements.

This hotel is less than 2 minutes walk from Waikiki beach. and price is reasonable considering the location.It is good if you traveling on a budget and want to stay in a hotel where all the aciton is. It's great for a group of friends or family. Not a romantic setting kind of a place.Pros:1. Close to action in Waikiki2. Reasonable pricing3. Clean / Okay amenitiesCons:1. No breakfast / no restaurant / no kitchen in hotel2. Loud AC in room.

I've stayed at the Pacific Monarch in unit 2708 twice now and it's a great deal for Waikiki... a half block off the best part of Waikiki/Kuhio Beach Park, just behind the Hyatt Regency towers. While the unit is a studio, it's entire eastern wall is glass and made of sliding doors, so when open, creates a HUGE open space and one gorgeous view of mountains to the northeast, a good section of Diamondhead, and a large slice of the ocean and beach.The unit is always clean, as well as sheets/bedding and kitchen supplies. There are plenty of bath and beach towels. While the small kitchen doesn't have a range, there is a serviceable hot plate that was good enough to make eggs and the fridge is plenty large enough for anything you may need to keep cold. My only real complaint is that the small AC unit is dated and doesn't work very well. On hot nights, it can get a bit sweltering. I'd normally sleep with the sliding doors open to let in the cool air, but sometimes the street noise can get loud. Also, the stand-mounted fan had a broken switch and I had to jerry-rig it to keep it on.There's a 4 floor public garage in the building. While not cheap at $25 per day, the self-service parking ticket machine is easy to use and now has multi-day options, so you don't have to keep buying new tickets every day. A WARNING: ALWAYS keep your parking ticket viewable and FACE-UP on the dashboard of your car!!!! On my last day, I accidentally left the ticket upside-down and was towed VERY QUICKLY! A VERY EXPENSIVE MISTAKE! $120 including the Uber ride out to pick up the car at the tow company!Ali'i Beach Rentals makes it pretty easy to check in and the smart phone app is great for getting the door code and other instructions. Keep in mind that you'll need a key card to open the doors to the building off of the parking garage and Ali'i Beach Rentals either leave this key in an envelope at the front desk or will meet you in the lobby when you check in.All in all, Rita and the gang at Ali'i Beach Rentals have always been very responsive to my emails and calls and are always professional, yet friendly and very helpful!Aloha and Mahalo Ali'i Beach Rentals!

I recently stayed at Aqua Pacific Monarch with our family of three on the 24th floor Ocean View Apartment. We really enjoyed having the full kitchen to prepare breakfast and loved the balcony which enjoyed city views and Ocean views. Although Dated, our apartment was clean and serviced every day of our 8 night stay. A convenient 2 mins walk to the Duke statue and Waikiki Beach and the Food Pantry Grocery store was a must to stock up on supplies. The front desk staff were always welcoming, especially Danny and Erica, after a day out on the beach or when we were setting off on a tour, always willing to help with directions or anything we needed to know. The rooftop pool and spa has amazing views and was never overcrowded. If you are looking for value for money with an excellent location you should consider this Hotel. We will be returning to Aqua Pacific Monarch when we visit Waikiki again.

Staying there for 6 days with 1 and 4 years old.Pros1. Location, location, location - 5 min to beach  - 2 min to convince store (ABC store) - good musubi/Japanese bento restuarent down at the hotel - 5-10 min to main shopping area/mall2. Friendly staff (Danny, you are awesome)3. Free wifi4. Free beach towels5. Free shuttle busCons1. Absolutely not a hotel, it is a apartment stay, lower your expectation. Think as a motel stay, then you will be fine.2. Parking is $25 a day and very small parking area3. Some weird $15 per night hospitality charge4. Worst sofa bed, don't count as a extra bed, you can't sleep5. $30 charge per night for crip. Just go to target and buy playbed. Cheaper than rentng.6. Loud air conditioning unit. Can't sleep7. Building is old, means the carpet smells...My biggest complain -My flight was at 9pm, so asked for late checkout when i was checking in. They said i need to ask it again the day before if the room is available for late checkout at 3pm. Sure, i totally understand if hotel is busy. So, i did ask the day before, and they can extend to 1pm instead of 12pm. If i want to stay til 3pm, i have to pay $30!! So, room was available until 3pm, but they would not want to accommodate for free. Hmmm...really? Overall, bidget friendly / good location apartment stay. BTW, i stayed at full ocean view at 8th floor, but you don't see much of it. So, don't spend extra bucks for it. See photos.

This is a solid 4 star property, but for my expectations (clean, safe, secure place to rest during the day and sleep at night). I don't need a resort experience traveling to Hawaii. This is a basic condo-style property in the middle of Waikiki, two blocks from the beach and 3-4 from the Ala Wai canal. Everything you could want or need is within walking distance, or with a $2.50 ride on the city bus, aptly called "The Bus".I have no real complaints. My unit was very clean, some aged furniture but no big deal. The bathroom and kitchen fixtures/appliances appeared to be new (if not, very well maintained). A major plus is the fact that Iyasume Musubi, a Japanese cafe with delicious, cheap eats, is located on the ground floor of the hotel.A negative in my opinion is the fact that the property charges a taxable $15/day " resort fee" for some very basic amenities (shuttle bus, DVD rental, local newspaper, "water in the lobby"(?)). This is the case across the Aqua brand and I can't see why they can't simply raise rates a bit to offset the cost of these amenities, which surely do not add up to $15+tax/day/person. The result of them not doing this is them being able to advertise unrealistically low rates ($139/night I think for my stay), when the actual cost is higher. I've come to expect this, being a repeat Aqua customer and O'ahu visitor, but that doesn't mean that I do not like it.

Small suite unit but very attractive in good condition. Location is in the center of Waikiki close to everything. Nice pool and hot tub on the roof.parking was $25 per nite. A good mid level hotel. Staff were helpful. We have stayed here twice.

Sensational location, great staff who are very friendly. There is a pool and spa on the roof which was a sensational way to meet people. The building itself was pretty dated but that didnt bother us. My only problem was that the Wifi in our room wouldn't work and the fold out sofa bed was really old, the matterice was thin and uncomfortable. But overall, the location is unbeatable and its a great little gem if you are on a budget.

We stayed in a 1 bedroom part ocean view deluxe room for 9 nights. The room was smaller than we thought (by looking at photos) yet clean and very functional. Balcony is quite roomy however there isn't a light, we solved that by moving the lamp close to the door and leaving the curtains open (easy fix). The $15 a night hospitality fee (compulsory) was a bit annoying but apparently is everywhere in america. They give you free movie and playstation rentals, beach towels, beach seats, umbrellas and have a rooftop pool and spa. They also have a courtesy bus going to and from the ala mona shopping centre every 30minutes. Only 2 small blocks away from the beach. Food pantry (one of few grocery stores on the island) was just around the corner, as well as multiple foods places and abc stores. There is a tour shop around the corner (next to bottle shop) and the lady in there is very helpful. Perfect location. Free wifi was easy to access and use not slow at all.Danny and Johnny are loverly and will do anything to make your stay here the best. We had issues with our safe but a simple phone call to reception and they fixed it straight away. Johnny also use to be a concierge so he is full of very useful information! Only downer to the hotel was the sofa bed. you could feel the springs through the mattress, but we just asked for some extra blankets folded them us and put them between the bed and the mattress. Problem solved. Loved this hotel and would defiantly come again.

I enjoyed staying at Pacific Monarch, but it’s probably important to go there with the right level of expectation. This is a functional apartment hotel (serviced apartments), not a luxurious five-star hotel. I had a one-bedroom apartment with ocean view on the 23rd floor, which was quite spacious with a full kitchen, dining area, and balcony. The bedroom was small but sufficient and the bathroom was just fine but nothing special or memorable, more like what you might have at home. The view was great, framed by the two towers of the Hyatt but you do get to see a lot of the ocean, and on the balcony, the view of the mountains is very nice too. The apartment was in pretty good shape, especially the kitchen was very clean, though otherwise housekeeping could have been more thorough: there were crumbs on the floor that didn’t get cleaned during my entire stay. As other reviewers have noted, the a/c is very noisy and there’s no a/c in the bedroom, only a fan. That was enough for me even during an unseasonably hot November but if you like to live in fridge, it might not be cool enough. Wifi was very strong and reliable as was water pressure (which can be a concern on a high floor). Front desk staff were friendly and helpful, and while I found the $15 “hospitality fee” annoying, it’s common in Waikiki. The location is very good, two blocks away from the Food Pantry, which is the only real supermarket in Waikiki, and also just two blocks from the beach. I thought Pacific Monarch was a good choice for a self-catered stay in Waikiki, and I’ll probably go again.

Great location, 3 minutes walk to Waikiki beach and the Duke statue, just behind the Hyatt, where most tours pick-up, very convenient. We stayed on the 21 st floor, great sea- views, sunset, fireworks views. Studio is more than adequate for a couple, or a couple with 1 child. Fully equipped kitchen if you wan to cook, very comfortable king size bed, free and fast WIFI, free local calls. The unit had EVERYTHING needed for a beach holiday,eg. snorkeling equipment, beach chairs, books, playing cards, beach towels, kids beach equipment and toys. Certainly not 5 star, but super convenient to beach, transport. Food Pantry 3 min walk, several restaurants, shops etc. 2-3 min walk. I would book this place again.

we stayed here for 8 days, on the 29th floor, ocean view. Great stay, great spot, great views, 1 block back from waikiki beach. views wont be so great lower down, so ask to be placed as high as possible.

A fantastic place to stay. Very friendly and helpful staff. We stayed in a room higher up the hotel. Had beautiful views of Waikiki Bay. Couple of buildings in the way but could see more than enough. Was always something happening in Waikiki which you could see from the hotel. Rooms with kitchen, small dining & living were very clean and tidy. Bedding was 2 king singles pushed together. Was comfortable. Balcony was perfect. This hotel doesn't have a restaurant but they are all around you. Everything is so close. Shopping, restaurants, and everything else is only a bus ride away. You can get towels from reception for the beach. They also have iced water at reception as you walk in which is so refreshing in the heat. Lifts were slow and only 2 of them. Rooftop pool & spa was strong with chlorine. Don't forget the tipping. We actually stayed here May 2014 and this is where I'd book for the next visit.

My daughters and I are currently in the middle of our nine night stay. The room is perfect for the three of us with two single beds and a pullout couch. The pool although small is fine and the roof top view is awesome. The staff have all been friendly and helpful. Sonny the bus driver is great also.

This is actually a review of a condo we stayed in at the hotel. It was fantastic. A real home from home with everything you could ask for although we had a slight problem with the old style safe. Fantastic sea views. Great rooftop pool. Centrally located to shops, bars, beach. Would definitely stay again.

We stayed at this hotel when in Honolulu for a work conference. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The location was perfect, walking distance to many attractions and a two minute walk to the beach. We had a great view of the mountain and the beach from our huge balcony. Our room was a little tired looking but very clean. It was spacious and having the kitchenette made mornings very relaxed. This is not a hip or fancy hotel but it is central, clean and friendly.

Stayed 7 days oct 14, 2015 in a one bedroom suite with kitchen (you get to appreciate this if you found out how expensive it is to eat outside). It was a fully furnished kitchen including a rice cooker, toaster and a coffee maker. 3 mins walk to Waikiki beach (most kid friendly beach after paradise cove). Located close to everything, hence a little noisy. Roof top pool is better than other hotels. Gets crowded in the evening (anyway, we would rather be at the beach than the pool). There is an aqua shuttle every 30 mins that goes to the main areas of wakiki. Close to the public transit 'The Bus' stops close to the hotel - freq buses to all major attractions. On the last day, our flight was at 10 p.m., the hotel gave us until 1. p.m to vacate the room and then checked in the bags at concierge and use their pool as long as we needed until our flight departure. The hotel provided us with beach towels (large size) - this is very very useful, there is a small japanese eatery in the lobby selling at a very reasonable price compared to other places. There is a sauna (why in Hwawaii?) in the hotel which nobody uses. I can't say more, I am glad we booked this hotel.

We booked a disabled access room at the Aqua Pacific Monarch, Waikiki. My husband is in a wheelchair and the automatic door opener did not work which meant he could not get out of the room by himself. When reported to management they told us it would need a new part which was not available. We were not offered another room. A surcharge of $15 per day for servicing of your room (over the $300 per night) is charged. We had to request our room to be serviced on 3 of the 4 days we were there. Complimentary tea/coffee were not refilled, wet towels not removed, floor not swept or washed the entire time. A piece of broken glass was on the floor on arrival and still there on departure. A dead cockroach was on the floor for 2 days before departure and beads were on the bedroom floor the whole time. Friends at the same hotel had a toe nail on their couch on arrival, which was reported to management but was still there on departure. Would not recommend this place at all. Disgusting.

Had a room on the 18th floor with a spectacular view. There was an A/C unit but it wasn't quite cooling down the room enough, so we asked the front desk if they had any extra fans and they gave us a nice tower fan which really helped! Conveniently located, a 5 min walk to Waikiki Beach and shops. Would recommend for those looking for a nice place for a great price.

Location was great, room was average, cleanliness extremely poor. Maintenance non existent. For over $300 a night I would of expected a much higher quality, listed as a 4 star this one is not worthy of a 2 star. It was recommend by Qantas so thought it would be above average, so extremely disappointed, would I recommend this hotel absolutely NOT, awful.

We stayed here for our honeymoon. Although not luxurious, it suited our needs perfectly. It's a 5 minute walk to Waikiki beach and shops. The rooms are sufficient, especially if you're planning on exploring the island of Oahu throughout the day. The luxuries are not needed. Rooms are a little dated and ours had a slight musty smell but it wasn't an issue. As long as we had a bed, TV, wifi (free) and air con, we were happy! Free DVD rental from reception together with free shuttle bus service. Beautiful view of the sunset over Waikiki beach! Would definitely recommend for those on a budget or those who don't want to blow money on overpriced luxury hotels! Staff were exceptionally friendly and even gave us a free box of chocolate coated macadamias as a cheeky honeymoon gift.

Keeping in mind you get what you pay for this Hotel is excellent value for money.Location location location.2 minutes to the main beach, 5 minutes to a handful of fine eating establishments and 10 minutes from the main street shopping!

This was my wife's first trip to Hawaii and we stayed here on a friends recommendation in May 2014. As we did not have or need a car and as public transport in Hawaai is so good, car parking was not an issue for us.We rented a self contained apartment which had everything we needed. The room was old, but in good condition., the beds were comfortable. Grocery shops and restaurants were within walking distance. There was a little noise from the roads below, but not objectionable. I have stayed in places with far worse road noise. Road noise is a fact of life in any big city when you stay near the centre of town. The air conditioner was a little noisy and could do with being replaced, but it was not needed at night anyway. The roof top pool was great with a great view of the ocean. We also had a partial ocean view room and we could see the ocean. However, I don't go to places like Hawaii to sit in a hotel room all day!I would give this 4 stars except the hotel put through an authorization charge of $AUD1000 instead of $AUD1 on my credit card and did not cancel it. I did not realize that until I got home and checked my statement, during the trip it meant I had $AUD1000 less to spend which stopped us from doing a day trip to The Big Island. The money was credited back, but my bank did require me to get an email from them stating their mistake so my bank would cancel the charge. Was it an honest mistake or an attempt at fraud? I don't know. They fixed it up pretty quickly when asked about it.

This is our fourth time in Oahu, each time staying at Pacific Monarch - a different room each time. At all times have the staff been friendly, courteous and efficient - extremely.This time we stayed as a family of 4 adults and one infant - Room 2906.As per other reviews, yes, the a/c did leave a bit to be desired and the fold up bed was uncomfortable, but as these are being reviewed by Management then they will get better.Location is excellent, close enough to the Beach area but far enough away from the main traffic area, being quieter.it was easy to get to restaurants and obtaining grocery items.The free shuttle is a great idea, but, yes, it was a lottery to get a seat each time, but this will get better?Danny needs a special mention as he has always been a great servant for help and advice as well as being an exceptional person - thanks Danny.We definitely will be staying here again.

We loved our stay at Aqua Pacific Monarch. 2 blocks from the beach/strip, clean well kept apartment with everything we needed for a comfortable stay. Kids were happy with rooftop pool and PlayStation in the apartment. Would highly recommended to families with young kids. Danny on the front desk would always greet us with a smile, and nothing was too

We were upgraded to a partial ocean view 1 bedroom apartment on the 29th floor with was great. The desk was great and could fit 4 people and was a great spot to have a drink and relax in the evenings.The rooms were clean and seemed recently refurbished and the kitchen was a reasonable size.The pool on the room had a great view but got busier after 4pm as people seemed to return from the beach after that time.There are a few construction sites not far away so during the day you do hear some noise but if you are out of your room doing things during the day it should not bother you.There is a food pantry store not far away where you can buy food supplies.Once you check out you can leave your bags with reception to look after for the day.

It takes only 5minutes to the statue of the Duke.10minutes to Cheesecake factory.All staffs are very kind expect Japanese staff.She had no smile.I felt she doesn't like Japanese tourist.The swimming pool on the top of this was nice view,but it was not so big.Korean restaurant in front of it was cheap and yammy.Breakfast was about 10$,stakes set was 15$.

From bottom to the top this place is great !Entrance is imposing with massive floor to ceiling doors and it's a really high ceilingFantastic front end staff who can't do enough to help.Then 33 floors of quality accomodation, not new but well maintained .Awesome roof top pool and spa with a sauna and family room underneath. Do yourself a favour when you stay here get the ace an view room it is so worth it

We spent 5 nights in a 1bedroom apartment this week. Excellent location and only 5 minutes to central Waikiki beach. We were on the 18th floor with a partial sea view. Very comfortable and well equipped apartment. Serviced daily with very plant staff

Was a little weary before booking my long-term stay after reading past reviews. Me and family stayed here for two months and don't have a single complaint- only positive things to say! The management all has been very kind, helpful and routinely go out of their way to ensure our comfort and convenience in staying here. Raymond was especially kind and helpful to me and family. Room was great for the price and after requesting a tower fan to help route cool air towards the bedroom, had a very pleasant room temperature all day and night. The ocean view was breathtaking. Had zero issues with parking (follow the instructions and you won't have problems as mentioned on other reviews). Overall I would highly recommend staying here and plan on returning in the future! Aloha

We have stayed at this hotel over the years. Brand new carpeting was installed while we we here two years ago. This is more condo then hotel. Our room is cleaned every day. The staff our friendly and helpful. The down side is the air conditioning it's not effective. We chose the Diamond Head sidewith a beautiful view, but the morning sun after coming up heats up the room, so we have to close up the doors and shades, until the sun moves. After that it's great.The fee for each room is $75 for our stay, which gives us access to a Sony PS3 to watch unlimited movies and ga,Es. It also includes a free shuttle service, no need to rent a car or take the bus.unlimited access t movies and games on the Sony PS 3

Stayed here for 5 nights in a studio with kitchenette. Lovely views of the sea and mountains. Great size room with excellent facilities. Fully serviced each day with plenty of soft towels etc. Easy walk to the beach or if you prefer swimming in the very good roof top pool. Shuttle bus service provided was great. Only problem there were only expensive restaurant nearby, so a room with a kitchen/kitchenette is highly recommended.

If you want to ruin your holidays at Hawaii, you are very welcome to stay at Aqua Pacific Moarch. We stayed for 6 nights here, and it turned our Hawaii vacation into a total nightmare!! 1. During our 7-day stay, water never stopped dropping from somewhere high above the hotel building just in front of the hotel entrance. There is even puddles right there!! Moreover, there is construction going on around the hotel. Instead of soothing sounds of waves, noise of construction will be your company. Of course, nothing about puddles nor noise were informed in advanced.2. During our 7-day stay, none of the hotel staff is smiling. Maybe it is because we are not English native speaker, the staff were always frowning when they found out they could not understand us whenever we tried to ask for help. What is more surprising is that even the Japanese staff was not smiling. We felt totally unwelcome despite we paid quite a sum to this hotel.3. We traveled with our 1.5-year-old son, and I believe the hotel was also aware of it before our arrival. Nonetheless, the hotel offered us a room with twin beds put in the middle of the room. In order to prevent our son from falling down from the bed, we moved the heavy beds against the wall. When we came back the next evening, something magic happened! The heavy beds were moved back to the original location!! The next morning, we wrote a note to tell the housekeeper that we have a 1.5-year-old son, and the reason why we need the bed against the wall. However, the beds were put back again to the original location when we came back later that evening. However, the note was put on the dresser so it is certain that the note must be written. I called the reception to negotiate this problem. The nigh-duty staff just kept saying “ The housekeeper is not in the hotel anymore, call again tomorrow morning.” “I could not promise anything but tell your situation to our boss.” The next morning, I wrote a note again, but this time with tips. In God we trust, the beds were finally not moved back again later that evening. 4. The room facilities are in such a poor condition that we kept asking ourselves if we had been in a developing country? The air conditioner is as loud as airplane engines. We could not fell asleep at all if the air conditioner had not been turned off. Moreover, even if we tried to adjust the temperature and the fan speed, they never changed!! What better is that the wind is coming right to the position where the pillows were!! How comfortable it was!! 5. From the very first day, the water was leaking from the pipe under the sink. After the hotel tried to fix it, the water was leaking both from the tap and the pipe under the sink. How marvelous it was! 　After a new tap was changed for us, the bathtub stopper was broken!! Not to mention the quality of the shampoo and shower gel were so bad that our son felt itchy after using them.Everyday we were worried about anything would be broken again during our stay. How lucky we were. 6. The hygiene is also bad! Dried blood stains were found on the mattress!! I cannot believe it was the hygiene standard of a hotel at Waikiki beach, Honolulu. Our stay at Aqua Pacific Monarch was a total catastrophe. We will never ever stay at this hotel again.

Booked Aqua Pacific Monarch for our party of 4 couples. We requested 4 partial ocean view studios all on the same floor and our request was met. One couple also got upgraded to the 1 Bedroom Ocean View Apartment which was considerably roomier. The 1 Bedroom Ocean View Apartment has a good sized balcony with table and chairs and excellent ocean views. A great spot to have a drink and relax!The view from the partial ocean view studio was excellent, we could sit in the bed and see the ocean. The rooms were clean and seemed recently refurbished. Wifi worked well.The location for this property cannot be beat, especially in terms of value. You are only a couple of blocks back from the beach and there are plenty of restaurants and food options very close.Highly recommend!!

Only two blocks from the beach , but it's not more then 3 minutes walking. The air condition in the room is tiny, noisy and somehow inefficient but is durable. the kitchen/kitchenet is extremely helpfull as the restaurant prices are mostly high.The supermarket "food penetry" is minutes walking and offer a high variety.The studio room is a bit tiny but you will not spend to much in it.

Cosy one bedroom apartment, kitchen, sofa bed, friendly staff, pool and spa which is relaxing, close to shops and bus stop across road, they have a shuttle that comes hourly.. central to beach and restaurants. Leisure walks around waikiki..

We had a week here in June and it was a great location for a family of four to explore Waikiki from. We had a one bedroom ocean view room which had plenty of space for the four of us for the short time we were in the room and a kitchenette so we could have breakfast in each day. The view was amazing and the beach to the left of the hotel was great for the kids to swim with some protection from the surf. The food pantry a block away was also super handy for breakfast and snacks and had a much better variety of food than the ABC stores. The free DVD hire was great for the nights when we were all too exhausted to go out and the managers reception was also good.

By no means do we consider ourselves financially well off and we work hard for our money. With that being said, if we plan to splurge on a family vacation for the four of us, you can believe that we will thoroughly research for THE best accommodations for our budget. Here is our breakdown of the AQUA PACIFIC MONARCH HOTEL:Location: Being centrally located in Waikiki, we never needed to take the bus, it was a short walk to everything we wanted to see or do in the area. Literally, within minute(s) from the hotel, you can walk to many souvenir shops and high-end stores, countless eateries, a grocery store, ATM machines and car rental counters.Highlight: You will be just 2 short blocks (3 minute walk) from Kuhio & Waikiki Beaches.Hotel: We're not ones to care much about the outer appearance of a hotel, we care more about the inside. You are not going to find a landscaped waterfall or dolphins swimming in a lagoon, at the AQUA PACIFIC MONARCH HOTEL you will find nothing fancy, just a clean and well kept building with 2 restaurants on one side and the hotel's public parking entrance on the other.Highlight: Both restaurants within the hotel are very good and very affordable.Room: We can only speak for our room, we did not get a chance to peer in any other rooms. We were fortunate to get an upper floor corner room with a bedroom and we had both an ocean view and a city view and it was well worth the paying the extra for it. The rooms were large and the furnishings were clean and adequate. The full sized refrigerator came in handy when storing a case of water and our leftovers.Highlight: The lanai (outdoor balcony) was large and had a round dining table and chairs, perfect for eating our meals and enjoying the million dollar views of the ocean and Waikiki's skyline. More time was spent in the lanai than inside the actual room!Hotel Amenities: Beach towels-we took full advantage and grabbed the towels every day when heading out to the beach. Daily newspaper-grab them early. Pool/Jacuzzi-can get crowded at times but sun deck is huge enough to accommodate everybody. DVD/PlayStation Game kiosk-we did not use...watch a movie in the room or go explore paradise? The choice was easy! The AQUA shuttle to and from Ala Moana Mall-used only once. A lot of times it fills up and you have to wait for the next shuttle (30+ minutes) and it stops at each AQUA hotel for pick-up/drop off. Highlight: If you have a lower room where the views are okay, go to the roof where the pool is located. The views are spectacular!Cons: Of course not every hotel is perfect. The good news is that the AQUA PACIFIC MONARCH HOTEL did not have very many. A/C Units-For such large rooms, there is one small unit in the main living area not in the bedroom. We could leave in the morning and return at night with the unit on at full blast and we come back to a room that was meagerly cool and warm bedroom at best. There was an overhead fan in the bedroom that circulated the warm air around.Mirror-The females in our group found this hard to adjust to. We can't speak for other rooms, but there was no full length mirror to use.Sofa bed-As an adult, I wouldn't want to sleep on it for more than a night, you feel the metal support bars really fast. For my kids, they had no complaints sleeping on it for 9 nights.Laundry Area-For a large hotel that is family friendly, there were just three operational washers (top load) and 6 or 8 dryers. Maybe it was bad timing but all were in use whenever we attempted to use.Garage-$25/night to park your car..ouch! It's a public garage with no discounts to guests.Elevators-with three elevators servicing 30 floors, there could be a wait for a crowded elevator. From the lobby, you can see maybe 2 of the three elevators moving at best.BOTTOM LINE: Would we stay here again? We're already planning our return! The AQUA PACIFIC MONARCH HOTEL was THE best hotel for our family. The most important thing was that everyone, including my children loved this hotel and the conveniences that came with it.Highlight: The staff. Professional, courteous and eager to please. From the lobby staff, the maids on the floors, the guy cleaning the garage areas to the manager herself, everyone was genuinely nice and made you feel that your questions and concerns were their top priority. MAHALO!

We have stayed twice. The first time our two children were 6 and 9. We stayed in a one bedroom room with a kitchen. The kids shared the fold out lounge for a bed and at their ages it was fine. Three years later, same room but the fold out lounge was a little lumper for them and not as comfortable. The location is fantastic for families as Kuhio Beach Park is a two minute walk. The Food Pantry is a 10min walk for breaky and dinner supplies and plenty of other cafés and restaurant options in walking distance. The air conditioner was in the lounge room so it got very hot in the main bedroom but was too noisy at night to open the balcony door. Stay 14 nights and the room price drops. Reception were friendly and prompt every time we blocked the toilet! Only twice. Loved the roof top pool with fantastic views. Big parking station but Costly for long term parking. Highly recommend. On check out there were quite a few extra taxes which bumped the price up a little.
