Thirroul, New South Wales, Australia

review_body: Very good location. A short walk to main beach area. Services offered are good...but dont rely on them. Eg shuttle bus to Ala Moana Centre. This bus services all the Aqua hotels but only seats 12. It runs every 45 mins so its likely youll have to catch the bus as the shuttle is full or is late. Internet in your room is intermittent. Pool is small and gets very busy in the afternoons. View, however from the rooftop is awesome. Kitchenette is good - has everything you need and the supermarket is closeby.Ok. The staff. The front desk staff do not give a consistent message. The answers depend on who you ask. Consierge really only knows whats in the brochures. Not keen to know much else. Maintenance man is very hardworking but shouldnt have to be!!Bathroom is TINY but they do try to make good use of the limited space.The couch as a bed is very uncomfortable.This hotel has 31 floors but only three lifts. Which means you have to always wait for one.Dont expect to sit on your balcony. Its only 30cm wide!All that said, its very quiet. No banging doors when people leave for early morning flights.

Have stayed here 4 times now and have always been impressed with the service and the accommodation.My friend and I shared a 1 bedroom ocean view apartment, which had a kitchen and two balconies. At approx $200 p/night this represents excellent value for the location. The room was clean and very comfortable, with a full sized dining table and plenty of room for us both. Staff are friendly and it's a short walk to the beach and everything Waikiki has to offer. Will definitely stay here again if I'm lucky enough to return to Hawaii.

Good hotel and centrally located a couple of blocks back from the beach. Stayed in room 1004 which was a large room with balcony. There was a large bed, lounge, dining table with 4 seats, small desk and a kitchenette with all utensils. Didn’t use the kitchen much as ate out all the time. The bathroom was very small but adequate. Room is on street side with a little bit of noise but didn't bother us. Staff very helpful especially with changing money to smaller notes needed for tips and public transport. There is a compulsory US$15 service fee per day which includes free wifi, newspapers, swim towels and free shuttle to Ala Moana Shopping Centre with stops in between. Down side would be the small bathroom and there was an airconditioning unit on the floor right next to the bed which blew onto the person on that side of the bed. Ended up switching it off and opening the balcony door for the night. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

The views from the pool (on roof) were amazing. Could see the entire Waikiki landscape. The rooms were good but a little dated but other than that the team were friendly, location fantastic and surrounded by shops. Would recommend.

room 1108. city view studio. stayed 4 nites June 2015. I stay in hotels over 90 nites per year. this room, which I booked for pleasure, is the Best User Convenient Room that I have been in. It is a studio about 11ft x 35ft. with kitchenette.with utensils/dishes- even rice cooker . had one large bed with end tables,dining table with six chairs, large sofa (probably sofa/bed), coffee table. desk with play station apparatus. floor to ceiling windows to 2ft x 35ft balcony which overlooked over thousands of residential windows and balconies. (city view- other view option not offered/available on Aqua booking site).best facilities of room. indivdidual wi-fi equipment./account large wall mounted flat screen TV with swivel arm that extended out and can tilt up and down. FOUR table lamps with rocket type switches with TWO electrical outlets each. ( some pictures of rooms show wall mounted lamps on each side of bed-no outlets) .The room appeared to have be renovated less than a year ago. The soap products were of high quality. The pool deck facilities on roof was a great plus.There is a mandatory daily user fee which included the wi-fi.Aqua Pacific Monarch is at a convenient loaction, only two blocks to Waikiki Beach and the super market.remarks. this is a condo building-most units are operated as hotel. there are cooking smells in the hallways. building is at corner of city streets. on 11th floor. streets sounds can be heard. the air conditioner is next to the bed. the beach towels are issued with pool cards from the front desk. this was a nuisance as front desk is often busy checking in and out guests. One time they did not have pool card to give back on return of beach towels so entry had to be made in guest folio in computer.I would stay at the Aqua Pacific Monarch again.

Stayed at the Aqua Pacific Monarch this June. The room was exactly as appears in the pictures, the perfect three star hotel in Honolulu. Location was perfect, 2 minute walk to the beach and the main tourist area. The room was clean and kitchenette was great.Free shuttle to the shopping centre was great as well. This hotel is a great option if you are on a bit of budget and can't afford to stay right on the beach. Free wifi as well worked perfectly which is rare to find in hotels in Hawaii. All round great stay.

Booked this hotel from NZ online after much searching and deciding. We were two couples having a week in Waikiki before flying to Maui. Hard to get a place with two bedrooms, a deck and a kitchen at a reasonable price. So ended up with one bedroom and a pull out bed in living area.This place was very good. Excellent front of house service and the maintenance men are excellent. From switching on wifi, showing you how to work oven and coffee machine and fix any minor issues. Free phone call locally. Good wifi. Big deck. Full kitchen although being kiwis we had to buy a plunger for decent coffee. Bed great. Though the pullout bed for adults could be of a higher quality. But was ok. Room service fantastic . Place very clean. Included in hospitality $15 U.S. fee are beach towels, shuttle to shopping complex, wifi etc. We stayed on penthouse level. Also you can arrange late checkout and they will keep your bags safe and you can make use of pool area upstairs on rooftop - showers and toilets. So pretty good for Kiwis catching the late flight home

Pros: stunningly beautiful ocean view, nice staff. Cons: unfortunately, too many cons. The interiors are old, dated, shabby and worn. Bedding is old, poor quality and badly worn. Bed uncomfortable and sofa sleeper horrible for poor ones who had to sleep there. The area is far too small to accommodate 4 people as described. The furniture is large and clunky which makes crowding worse. The terrace was nice but unfortunately was in full sun, no breeze from late am till after dark so wasn't usable. FINAL KICKER: THERE IS NO CENTRAL AIR. THE HEAT IS BRUTAL IN THE BEDROOM (no sleeping til wee hours) AS WELL AS THE BATH. There is a very small a/c window style unit mounted in the common area at FLOOR LEVER UNDER A DESK! The a/c location prevents any of the small bits of air getting to BR or bath. It is brutal and I do not exaggerate this matter. We were most disappointed and were brutally hot throughout our stay in the hotel.

Upon checking in to Pacific Monarch a security charge was supposedly placed on our credit card which we expected. What actually happened was we were charged $US260. When we checked out we were charged our full account and it wasn't until we returned home and checked our credit card account that we realised that we had been overcharged by the said $US260. My wife emailed Pacific Monarch straight away but we received no response from them at all. A second email elicited the response that it was only a security hold and that they had asked their bank to release it. Nothing happened. To cut a long story short Pacific Monarch did not contact us unless we contacted them. Extremely poor service. We finally did get our money back but only because we were persistent.If this had not happened I would have rated this place somewhere just below a 4. Our room (one bedroom ocean view) was fine, the staff at reception were great and the location is superb. It's just a shame that back office staff were less than helpful.

The staff were very friendly and amenities good. Unfortunately the bed was like a rock and we felt that soured the holiday a bit - you really need a good sleep when you are on holidays!! But with a good bed you would have a great stay.

We rented the condo 2404 at Pacific Monarch for 4 nights in july. The location was the best as is right on the heart of Waikiki and only 5 min walk to the Duke statue. The condo provide beach chair, Umbraller. A small buggie board and a set of snorkel. Plenty of beach towels. A jug of icy cold filted water in the fridge is a nice touch. Shower is good but the bathroom is bit small. The condo is ok for 2 people up to 2 young kids. Elain the owner was very efficient to communicate with and the manager Deborah was very helpful. The big open view from the room was very nice with partial Ocean, city high rises and mountain in the distance as it is on the 24th floor. The down side of this condo would be the bed and pillow weren't very comfy. The aircon didn't work efficient enough to cool the room and is a bit lound to leave it on over night. The curtain did my head in every time try to open and shut...if you stay there make sure you try the Karean BBQ restaurant across the road from the building, the best bbq beef and chicken. Also must try Wolfgang's steakhouse, highend restaurant but the best steak and service in Hawaii ! Overoll we enjoyed ourstay at this condo as we didnt need to rent a car. Eveything is closeby.

It's location is excellent and the views from our room were brilliant but unfortunately the good stopped there...The air conditioning is insufficient for the room - it cooled one space but not the whole room. For a infant bed get ready to pay $30 offer night. The dust and used condom remnants under the bed are evidence of average cleaning. The bath didn't work at all and couldn't be fixed.On several occasions we had to wait 10 mins for a lift to get to our from our floor - it turns out that the hotel had shut down 2 of the 3 lifts for their uses. Our room cost a premium and for that I clearly expect much better. I don't recommend this place :)

We stayed for 3 nights in a partial oceanview room. The room was good given the pricepoint. Like all other hotels in the Waikiki, there is $25/night parking. The location as great. Just a 2 minute walk to Waikiki beach, shopping and restaurants. We found a great Korean BBQ takeout place just outside this hotel that was really good. The overall condition of the hotel is a 3-star IMHO, but we hardly were in our room as there is so much to do in OAHU

Great location, only two minutes walk from Waikiki beach but set back from the main road. A little noisy and the sofa bed in the one-bedroom apartment is not the most comfortable. However, it is very clean, staff are friendly and helpful. There is parking available for an extra 25$ per day. Kitchen is pretty well equipped. Pool has a spectacular view from the roof.

We had a 1 beedroom partial ocean view room on the 7th floor with a kitchen, the room was very nicely set up, very clean and looked exactly like the pictures. The front desk staff are so incredibly polite and helpful they really do go the extra mile for the customers. The location was perfect walking distance to everything you needed. The views from the rooftop pool area are stunning it's a must to go up there and have a look when it's night time the view is incredible! Would definitely recommend this to anyone who is travelling to Waikiki as it was such an amazing place to stay !!

Very food staff, friendly and so helpful, the one room appartments are very spacious and kept very clean. The bonus is the rooftop swimming pool with a great view. The hotel is close to all the restaurants and bus routs as well as the beach.

Have just returned home after spending 13 nights. Studio apartment with kitchenett on the 23rd floor with great views. The negative aspects of this room were, and I guess this has something to do with the age of the building, which I would put at around 40 years are:Air conditioning unit is way too small and noisy as hell. The room always felt as if you were sleeping in a sauna.The pull out sofa mattress is like sleeping on a bed of nails. We had to get them to put some foam on top, to at least cushion the impact marginally.We found the staff to be pretty good however, and the shuttle service good.You have to go next door to the Bamboo to make any tour bookings, and the girl there was very good.Overall average hotel that needs a lot of infrastructure upgrading, particularly when they are charging you around $330/night

Our first night we arrived we had booked a studio with a partial ocean view. We were told by our agent it would have full kitchen etc but turned out to be only basic so the next day I asked about an upgrade to a 1 bedroom which we looked at and loved as it had a full deck, full kitchen and views to die for overlooking waikiki beach. The hotel was very clean and any problems were sorted pretty promptly, thanks for a very relaxing holiday would recommend this hotel as it is only 1 block back from the beach and very handy to everything.

This hotel is located one block from the famed Waikiki Beach and is an economical property for its location. The roof features a hot tub/Jacuzzi and a pool. The view is amazing The top of Diamond Head is visible as well as the Waikiki Beach area. The lush valleys of Manoa and the University district were stunning. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was spacious with a full bed and a pullout sofa bed. Standard amenities were provided.
user_name:
Randy D
Wailuku, Hawaii, United States

review_body: Room was OK, pull out couch uncomfortable, no jug in room and very very rude security guard came up. Complained to management formally about him but still awaiting a response 1 month later! Would not stay here again ever. Plus things, nice pool, great shuttle service with friendly drivers and front reception were polite.

I have stayed on the ocean every time I have been to Waikiki, but decided try something a little less expensive and I am happy I did. The room was a 1 bedroom with a kitchen. It was clean the pictures depicted the room correctly. The elevators are a little slow, but I really liked the lobby and the atmosphere. More importantly, this hotel is within walking distance of everything you'd want to do at night and a block and a half from the grocery store. I would definitely stay here again.

Not appealing from outside but check in was great, very helpful staff. Room on 17th Floor was great but stinking hot when we arrived around 11pm. Hunted for air conditioner to find a small unit on the floor. The room was excellent in size and had been done up recently with new furniture and mini-kitchen. My only problem was the room was hot all the time. The air con never got the room below 77F and was usually in the mid 80F. The problem was the air con was on the floor and blowing directly on the bed area. So sleeping with the air on was a must but it blew on you all night! The free shuttle to Ala Moana shopping centre was excellent! Nice hotel but don't get room 1705

I stayed here for 6 nights, this hotel is in a perfect location. On a main road, & a very short walk to the beach main road. Like 2-3mins. Very Central & close to absolutely everything, in walking distance to everything. Bus stop practically at front door. The staff were very nice & polite. Especially Maria at front desk, she was awesome. My room was exactly as described. I was on 28 th floor. Part ocean view. Which was great. Bathroom had shampoo, conditioner, as well as other stuff. Just one gripe the air conditioner was beside the bed & very noisy. It was also very good the hotel had its complimentary shuttle to the ala moama shopping centre. Across road from hotel I got the most delicious crushed ice. The melon flavour is yummmmm. I have already recommended this hotel& I will return here.

As all others mention, great location with lots of good food choices not far away. One block up and there is food pantry which was a great supermarket for our apartment. We absolutely loved our apartment. The balcony this high up had amazing views and the kitchen and lounge were perfect for our holiday. We spent many afternoons chilling watching the surfers and people go about their holiday. We didnt use the air con but left our doors open to get the nice breeze. Full sized fridge oven were also handy. The wifi in this room was perfect, full signal and quick speeds. We got the paper downstairs for the nightly tv guide and if you get sundays paper it has the full week. We also took up the dvd rentals that were available which were great to have. The rooms were cleaned well every day. We did find that reception staff were not as "Happy" and we often had to say good morning first or didnt even get eye contact (not like bali or thailand happy if you know what i mean) they were not rude but we did notice the difference. Check in was a bit hectic with the lady not speaking strong english and trying to explain the security holding fee ($50) then resort fee of ($16 with tax) per day and when they would be charged. The free shuttle bus is handy but the bus if usually full and the driver frustrated with having to tell people no. There is a bus stop on the other side near food pantry $2.50 and it will get u to the shopping centre so dont be afraid to use it. There are also trolly bus's that u can get that go up that way as well. There is a rubbish shoot in the hallway if your bins get full too. Me bbq across the road is fantastic so check out my review on that. Abc store one stop up is also very handy with well priced wine beer and other essentials. The hyatt hotel is infront and normally the pick up stop for a lot of tours. We loved our stay in this one bedroom apartment. It was perfect for the resting part without feeling like you are missing out on the beach or hiding in your room. Pull the blinds, open the windows and doors and soak up waikiki! While not being cheap its the best deal for what you get in waikiki with the balcony or the mid price range. 9 nights was about 2500 Aud after tax and conversion.

This hotel had the best staff from the moment we walked into the reception.It may not be appealing from the outside but don't be put off.The rooms are fabulous - perhaps they may need to have a few more Queen size beds but, hey that's our only gripe!Loved, loved, loved staying here and would do it again in a heart beat.Perfectly positioned in the Waikiki area!

I have just come back from Hawaii after staying at Aqua Pacific Monarch for 12 nights with 2 friends. We absolutely loved it! All my requests were met (early check in, higher floor room, best views). We had no problems aside from our balcony door. It became a bit stiff to slide open and that was fixed almost immediately. I was shocked at how close the beach was to our hotel! We walked everywhere and didn't need to ever catch a taxi as their free shuttle service took us to Ala Moana whenever we wanted and everything we needed was at our doorstep.I work in the travel industry, so my expectations are pretty high. Customer service plays a huge role in the success of a hotel and Aqua Pacific Monarch exceeded my expectations. I highly recommend this hotel to everyone for the price, the location and the service. I'll be coming back for sure!!

This is a perfect place if you need a kitchen and to be right by the beach. Save on car rental/food. Everything you need is conveniently located near by.The only down side is its always extremely windy at the pool and also its not that quite, since its right in the middle of the city, but almost every room has amazing views..

Wonderful place and the staff are amazing. We were in the one bedroom ocean view and the views were stunning and it is literally a 2 minute walk to the beautiful beach. The rooms were clean and cleaned daily. The room has a kitchen which we cooked in a few times. There is a free shuttle that takes you to the main shopping centre. Everyone we dealt with was so lovely and we will not hesitate to stay here again. What a great experience and want to thank all the staff for their efforts.

Have just stayed here for 5 days. This is a real find and is only a 3 minute walk to the main strip and beach. We have a 1 bedroom which has a pull out double sofa in the main living area so easily sleeps 3 or 4. The full size fridge is great plus stove and microwave.we paid extra for a beach view and balcony and it is so worth the extra $$$. The rooftop pool is fine with spa and laundry on 3rd floor. Rooms cleaned every day plus towels but bed linen every 3 days.Wifi so fast and included in $15 daily resort fee.Worth noting..if you arrive early before check in there is a Hospitality Room on rooftop where you can wait and even have a quiet snooze. Will definitely stay here again.

This hotel has it all: Location, terrific views if you book oceanview room or suite,very short walk to Waikiki Beach. 2 streets away from Hyatt Regency where many tours load and unload. Great variety of shopping and places to eat are all just easy walk from this hotel. Internet cafe is 1/2 block away for those needing computer/printers.Can't think of one nit to pick and that's a lot coming from this old curmudgeon!!!

Aqua Pacific Monarch is located in the heart of Waikiki, situated across the road from the beach. Offering spacious studios and 1 Bedroom Suites, with kitchenettes or full kitchens. Rooftop pool with views of the ocean. Also has a jet spa and sauna on the Rooftop. Wi-Fi internet access is available in all rooms/hospitality room/Pool area and Lobby area. Has its own Jinroku Japanese Restaurant, located on the 1st floor. Staffs are very hospitable and friendly.

We are staying here for a month and a half and we love it. We are moving on the island and were kinda lost with all the things we had to do, especially staying at the hotel with two babies... it isn't easy. But the hotel is great for that, you have access to movies, a pool, a jacuzzi, a sauna...they have a little aquarium in front of the elevator that the kids love.Only bad point for us: the pool is tiled and it is slippery. but other than that, the hotel is great, the location is perfect, close to everything you can need. Also something that could be improved: the "newsletter" about what is happening in the area can only be found in the elevator, I would suggest putting a board on the lobby so we could take time to read it (or if there is one, i didn t find it and so make it more visible:) )The staff is nice and i want to give a special mention to Daniel who helped us with every question we had and went the extra mile to help us every time. Always happy, smiling, nice and ready to help anyway he can. We definitely love him and are thankful for all he did for us. Maria also helped a lot and was able to answer all the questions i had. Quality and not too expensive or the area, I would recommend this place without a doubt.

We stayed here in April for 8 nights. We are a family of 4, with two daughters aged 6 and 9.We chose to stay here based on the strength of the TA reviews and the price. We are delighted with our choice and we will stay here again without hesitation.It is not a 5 star hotel. Nor is it beach front. . In saying that it is not beach front, we had partial ocean views and the beach is only a short walk (2 small blocks).We stayed in a one bedroom apartment. We had the comfortable queensize bed (I think it was this size anyway) and the kids stayed in the comfortable sofa bed. The sofa bed arrangement might not suit everyone, but it was fine for us. I am not sure if it would work with older kids? I did see staff with a rollaway bed one day.Maybe this is an option.The Aqua Pacific Monarch suited us as we wanted reasonably priced accommodation for our family, and we also wanted a kitchen where we could prepare meals. We enjoyed having breakfast on our balcony, especially those few mornings where we had a little sleep in. We did not actually cook dinner in our room, but we could have if we wanted to. We often bought lunch at the ABC stores and came home to eat it on the kitchen table.We found that we did not need to use the air conditioner. We actually slept with the doors open, as surprisingly , there were no bugs/mosquitoes flying in the room at night (Most Aussies will know what I am talking about)!We used the free shuttle to Ala Moana. This was handy!We loved the beach towel service.The staff without exception were polite and helpful. We felt welcome and we felt part of the hotel community. Several guests that I spoke to , were loving their visit at the hotel, with one Aussie saying he would not stay anywhere else and he has been coming to Hawaii for years.Housekeeping provided an excellent daily service, thank you. It was good also to be able to use the wash and dryer laundry facilities at a reasonable cost (From memory $1:75 each)My kids enjoyed the pool on the roof top (Amazing views).The spa looked inviting but we did not use it.We did not use the Playstation or the complimentary DVD's either ,but might on the next occasion.The hotel staff were helpful with directions and recommendations. There was a weekly sign in the reception showing various things that were happening in the Waikiki area.I enquired about beach chairs and beach umbrellas on the last day. Apparently there are chairs available but no umbrellas. Complimentary umbrellas would be my only suggestion for improvement (I might have to bring my own umbrella next time as the daily rental is worth more than the cost of a brolly in Australia).We are already planning our next trip to Hawaii, and hope to stay here again. It was perfect for us, and I miss it already.Me and my husband had a very comfortable bed, queensize from memory. Our girls slept on a sofa bed in the lounge room. This probably was not the most ideal situation,

Just spent 7 days at this hotel. Stayed in a studio with kitchenette. First of all the pictures shown online are exactly what the room looks like. A Family of 4 could make this work very nice. Room had dining table, couch with coffee table and end tables. The couch has a pull out bed. A desk with a PS3 to play games or watch movies. The Wifi router was in the room and worked just fine. Earlier reviews may have been before updates. I used ipad with no issues. There is a 15.00 a day fee not included but it gives you unlimited game and movie rentals. Also beach chair and umbrella use. Also included in fee is a shuttle to local hotels and beach plus mall. Very nice and clean room with granite tops and tile in the bathroom. The balcony sliding glass doors open up almost the whole room to the outside.Location : It is a 4 min. walk to the beach right in the center of Waikiki beach.Food : Dozens of places to eat within walking distance. My kids of course are picky and didn't want to take in the local flavor so Mcdonalds, Sudway, Burger King right around the corner. You can walk out the door and there is a Korean BBQ place that's good plus a real healthy cafe next door.Downside : The balcony is about 2 feet wide. Your are really only able to just stand out there. No chair or table space. Was still nice though. Pool on the roof is 34 floors high so there is a lot of wind.For the price this place was a home run.

My husband and I just finished a "stay-cation" here and really had a good time. Everything in Waikiki was within walking distance and if you are a local, the scent of Korean BBQ across the street will just make your stay better. Spa and pool were great, surpassed only by the view from the pool deck at sunset. If you like to cook a little to save money, this unit had the best equipped kitchenette I have ever seen. You can cook almost any meal with what this little kitchen has; just no baking :) We were right next to the elevator but never heard a sound from the hall or elevator.

An error in arrival date forced us to look for another hotel that could accomodate my family from April 19-28, 2015. The search led us to this hotel which is nearer to the beach than the first one who could not accomodate our request of an earlier arrival date. Aside from a weak AC unit in our room, everything else is A-okay from the time of our arrival with the hospitality and friendly smiles of the hotel staff. Danny, Maria, Cherlotta, and the housekeeping staff were very accomodating and helpful. Will definitely return for another stay based on this very nice and warm experience.. Aloha!!Btw, the first hotel charged us a day even though the cancellation fell within their "free cancellation period". For the record and in fairness, we cancelled because they could not accomodate us arriving a day earlier of the booking date.

This is the 2nd time we stayed at the Pacific Monarch and we chose this hotel for our 2nd trip because we were very pleased on our first stay. We had friends stay at this hotel with us this time based on our first recommendation and they were impressed as well. The employees are very friendly and go out of their way to assist. It nice to hear "Aloha" with a smile every time you enter the lobby. The roof top pool provides amazing views in all directions. The hospitality room is a fantastic surprise when compared to other hotels' hospitality rooms.I had family staying in another hotel close by and they paid more $/night, their rooms were outdated and the hospitality room ended up being half the size of their room with a couch & bathroom...while ours was half of the floor with windows all around, large couch with 2 chairs, large tv, several sets of table & chairs as well as 2 bathrooms and a separate shower...no comparison!! (especially if your flight doesn't leave until the evening). Once a week, the hotel has a Manage's reception in the hospitality room where you get a chance to talk to other guests and staff and enjoy a drink with munchies.Our room had a little kitchenette which worked out great for snacks & lunches. Even though there isn't a restaurant in the hotel, it's located just a couple of blocks from the main street where most of the restaurants and shops are. The location is just far enough from the action for peace & quiet but close enough to the action for access quickly at any time.We are already planning another trip to Hawaii and plan on staying at the Pacific Monarch again! It's not a 5 star hotel with a restaurant & spa...but it is clean, has a great location, the staff is the best, the price is competitive and when you really think about it...how much time are you going to spend in your hotel room in Waikiki compared to the time you are going spend out on the beach enjoying the fantastic weather? Save all your money for shopping and excursions

You are greeted by friendly smiles and an overwhelming response from staff to meet your needs as soon as you step inside the hotel. Every staff member acknowledged your presence daily and the service from all staff was exceptional. It is a home away from home where the staff became part of your family. The rooms were comfortable and spacious and cleaned to a very high standard. The location was central to all amenities and you never had to walk a far distance to get to where you needed to be. The beach was a hop, skip and a jump away...very handy indeed. Free shuttles were provided to take you to the shopping mall and the shuttle drivers were very friendly and helpful. I will never forget how my soul felt when I left this place...replenished and vitalised by the powerful energy of aloha that surrounded me while being there. I also felt saddened when we left and was so grateful to Raymond Yoshimura (guest services manager) and Kauika (Aquarium Monitor, Luggage Handler, Reception etc) for saying goodbye while our shuttle left and waving to us as we were leaving. The experience I had there was magical and empowering. Thank you Aqua Pacific Monarch

The true value of a hotel is the "experience" while you are there and the staff without exception demonstrate "aloha" every day. We could not recommend this hotel enough from the check-in to the free Aqua shuttle drivers, the manager and the managers reception, the front desk staff to our cleaners, it is the holiday experience you never want to end! Great location and the rooms themselves were exactly like the pictures not that we spent a whole lot of time in there!At the risk of missing someone out we have to say a special thanks to Uncle Raymond, Koaika and Danny who were always there to save the day with a million dollar smile and always a helping hand. These people are golden!Nga mihi aroha ki nga kaimahi o Aqua Pacific Monarch.Aloha, a hui ho!The Maori girls from the land of the long white cloud...Aotearoa New Zealand xox
user_name:
Marlene H
Rotorua District, New Zealand

review_body: We stayed here 7 years ago with 2 kids aged 11 and 9 and I'm so glad we returned last month for 10 days with the kids aged 18 and 16.We have been back to Waikiki 4 times in between and the Pacific Monarch is right up there with the best of them.A hidden gem 2 streets back from the main part of Waikiki beach ( Dukes Statue ) behind the Hyatt.5 minute easy walk to the beach.I booked direct with Raymond and got exactly what I asked for as Ive stayed before-a 1 bedroom kitchenette ocean view on a high floor.Rooms clean,spacious and well maintained.Daniel on reception was so nice.Nothing was a problem.Everyone very attentive.Cheaper resort fee than others and wi fi not a problem.3 lifts all very fast.Nice roof top pool and spa.There is no gym.Seroiusly you cannot go wrong with this Hotel.Highly highly recomemmended.Cant wait to r

Stayed here with my mum for 12 nights in March.We used to stay somewhere else till I read the bad reviews so we stayed here for the first time and it wont be the last.Would definately stay here again.The room was so spaceous and light.Very clean, nice to see no mould in the bathroom as many hotels do.We were on the 22nd floor with a loveley view of daimond head and Waikiki beach.The staff from the people who cleaned our rooms and throughout the hotel were more than pleasant and nothing was too much trouble for them, also the the drivers who took us to Ala Moana shopping centre.Very good value for money for this standard of hotel.

As this was our 5th trip back to Honolulu we were apprehensive about this Hotel, but we did not have to worry. We had booked a1 bedroom suite with kitchen and ocean views up high and that is exactly what we got. Right from the start the staff at the front desk were brilliant as were the rest of the staff throughout. We were there for a full 2weeks and could not fault a thing. We got exactly what we had asked for with the most beautiful view over waikiki on the 23rd floor. We would definitely come back to this Hotel in the future, so thanks again to all staff for a wonderful stay. Mahalo to everyone at Aqua Pacific Monarch

Finally the hotel room pictures paint a true picture of the rooms & they are fantastic! I booked a studio & you get a large room with double bed (almost 2 rooms), dining table for 4, nice lounge, playstation, shuttle to shops & outstanding customer service. I will come again next year! It is only one block back from the beach. Prices are excellent, people are friendly. I didn't use the pool or restaurant but both looked good. Yes the building is old but most buildings in Waikiki are oldish. If you want to get really good value & not be stuck in typical hotel box try this out!

We booked this hotel not really knowing what to expect. We got a studio with an ocean view that was stunning the room was clean and kitchen was fully equipped with everything you need. Roof top spa and pool was nice too.

This hotel has so much potential. I loved the location and the view from the rooftop pool is absolutely stunning.But here's why I'd probably never go back:Small rooms, loud and barely functional A/C. We spent the first hour or so troubleshooting the internet because we couldn't connect to it. The staff was courteous enough to help us out - but even once after we were connected, it was absolutely unusable. Water pressure for shower is awful, and the stove for the kitchen top was so weak that it took forever to boil water. There's no fitness centre - although a run on the Waikiki Beach under the scorching sun more than makes up for it!We're supposedly here during peak season - and with added daily service fee + parking cost, the price we paid for doesn’t justify the experience.

We spent 10 days here, great service, close to everything. The staff was friendly and always helpful. Within walking distance to beach and shopping. The rooms were kept clean, and had a full kitchenette. The staff was helpful in booking tours, picked up at the door, and delivered us back. Enjoyed everything about it, might not be a 5* but all we needed.

Very nice and clean and staff was excellent! Rooms are a great size with fully stocked kitchenette. Service was great and location is excellent. Towel service for beach use is very convenient. The only suggestion I have for improvement would be to have computers available to guests for printing boarding passes.

We stayed at the Aqua Pacific Monarch for 2 weeks in February. Due to change in flights, we had to find accommodation at short notice, and there was not much available in Waikiki for the dates we wanted. We went with Pacific Monarch, and Im so glad we did. The hotel is not located on the beach from, but is a few streets back on Kuhio Avenue, which is a main street, and only 2 minutes walk from the bus stop. They have a free shuttle, that takes you to the Ala Moana and back daily, which was great. We walked there a few times, but it is great when you have been shopping and dont want to carry all your bags. :) The shuttle drivers were lovely, and very helpful. We stayed in a studio room on the 28th floor. It was a bit small for 4 people, but I am not complaining. It accommodated our needs. If we wanted more space, we could have booked a bigger room. It was good to have a kitchen, and gave us the option to cook our own food. We had a kettle, microwave, stove, fridge, coffee machine, utensils, sink, plates etc. The hotel is about 1 minute walk to the beach front, and about 30 seconds to the nearest ABC store. The staff were professional, friendly and very helpful.The rooftop pool was awesome. Always clean. The spa was also great too. I have read a few reviews from people complaining about the noise. I did not find this a problem at all. Sure, you hear a few screams from people on a Friday and Saturday night, but I think you would hear that at any hotel.All in all. I will surely be staying at the Pacific Monarch when I next come to Waikiki.

We had a 1 bedroom apartment with a kitchen, bathroom and balcony was small the roof top pool is a good size but if windy it’s very breezy. We mainly used hotel to freshen up and sleep after a very long day of sigh seeing so this was great for us, great location 2 blocks away from Waikiki beach, walking distance from tours pick up and drop off point and restaurants, trolley tram stop across the road. The ABC shop at the corner if you needed a late snack.Friendly staff, tour desk very helpful and knowledgeable organised our tour and always tried to get the best tour at the best prices for us.If travelling with kids you have the zoo 4 blocks away and the aquaria about 5 blocks away all within walking distance. If you’re thinking of hiring a car it's very cheap, but be careful find out with the hotel you’re staying at if they charge for car park. The Aqua Pacific charges US$25 a day we thought that was steep.Overall a great Hotel and definitely will stay there next time

We had a 1 bedroom partial view room. Great property, great location. Staff very helpful. Probably wouldnt want to be up on floor 29 though. The only thing i would say is. friends we went with had a studio room, the balconies are not big enough to put table and chairs on, you would need to book at least a 1 bedroom if you want to sit out on your balcony. But also my friend requested 2 twin beds and the sofa bed. But she got a double bed and sofa bed, they offered to move her a couple of days later but she decided not to. So i would just check your booking direct with hotel am i getting what i asked for. But apart from that great property.

We stayed four nights in one bedroom suite. Hotel was remodeled but room still in old fashion. Personnel was professional and friendly. Rooms were cleaned. Full kitchen gave you some freedom. Fantastic view from balcony. Great location - 1 block from beach. A lot food places around. Garage is little tiny and entrance to garage is little difficult. Pool on the roof is awesome!Airconditioner was in the living room only - no central a/c at all!

The Hotel is getting weared and has a small kitchen with very limited equipment for cooking. Its very noisy already from 4 AM where sleeping was impossible. The location in Honolulu is good if you dont want yo pay for a beach front Hotel.

I had gone to the Pacific Monarch before in the past, but wanted to broaden my hotel choices....NEVER again! It was an absolute nightmare! The Pacific Monarch staff was so accommodating, nice and professional! Even after picking a hostel like hotel for virtually the same price, they gave me an AWESOME room! I've visited Oahu three times, twice at this hotel and will only go here after this! It's like a home away from home!They have-Refrigerator-Stove-Microwave-Kitchen UtensilsYou can cook your own meals! I was so tired of eating out every single day! Cooking and lounging is an option again!

The proximity of the hotel to the beach is great. It is a 5 minute very maximum walk to Waikiki Beach. You are behind the Hyatt Hotel. The hotel provides you with beach towels and beach chairs. The hotel is close (5 min walk) to retail shops which are located on the main road (Kalakaua Ave). There are ABC shops everywhere and they can provide you with basic amenities and groceries ie drinks, bread etc. There is a big SafeWays grocery store located about 20min walk away but found it expensive. The free wifi in your hotel room and hotel foyer is great. We had a studio apartment ocean view for 3 adults and it was great. Had a kitchenette, balcony, everything you need. Great ocean views from the apartment and also from the balcony which had a table and chairs. The hotel provides a free shuttle service which is fast and convenient. It runs along the major road, from Diamond Head right to the Ala Moana Shopping Centre. Staff were friendly and helpful. Hotel is also located near public transport bus stops, so you can get around Honolulu to the tourist spots in-expensively this way ie Pearl Harbour, Diamond Head (approx US$2.50 each way). Very glad we chose this hotel and not an apartment building near the Marina, as is quite a distance away.Definately recommend this hotel for location, amenities and price. Also a good family hotel/apartments if you have children.

Great hotel for the location and price given that Hawaii is expensive even by Australian standards. Had two ocean front 1 bedroom apartments on the 14th floor for 7 nights. Exactly as shown on website. Hotel had good amenities, thought I too struggle with the additional $15 daily service fee charged extra, which I believe is common amongst other accommodation houses. Staff were wonderful and an asset to the hotel. We felt safe and secure. Enjoyed the Managers reception for meeting other travellers but didn't get to the meet the Manager, not sure he or she was there. Absolutely in the thick of all the action. Couple of tips, the higher you are up the less the early morning street noise (not the hotels problem) but it doesn't let up 7 days a week from about 4am! Don't be tempted to use the car hire place on the corner opposite the hotel, go to Alomona or Enterprise in the same block much cheaper. Great housekeeping staff, wanted to bring her home! Close to the beach, handy to all you could want. Will definitely stay there again and will highly recommend our friends and family to use this hotel. See you again!

We stayed at the APM for 9 nights... Great choice of hotel... 2 blocks from Waikiki beach, 1 block to the Pantry Grocery Store, and right on major bus route! Staff very friendly and like the provide flavored water at the front desk! Stayed in 1 bedroom suite with ocean view on 21st floor... Room nice, clean, just enough amenities to cook ourselves and the housekeepers did a good job of tiding and providing us with dish soap, kitchen cloths, etc.Pool area very nice (wish they had a palm tree or 2 up there to make it feel more tropical) ONLY complaint... This $15 a night Hospitality Fee... Not included in the price is I paid when I booked the room... Only told about it when we checked in... At that point what option do you have but to pay it... Honestly.. $15 a night is way too steep.. They say for pool, free DVD & XboxRentals (which we used) and common room (on rooftop) I can see this charge if you are renting one of the privately owned suites but when booking directly with the hotel this should be included in your room charge... This all being said.. Would stay here again if I came to Waikiki!

We arrived early in the day 0830 as we were coming of the island cruise,our was not ready at this time but staff directed to a really nice waiting area on the top floor tv lounge till our room was ready ,this was much appreciated.nice central location James Mitchell .lake country b.c.

We have stayed at the Pacific Monarch many times. The top floors with the suite option offer great views and a spacious lanai. Restaurants, shopping and the beach are just steps away. Staff at the front desk are friendly and the room cleaning crew is top notch. Yes, there are many other upscale and fancier looking hotels in Waikiki. But it's the staff that keeps us coming back to the Pacific Monarch.

Stayed here Dec 21 - 25 on a Hawaiian Air travel package. No major problems. Our room had one bedroom, one bath, kitchenette, sofa bed.Adequate parking ($25 per day), better than some of the cramped parking stalls in many Waikiki hotels. Parking is on the 2nd to 5th floors. We had no problems finding a spot (they do not guarantee a spot and the parking is public) during this time, Try the 4th and 5th floors as everyone seems to grab the first spots they see. I parked with the ramps behind me for ease of backing out. You need your room card to get back in from the parking stalls else you have to walk down to the front desk and to get to the elevators. Since Waikiki has many one way streets, get a GPS or familiarize yourself with the streets beforehand. Driving was not a major problem if you take it easy and pay attention.At the top, they have a swimming pool and hot tub with a great panoramic view of Waikiki and Honolulu. There is an enclosed lounge (sink and tables) with a great view. Daily housekeeping and daily Honolulu Star Advertiser newspaper in the lobby.We were on the 17th floor (1707). Room have a kItchen, refrigerator, stove, etc. Short walk along Kuhio Avenue to restaurants and shopping. Room doors had a 1 inch gap so you can hear floor traffic and conversations. You can stand on the "balcony" but there is no room for a table and chairs to seat outside and enjoy your breakfast unlike other hotels. No washer/dryer in the condo. There is a coin operated laundry in the parking facility (ask the front desk).Since you are in Waikiki, you can hear the police and fire sirens at night. The view was not that great but then again if you are staying 24/7 in a hotel room in Oahu then "why are you actually here?", you should be out at the crack of dawn and be staggering back in late at night being a tourist. About 2 and a half blocks to Kuhio Beach. Kuhio Beach is a safe beach with a sea wall providing a safe shallow swimming area for children, non swimmers. Get a face mask and snorkel and you can find Hawaiian reef fish along the sea wall. The hotel gives you a "towel card" that you trade in for a beach towel. (Make sure that you give back ALL your cards when you check out as there is a $30 charge for any missing beach towels).If you do not want to swim at Kuhio, walk about 3 more blocks towards Diamond Head (across from the Honolulu Zoo) to Queen's Beach for open ocean and a rockier bottom (with a lot more and larger reef fish, think "free but smaller " Hanauma Bay without the parking problems, drive and fees).If you have kids, there is a Makittii Buffet (2380 Kuhio Avenue) about a 3 minute walk away on Kuhio. Since you have a condo, the closest grocery is Food Pantry (2370 Kuhio Avenue) about a 2 minute walk, close to Makittii. If you have a rental car or want to use the Bus, try Don Quijote (801 Kaheka Street), a local complete grocery store about 1.8 miles away near Ala Moana Shopping Center with an outdoor food court and Asian deli indoors with tourist goodies, bakery, produce. (They have their own web site so you can check their ads, do a Google seach for "Don Quijote Honolulu store").Wal Mart is about 2 miles away (700 Keeaumoku Street) near Ala Moana. Costco is at 525 Alakawa Street about 5.5 miles away (hit them on the way in from the airport). There is a second Honolulu Costco at 333 Keahole Street abut 8.5 miles away, head toward Hanauma Bay out of Waikiki. I think that they started charging a $15 daily convenience fee (ask the hotel staff) which includes a shuttle to Ala Moana Shopping Center about 2 miles away. Since we made our reservations out in April 2014, there was no resort or extra fees at that time. If you are shipping goodies back and want to make sure that your boxes or luggage is 50 lbs or less, ask the front desk to use their "hand scale" to weigh your stuff.

The location of these apartments is right in the centre of Waikiki, one short block away from the beach and the main Street with excellent restaurants nearby. The rooftop pool is also a bonus with great beach views. Also very handy to have a kitchen rather than just a small room like your usual hotel. Not the fanciest hotel in Waikiki but I would definitely stay there again!

We had a wonderful experience staying at Aqua Pacific Monarch. The location is perfect which is near to Waikiki beach, great restaurants, and with free ride to Ala Moana shopping center. Staff were very accommodating and special mention tomMaria and Danny for the excellent service. We would love to stay again in this hotel.

We stayed at this expensive hotel for 3 nights, out of which one was spent in Kauai. The hotel is fairly close to the airport. Transportation: No need to take any airport shuttle to get to the hotel. The cost for a taxi from the airport to the hotel is around $50 - not including luggage. The SpeediShuttle costs $60 while being shared with other passengers. Although renting a car is always an option, I would strongly recommend against doing so - the daily parking is around $25, plus car rental tends to be rather high (unless you have some kind of corporate discount - in which case the rate goes down rather steeply and makes renting worth your while, even in Hawaii). Include costs of gas, additional parking whenever you go to some other place and soon you are looking are real money. Taxis are plentiful and tend to be available at all the touristy spots. Dining: There are plenty of dining areas and watering holes near the hotel. Take your pick from Italian, Mexican, and local fare. Shopping: Although we never went shopping, we were led to believe that there is plenty of shopping also nearby.Attractions: The three attractions we visited were Pearl Harbor (separate review), Waikiki beach (beautiful beyond words to those who don't have beaches in their backyard - coming from New Jersey, the beach was ... meh ... compared to Miami and Myrtle beach and Cape May) and Diamond Head (separate review).Accommodations: Although the pictures accompanying this review are dark, rest assured that their so-called studio is actually a one-bedroom hotel. Coming from NJ, my definition of a studio is much more restrictive - a single room. Our unit had a sitting room with a queen-sized sofa-bed, a small glass top dining table with two chairs and another table with a couple of chairs. The balcony (or Lanai as Hawaiians tend to refer to them) was spacious with two chairs and a table and was accessible from the bedroom as well as the sitting room. The space on the balcony in front of the bedroom was very limited. Service: We had booked this from a service called booking dot com and we were told as we were checking in that we only had a city view unit. Which is factually correct. But if you stepped out to the balcony, you could clearly see the ocean - albeit just slices of it between a couple of buildings - in front of Waikiki beach. The cleaning service did a decent job. But they do NOT clean the utensils left over in the sink. Amenities: There is a full kitchen, including a full size fridge and a sink with hand dishwashing fluid and a scrubber available. There were bowls, plates, spoons, serving spoons, 3-4 heating utensils - and an electric stove with 4 burners. The exhaust vents into the room itself, so be careful with heating flavourful dishes - you have to live with the odours for the remaining time. The bathroom is good, the water pressure was good. Everything was working fine. The air conditioning is next to the dining area, close to the balcony and is only able to cool a few square feet around that area. The bedroom and the sitting room do NOT get cooled by the (rather loud) air conditioner. We were fortunate we visited at a time when there was no need for the AC. The queen size sofa-bed is truly enough for two normal sized adults. We asked for additional pillows and sheets and got many - as many as we wanted. Overall: We were very happy, with four of us - myself, my wife and two teenage children - with the place.

We stayed at the Pacific Monarch for 5 nights during the last leg of our Hawaiian vacation. I will try and summarize the pros and cons in order to keep this review short:Pros: (i) excellent location - it is a short walk to Waikiki bay, super close to some great restaurants and shopping centers; also very close to Diamond Head.(ii) friendly staff;(iii) great views from the hotel.Cons:(i) parking- the parking area in the hotel building do not belong to the hotel and are run by another company. The towing policy is brutal.. although we prepaid our parking our rental car was still towed after we left the car unattended for approx 30-40 mins taking our beach gear, towels etc back to the hotel room (our fault - we were on vacation mode). Because we did not rent a car on our first day, the hotel check-in did not place emphasis on how brutal the towing is there. Be aware! Display your parking ticket for example upside down - your car will be towed. It took a $34 cab ride at night to a dodgy neighborhood and only $198 later to retrieve the car - do not expect any assistance from the hotel since they do not run the parking.

Stayed here for two nights during Christmas break. Bathrooms are outdated. Parking is at a adjacent public parking place which is not easy to park for big vehicles. Charging the same price as some of the better hotels in that area, but does not have amenities as the other hotels. If you do not find any other place to stay, stay here. The only good thing I found here is it has a kitchen and they provide lot of kitchen tools if you plan on cooking.

We stayed here for 10 days in late November to Early December.My thoughts:The hotel, it is located a couple blocks back from the southern end of Waikiki beach, in an area that was primarily hotels but with some residential houses/apartments as well. Me and the girls I was staying with felt safe walking around at night as there are lots of other people around usually.Within 10 minutes walk of the hotel was everything that you need, from food options, shopping, most of the trolley/bus routes (including to Ala Moana and Waikele Premium Outlets), a lovely stretch of Waikiki beach, but less crowded than further north and many entertainment options.Check-in was smooth and quick, my friends showed up a couple days before I did and they had no issues, even though I was the one who booked the accommodation. Staff were friendly and knowledgeable.The room, we got a room on the 10th floor, room 1007 and it was a good quality 1 bedroom apartment, the furniture was of an acceptable quality, it wasn't "high end" but it was mid-range which is what we paid for and was comfortable so no complaints.We could see the ocean from our balcony, for being on a busy street corner and in Waikiki in general, we didn't notice much traffic noise except a couple times with all the windows and door open and then only during daytime, at night there was no issues for us with noise.What I really liked was that we got a full kitchen (one of the main reasons we chose this hotel) including a proper sized fridge, oven and appliances. This was good as it meant we could store food in the fridge/cupboards so we didn't have to eat out every meal, which brought the food costs down.Bathroom was good, everything worked and the shower pressure was better than I get at home.Air conditioning did a good job keeping the room at a decent temperature.Beds, the main room was taken by the girls and they said it was super comfy, I got the sofa bed, I found it comfortable.We didn't make use of the hotel pool/spa/common areas that were at the top of the hotel, but we did go up for a look and the views were spectacular (couple are included in photos). The definite highlight of our trip though was Mary-Ann on the tours desk, she was super helpful, helping us book rental cars, tours, luaus and just being a really nice person to sit down and chat to, even when she was struggling with allergies she was a pleasure and super cheerful.All in all, everything was great during my stay, I would recommend this hotel if you are looking for somewhere to stay that has a decent location, is comfortable and doesn't break the bank (as quite a few hotels in Waikiki can).If I come to Waikiki again I plan on staying here again.

We enjoyed our stay at the Aqua Pacific Monarch hotel in Honolulu. The staff were very pleasant and friendly. The room was clean with a cute kitchen. Maria at the front desk was so helpful and always provided great service. We recommend this hotel to everyone. Thank you!

The hotel was fantastic!! I can't say enough good things about it. Great location, close to the beach, transit stops and everything else you need in Waikiki! We had a studio and it was perfect for the two of us. The kitchenette was perfect and we had breakfast and dinner there on day, as food pantry was close for grocery shopping. I would definitely recommend this hotel!! The best thing is check out is at 12pm and with a flight at 1130pm, they let me still have access to the pool and stored my luggage, so I could still enjoy my day!! Thank you so much!!

We had stayed at this hotel about 6 years ago. The location is very good, close to shopping, restaurants, bus service. This being a condo/hotel some of the rooms are not furnished to hotel standards i.e. different types of beds, odd assortment of furniture, closets have condo owners stuff stored in the closet. The air conditioning is not adequate for the size of the room & where it is located, close to the floor & next to the bed. Unless you move the night table in front of the unit, one gets the blast of air in your face. This was a comment that other guests made. The Wifi was inconsistent, worked intermittently, telephone was old & had difficulty with the sound/audio. Staff was friendly & helpful. I would not stay here again as there are better other choices. If one was to book a room ask specifically if the room is a hotel room or condo unit.

We stayed at the hotel for a week.The staff were consistently helpful - Daniel, Danny, Charlita, and especially Maria, as she helped us with a nicer room (2006) when it became available, which had beach views from the balcony. Our room was clean & tidy, & comfortable, with a good kitchenette.The rooftop pool is great, as are the views from there. Bus stops, Food Land, restaurants, and the beach, all close.We had wifi free in our room.We'd definitely stay there again!

You get what you pay for and this little hotel is great value for money. Pay a little extra and stay in a 1 bedroom ocean view room. View is outstanding. Staff were very obliging. Only 5 minutes to the beach. The Japanese restaurant under neath the hotel [Jinroku I think] was fantastic. Very tasty, the chicken teriyaki was great. Sure the decor is a little dated and in need of a make over and yes the air con was only adequate, but this hotel is fantastic value for money. This is now our hotel of choice in Waikiki.

We enjoyed a week at this hotel in October and would highly recommend it. I did not want to waste my money on pricey accommodations when we were going to spend very little time in our room. We stayed in the a studio and found this met all our needs. The staff are friendly and helpful. I used the pool every day and it was always very well maintained. We will definitely stay here again if we visit Honolulu again.

We stayed overnight in a one bedroom suite which was large and very comfortable. We had a lovely view to Waikiki beach which is a minute's walk away, as is Kalakaua Avenue with it's shops and restaurants. We would happily stay again.

My husband and I decided to stay here while waiting for on base housing! I'll start off with the positive... Customer service was great! Even coupons available upon checking in to restaurants and activities in the area. Our main concern was the black hair found on our "fresh" towels. And the blood droplets throughout the entire room (bathroom, bedroom, kitchen, and entry way). GROSS!! After calling down to speak to a manager, we finally had to go down to the lobby because it wasn't being taken care of. After explaining our situation to the manager and showing multiple pictures , he very quickly hushed us and assured us they were just food particles. (Pictures have been posted on here, definitely not just food!) He moved us up two floors with a half view of the ocean! No blood this time!! Thank God!! Didn't get the managers name but thanks for solving our problem after some stern complaints when nothing was getting done. Honestly unsure if I'd ever stay here again after the situation and being told it was food when clearly it was blood.. Great customer service though! But be warned... Parking is $25 a night!

We booked a last minute stay in Waikiki for a wedding at the Aqua Pacific Monarch. Trying to save money, we opted at first for the most inexpensive room they had--on a lower floor, a studio with a small kitchenette, no view. The hotel offered us an upgrade for a reasonable cost and we moved up to a one-bedroom unit on the 27th floor, partial ocean view, lovely view of the local mountains, large balcony, and a much larger kitchen area. The separate bedroom and large living room--including an eating area--were really nice. We were there for 5 nights and the extra expense was worth it. The bathroom is small, but more than adequate. As other reviewers have noted, it is older and at times it shows. That said, the room was extremely comfortable, the staff very helpful, the location very convenient--the beach was only a 10 minute walk, if that!--and parking was reasonable for the area. There is traffic noise and there isn't any air conditioning in the bedroom. It would have been nice to have the promised wifi, but it wasn't working that week. All things considered, I'm really glad we found the Pacific Monarch and would be happy to stay there again.

This was our second trip to Waikiki and my husband and I decided to stay at this hotel for 2 weeks in Oct/Nov 2013. When we first arrived we got placed in a lower Cityview room when we paid for an Oceanview studio room but we told them it was a mistake and they immediately made things right and we got what we paid for and so much more. The view was amazing. We were very happy with everything from that point on. The mix up stemmed from the fact that they changed from Aston Pacific to Aqua. At least, that's the excuse they gave anyway. - The beds were very comfortable. There is a lot of street noise at night though.- Staff was great. Especially one of the ladies at the tour desk. Can't remember her name but she was very helpful. - Location is awesome. (a little "shady" at night though, but for the most part we felt pretty safe).- The pool area was alright, it was very windy, but the view is great. There is room for improvement though.- We found the air conditioning adequate. Excursion TIP: When you are waiting for the tour bus to pick you up stand on the corner of Kuhio and Uluniu Ave. We were told by the booking company to stand on Uluniu and wait for our tour bus but had to reschedule because the tour guide stopped on Kuhio and didn't look around the corner to see if there was anyone waiting and therefore left without us.I would stay at this hotel again. We love Hawaii and everything about it. The good, the bad, and even the ridiculous. It's what makes this place special and has given my husband and I some of the best memories. So, whatever you choose just hang loose and enjoy the ride. Mahalo and Aloha!

Stayed here twice and it needs a upgrade, but you cannot fault the location easy to beach and shopping and the tour desk was fantastic. The room was a one bedroom studio and there was room for everything. The pool and spa were lovely at night and opened till 10.00pm.

I had to go to Oahu for a conference and was given the gift of two free nights stay by a friend. From the moment I arrived the staff was very friendly. Pretty lobby with a waterfall and lovely seating area. Safe, requiring key card access just to get to the elevator. Stayed on the 10th floor with a view of Diamond Head & a small view of Waikiki Beach. The room was quite nice with a small balcony looking directly towards Diamond Head. Of course, like any city you also have the view of the local neighbors. Room was clean & comfortable. It's located three blocks Mauka of iconic Waikiki Beach. I spent the evening walking through Waikiki. There is a lovely outdoor pool on the 30th floor. Perfect for reading as it wasn't crowded at all. The view from the pool was amazing! Overall, nothing too fancy but quite pleasant. Worth the stay.

We stayed here for 5 nights. The hotel is in a great location, minutes to the beach, restaurants etc. We arrived early and were given an early check in which was greatly appreciated. We had a one bedroom apartment which included kitchenette, plenty of space, the room was very clean. Only negative would be the noise, on our first & last nights the room next to us was very rowdy, rooms are not overly sound proof.Not being a big hotel/resort we found the pool often empty or with minimal guests which we loved. Would stay here again due to location and very reasonably priced.

We arrived quite early, and as normal needed to wait till 2.00 pm on the day to get to our room, the room was booked as a studio , with a partial view of the beach- view was partial as noted , but could see to Diamond head and part of the beach, The room was smallish however we did not spend too much time there, so it was ok, the bed was very comfortable, the staff were great- if we needed anything the staff were very accomodating.The Air conditioner as a wall mounted model at the end of the room, this caused some concern as the A/C was too small to cool the entire room comfortably- the bathroom was small but ok- we had a small kitchenette which i prepared breakfast every second morning- which was great We stayed on the 23rd floor which gave a reasonable view- if booking again i would ask for a room looking at the ocean, and possibly a one bedroom apartment above this levelAll things considered- it was a great holiday, great location, great staff, and all round good time in Hawaii

We had a studio room with a partial ocean view. The hotel is generally old and in need of some renovation. The room was basic but clean however the vertical blinds were damaged meaning that we woke up with the sun and the bathroom needs some definite upgrading. Our shower was broken and moved when trying to adjust it. The air con was also very loud and I had to sleep with ear plugs. However the staff are very helpful and very accommodating. The location is pretty good as the hotel is 2 blocks back from the duke but at the eastern end if the main shopping and restaurant strip. Overall satisfied with the stay.

This IS NOT a review of the Aqua Pacific Monarch hotel (Monarch). I can tell you that the Monarch desk staff are kind and patient, the rooftop pool is a standard rectangle that is well maintained and the water is crystal clear, and the view of Honolulu from the rooftop pool is amazing.This IS a review of the Aloha Waikiki Condos (Aloha) at the Aqua Pacific Monarch hotel.When we checked in at the Monarch, we were told that we had no reservation. What we discovered was that we were booked into a private apartment (condo within the Monarch building) operated by Aloha. BE AWARE: We made our booking through Booking.com, thinking we were booking the hotel. There was no clarity that we were actually booking through a private entity.The hotel DOES NOT manage these condos, so it really isn't fair to expect support from the hotel staff. Even so, the hotel staff tracked down our keys, and we able to get in to the condo, without having to CALL Aloha (which is how you reach them).Our condo was on the 25th floor (2501), and has a good view of Waikiki beach. When we stepped in to the condo the sliding door was open, and the room was muggy. We closed the sliding door, and went in search of the thermostat so we could turn on the air conditioning (a/c). There was no thermostat, as the only a/c in the room is a floor level in wall a/c unit. We turned the a/c on, and quickly discovered that it cooked the bed nicely (since it is right next to the bed), but you leave the bed area you instantly feel the heat. Due to the heat the room is really not comfortable, due to the heat (and this is in October).The entire wall that overlooks the beach is a glass slider, with white curtains that are ineffective in blocking the lights of the city, making sleep difficult.The balcony is two feet wide (standing space only). You do have a good view from the dining table (in this standard issue rattan studio beach condo).We booked a kitchenette room that out to be a dual hotplate, microwave, toaster, and sink. The kitchen area is so small that the coffee maker and hot are on a roll cart. The kitchenette is at the farthest point from a/c, so cooking was a sauna experience. We were booked for three nights, but because of the issues in the condo we decided to leave a day early. We immediately contacted the condo folks (by phone), to let them know of our decision, and to ask them if they would refund the last day. They said "no", because we had already been there three days, even though factually we had only been there two days.

Stayed here for one night. We originally booked the hotel for 2 nights but Flew to the Big Island a day early due to Tropical Storm Ana.Hotel staff were friendly. Check in and check out were fast and efficient. Rooms were nice sized and clean. We booked a partial ocean view and it was as expected. The only negative about the rooms is that the very small air conditioner in each room is not adequate to cool the room. In one of our rooms the air conditioner was set in a mostly enclosed sitting area away from the bed and never cooled anything except the sitting area. Another room had the A/C right next to the bed which made it easier to sleep but the bathroom and sitting areas were extremely warm. Apart from the A/C issues we thought the hotel was fine. It's about a 5 minute walk to Waikiki Beach and there is ample shopping/restaurants in easy walking distance. Free wifi was nice. Parking is $25 per night, which is pretty common for the area.

The Pacific Monarch is quite an old hotel but close to everything in Waikiki. Our room was a good size, with 2 twin beds and a sofa bed. The balcony was the length of the room but very narrow and could be quite dangerous if you had children. The kitchenette was functional but the bathroom was very small and the shower was tiny. One of the beds was situated right next to the air conditioner so one person (me) had a noisy sleep. We stayed for 5 nights and 7 days and the room wasn't made up on 2 days which didn't bother us but could bother other people. The pool area could do with some plants to soften the environment and the walk up the stairs isn't good for those who are older or have mobility issues. And the lifts were quite slow. But overall, our stay was pleasant and it isn't too expensive.

We stayed here in May 2014 while we were presenting at a conference and enjoyed some holiday time too. My husband, daughter and I found the kitchenette (stove (no oven), microwave, fridge, sink) very convenient for breakfast or small meals. The easy walking distance to the beach was great as was having use of hotel towels (and chairs if available) . We had a partial oceanview room (no separate bedroom because we had read that the air conditioning would not work well for this layout). The air conditioning wasn't as strong as I would have liked for the hotter May days in Hawaii but it worked well for certain portions of the room close to the air conditioning unit. The wifi was not functioning after the first 7 days and after unsuccessfully trying the new password, we asked for another one and were eventually able to use wifi again. There was some spraying of the kitchen for insect control (we didn't see any) but a previous tripadvisor post mentioned a roach. It was nice to have a balcony even though it was quite narrow and not really designed for comfortable sitting. I would consider staying here again but perhaps at a cooler time of year.

We stayed here for 5 nights on a recent holiday in Waikiki and were very happy with this hotel. Our view from the 29th floor was spectacular and the design of the room to maximise the view is very clever. We found the room to be very comfortable, clean and well appointed. The staff were helpful and friendly at every opportunity.The location of this hotel is perfect! So close to shops, buses, the beach, and being surfers, having a view of the waves was a huge positive!I hope to return to Waikiki soon in the future and I will stay here again.

We stayed here several times. This time a roach was climbing the wall in the bathroom. The drapes and carpet were stained. We had to wait 24 hours for management to resolve the problems. Housekeeping does not do a good job.

The hotel itself is a little outdated and run down, but the convenience outways this.The air conditioner in our room on the 8th floor was struggling to keep up with the hot weather, also did not help that it was located near the floor and blowing directly under a table.It's a bit squishy when you have 3 kids and 2 adults sharing the one room.The Bus stops right out the front as is a great way to get around whilst in Waikiki.

This hotel was very basic, but was clean with a comfortable bed and just a 5 minute walk to the beach. It was also very close to the public transport. We spent 2 nights here. If we return to Waikiki we would choose a more upmarket hotel.

we stayed at the aqua pacific monarch because life with a toddler on vacation is made easier when a kitchenette is available. the aqua pacific is not luxurious nor very modern, but it is clean and the staff are friendly. the location is excellent as it is near the kuhio beach which is great for kids, is adjacent to the Musube Cafe Lyasume & Me's BBQ which are both tasty and inexpensive, and is within walking distance of many terrific restaurants. as a bonus, it is located near the park and zoo. the sleeping/living areas are fairly good sized, but the bathrooms tend to be on the small. overall, a good value as long as your expectations are not to stay at a fancy resort.

This hotel rocks for any 1st time visitors. It's right in the center of it all. 2 minutes walk to the beach; restaurants and shops. The only thing I would recommend is to request a room higher up. (Better view).The hotel is a little on the older side but they do a good job keeping it up. Oh did I mentioned there's a pool on the roof as well as a hot tub. My only issue is I wish the showers were bit bigger.

Last minute booking...didn't expect much but was pleasantly surprised. Rented a corner unit that had a balcony table and chairs which was really nice .. Had meals there. The one bedroom was not huge but with 2 kids we made it work. Clean and close to the beach. Good rental

I recently stayed at the Aqua Pacific and found the staff, rooms and service all excellent. We had an ocean view room which gave us just that, a great view of the beach with a welcomed breeze each day. A 2 min walk to the beach, shops and transport made our stay very enjoyable. I Would stay here again.

I did a staycation over Labor Day weekend and had no issues. I read a lot of the reviews and I agree that the AC is not the greatest. I had a West facing room so I got the afternoon sun. I kept my curtains closed during the day and the AC on high in the afternoon, and low at night with the ceiling fan running constantly and the room was very tolerable. The room was very clean and did not have any strange smells. The kitchenette was great, complete with plates, silverware, pots & pans, coffee maker, corkscrew, etc. The fridge is small, but perfect for a short stay. There is a PS4 as well, I didn't use it, but I thought it was a great touch for those who have kids. The room was spacious with a couch on one end, a table with four chairs in the middle and two single beds on the opposite end. A desk and chair with swivel flatscreen TV. There is also a dresser for clothes. The people across the hall from me blasted their TV, but I was only able to hear it when I went onto the hall. With the AC running, I heard very little going on outside or around me and was able to sleep very well. The lanai is very narrow, but in the winter months it would be great to open the giant glass doors and just sit an enjoy the breeze. The pool is on the top floor and there is a spectacular view and breeze. There is also a nice room to relax just one floor below with a big screen TV, tables, and couches which also has a great breeze.The only negative is the AC is a floor level, not ceiling level so it is hard to get the cool air to circulate (and it blasted the bed closest to it) and I had a room with twin beds (although I used Hotwire and did not specifically request double/queen/kind).If you use a 3rd party (IE Hotwire, Expedia, etc) to book the room, pay close attention to your charges. The desk clerk wasn't aware that I had already paid at the time of booking and almost charged me again. No biggie, just something to know about.The location is amazing. You are one street back from the Waikiki Strip. Literally a 5 min walk to the beach. There are places to eat, shop, party, and walk all around you.
