Goose Creek, South Carolina

review_body: We stayed here in August and must say the staff were very helpful and friendly. Our room wasn't ready on arrival however there was an oceanview room that was available and we could be upgraded to that for an extra $20 per night plus taxes which we agreed to. We were on the 27th floor - very high but the view was amazing - could see out to the ocean. This resort has been refurbished and we found the room to be very nice and the bed was super comfy. Great location. The only negatives I would say would be the air con was quite old and noisy to try and sleep and the lift was slow. I would stay here again and is very affordable.

Gold Coast, Queensland, Australia

review_body: we chose the aqua pacific monarch mainly for location, one stone throw away from Kuhio beach, 3 minutes distance from Duke's statue. The hotel is just behind the Hyatt, on the higher floors it definitely has the same view as the hyatt... with a totally different and more approachable budget. we had a "1bedroom ocean view & kitchen" on the 31st floor, it was supposed to be renovated, the furniture in the room and kitchen looked new enough but the bathroom not at all... but all amenities were there, wifi, beach towels etc. I think that it is a fantastic location and an ok hotel to be for somebody who wants to stay in waikiki.

We were there for almost 2 weeks in July 2014. The room felt cramped; we didn't feel they maximized the best use of their space. The A/C in our room didn't work very well, so we sweat all night and all day. The A/C leaked water all over our stuff. We used our bath towels they gave us to clean up the mess. We called the front desk to replenish the towels. they brought us wash cloths and hand towels. They made our beds every day, but rarely cleaned. The floor was always filthy, bathroom and bathtub filthy before we arrived and it stayed that way throughout our trip. We had to ask for coffee replenishment every day b/c they didn't refill it when they "cleaned" our room. The fire alarms went off at 3:00 AM frequently. They also went off during the day, but that was less troublesome. But, like the "boy who cried wolf", if there was really a fire, I don't think I'd leave b/c I've gotten used to the fire alarms going off.The housekeeping staff was very friendly when we'd see them in the hall. The front desk was less than friendly. They acted like they didn't have time for us. once when I went down to tell them their washers took more money than is advertized on the washer she shrugged me off. I told her they should put a sign on them so people know to bring more money (b/c there's not a change machine where the laundry facilities are). Parking garage was a bit small, and hard to get through if there is more than one car trying to park or coming in opposite directions. be careful because they WILL tow. The pool and upstairs meeting room was pretty nice! We didn't use these areas though, because we stayed so busy.The hotel is only a few blocks from the zoo and a few blocks from the beach, so the location was nice. (besides the police having to shoot someone half block away.) All in all, if I had to do it all over again, I probably would NOT stay here. It was reasonably priced, but I think I'd pay just a tad bit more for a better hotel and better service.

I have stayed at this hotel numerous times and I love the central location. Rooms were a great size with a kitchenette. The view from the rooftop pool is one of the best in waikiki. Staff were very helpful and polite. Wouldn't hesitate to stay here again.

Location was awesome. Had a kitchen that was very convenient. Grocery store about a block away. The only complaint was that the air conditioner was not the best. It was not bad enough to keep me away. I would stay here again. The parking was tight, but this is Hawaii, not many places to park. Family of five stayed comfortably. Great staff and service.

Have stayed at this hotel on every trip we'e made to Waikiki and sent several friends and relatives as well because our experiences have been so good. Sent our grandmother back for a few weeks' stay in August 2014. Upon arrival, she was severely disappointed in her room, which she equated to "more Motel 6 standards than Pacific Monarch standards." I contacted the reservations department who connected me to the hotel manager to whom I explained the issues. He (Randy) assured me that he'd see what could be done but because the weekend was completely sold out, it would be Monday at the earliest, and the issues were complicated by the need to have 2 side-by-side rooms as my grandfather travels with caregivers. Sunday morning, I got a call from my Grandmother that they'd found them new rooms and were moving them immediately. She is ecstatic with the new rooms. Thanks to Randy and his team going the extra mile to accommodate the needs of an 85 year old woman, I know my grandmother's last visit to Waikiki will probably be among her best ever. Thank you, Randy and Pacific Monarch!

I haven't had a great experience at the Aqua Pacific Monarch. Just because you book an "ocean view" room does not in fact mean you will have a clear unobstructed view of the ocean, we booked ocean view only to be severely disappointed to find that when we stepped out not the verandah that we did not face he ocean and that we had more accurately a view of the city and if you looked between a pair of buildings you could see a fraction of ocean. My experienced has been sullied by the fact we booked double room, and didn't get a double room. When moved to another room (still not a double room) found that we didn't have wi-if, couldn't lock the door to the verandah and had to get a staff member to do so, and the hairdryer didn't work. Prior to staying I read several positive reviews about the Aqua Pacific Monarch, my experience has been very disappointing however.

Great Hotel! Value for money and excellent customer service!Upon check in we were greeted by the friendly staff and given an partial ocean view room as requested. They even remembered that we were celebrating my best friends graduation.The room was clean, tidy and modern with a brilliant view of Diamond Head and Waikiki.The staff went above and beyond for me at this hotel. I accidentally locked my suitcase with the key in it. Not a problem, as the maintenance team were able to easily break the lock. Reception were so patient with us and assisted with weighing our baggage for our flight (too much shopping haha).The tour desk staff were very friendly and helpful. Everything can be booked in the downstairs foyer.Location was 2 blocks back from the beach - short 2 minute walk.Cannot wait to return!!

The Pacific Monarch is perfectly located just two short blocks from Waikiki beach and reasonably priced, offering great value.We booked a 1 bedroom suite for 3 nights there. The suites are small but have everything you need. There is a full kitchen, a dining table for four and a hide-a-bed in the main area. There is also a desk and flat screen TV. The bedroom is a reasonable size with two closets and a dresser. The bathroom is a full 3 piece. There is a safe in the room as well. The rooms are clean and have plenty of windows. Dishes and cooking needs are provided. There is a decent sized patio as well.The staff are very friendly and check-in was a breeze. There is plenty of shopping within walking distance from low to very high end pricing. There are plenty of restaurants nearby as well. There is also a Zoo within walking distance on the far end of the beech.The only thing I didn't like, was that there is only one air conditioner in the suite and it is in the living area. There is a ceiling mounted fan in the bedroom but I would have preferred A/C. There is no TV in the bedroom either (not a concern to me but could be for others). Some of the rooms face the main street which has high traffic. Ours was in the back, so not a concern.We had to check out well before our plane had to leave. The hotel checked our bags and suggested we could use their hospitality area. It is a large covered patio with plenty of seating and a flat screen TV. Access to the pool, hot tub, sauna and showers is off of this area as well.Overall a great stay. If your not bothered by the few negatives I have mentioned here, I would highly recommend staying here.

Everything about this hotel was awesome for my husband and I . We will be going back with our son and will recommend this to all our friends and family. Fantastic value great location! We think that says alot since this is about our 12th trip to waikiki. We have stayed everywhere. A little dated but awesome all the way around. Staff great great great!!! Rooms are redone and are nice. Pool on the roof is warm and awesome! We will be seeing them soon!

Our family of two adults and two teenage boys have just got back from our Hawaiian holiday. Pacific Monarch was the first place we stayed, and we were extremely pleased. Now I must state that we are cavers and trampers (hikers) from New Zealand so our idea of luxury are showers, toilets that flush and beds with linen. We found the staff very friendly and helpful. One separate bedroom, with twin single beds and a fold out queen sized sofabed in the main room, both were clean and comfortable. We cooked most dinners there and had everything we needed to prepare and cook our meals including pots, pans, refrigerator and freezer, huge stove with 4 hotplates and oven, microwave, and coffee maker. Great location, a short walk (2 blocks) to main street of Waikiki.The noise level outside the hotel at night is about what we expected in the centre of a big city. Air conditioning noisy to us but the fans were quiet. Great location for us as we like to be out and active all day so don't have time to waste. The teenagers NEED their WIFI and that worked fine. The pool was popular with the boys, and the Bus stops just about at the door. A tidy, clean place to stay not excessively fancy. Recommended.

My teenage children and I recently spent 3 nights at the Pacific Monarch. I chose this hotel based on price, rating, and location. This hotel is 2 short blocks from Waikiki Beach and within a few blocks of MANY restaurants and stores. The location cannot be beat! All hotel staff I had contact with were gracious and friendly. I booked a city view studio room but was complimentary upgraded to a partial ocean view 1-bedroom at check-in. THANKS! Our room included 2 twin beds and a sofa bed, dining table with 4 chairs, and a small kitchen. I did not have a car, so did not use the parking garage.Beach towels and beach chairs are complimentary for guests. Ask at the front desk. We loved the rooftop pool and the views are amazing! The elevators are fast. Street noises were not bothersome at all.However, we did experience a few problems with the hotel, which is why I gave it an average rating. 1:) The air conditioning was weak...our room never really cooled off the entire time we were there. 2)The wifi was spotty at best...most of the time it didn't work at all...VERY ANNOYING 3) several times we had trouble getting our keys to work. I think they are under new management and just need to get the kinks worked out. We enjoyed our stay at the Pacific Monarch, and would consider staying there again, based on the location alone.

This hotel is ideally located, right in the middle of the heart of Waikiki. The hosting quality is good, and reasonably priced. But this is Waikiki, it is very noisy night and day. The view from the rooftop pool of the hotel is absolutely amazing !

At the last minutes we decided to book a hotel/condo with an ocean view, because we remembered why we came to Hawaii, to enjoy the ocean. Initially the room we booked was a studio with partial ocean view. My wife really wanted more ocean view, because she planed to work on her school project while in Hawaii, and facing the ocean was what she desired. It was a tough situation, because the rooms were quite fully booked. However, one of the hotel staff Cherlita patiently assisted us and went through much trouble to get us a room with a wonderful ocean view. Moreover, the facility was clean and the staff were pleasant and helpful. It's only two blocks from the beach.

Great location and place to stay for the price! Super location, very clean, room enough for our family of four ( 13 & 15 yr old kids). I spent a few hours researching locations in Waikiki and this was one of the first places to pop up. Great price, great pictures.... Something has to be wrong with it. 2 hours later I was brought back to this hotel. I booked it. We were not disappointed. Very clean and it was just what we were looking for. Studio with a well equipped kitchen set up, kids loved the pool (best view around, but a bit windy),great location to watch the fireworks out on the water on Tuesday night, a short walk to the beach, and any area in Waikiki.

Hi All, we stayed at the Pacific Monach, as a second choice, as our first choice (a private Condo) was cancelled 2 weeks out, and being a group of 6 women, finding somewhere to stay was stressful to say the least. Much to our luck, we came across this hotel. All the staff were brilliant especially Cherlita. Always happy and helpful. The hotel is older, but very clean, well maintained, with all facilities at hand, every room had a kitchen also. The beds are the most comfortable I've ever slept in. Across the road from the side door is a Korean BBQ, where the food was really good and plentiful and cheap. $14 usd for a meal big enough for 2-3 and super tasty. 2 blocks from Waikiki beach, 1 block from an ABC store, In the foyer was filtered chilled water with lemon, free to all. The roof had a pool and a leisure area, where we met up with friends and had a party.I would recommend this hotel with pleasure.

Just got back from our honeymoon in Hawaii! We stayed 10 days at the Aqua Pacific Monarch, and it's a nice hotel with an amazing location in Waikiki, right in the middle of everything! No breakfast, but the room has a full kitchen. The view from the terrace is really nice with a swimming pool, jacuzzi etc. The only bad thing I would say is that the parking is really expensive (about U$25 a day), we ended up parking in another hotel nearby.

The room and view are great! My family and I enjoyed our vacation. Pool and sauna located at the roof top sounds and looks really cool! The Staff were friendly and courteous. Maria at the front desk is really very Polite, helpful and gave us great customer service!!! Location of the hotel is extremely great Honolulu zoo and waikiki beach are walking distance. My family and I loves their lemon water at the lobby area.We were treated with full of Aloha:) will definitely come back to this hotel!!!

I stayed in this condo building for a week in June on a high floor that had 270 degree views (beach, city and mountains). Great views and nice size lanai that could easily seat 4 people. Pluses: - Fabulous location; 2 blocks from the beach, supermarket, on the bus line, easy to park the car for in/out; surrounded by restaurants and shopping. If you like to walk, this is a great place for pedestrians. - Roof top - small pool, small hot tub, 360 degree views and indoor common area rooftop where you can read or have a small informal function. - Friendly staffNegative for the unit that I was in - (Check with your specific unit; each unit may have a different owner and this may not be applicable for your unit) - Our unit did not have a dishwasher. - There was only 1 AC unit and it was in the living room and it did a great job cooling this room and the adjoining kitchen. However, it did not cool the bedroom down during day time hours. At night, the temps drop so that it is comfortable again and the window could be opened, but the bedroom only had a ceiling fan. Bedrooms are sometimes needed during the course of the day.  - Yes, you are in paradise called Waikiki; but you will hear lots of street noise; sirens (police, fire, etc) in this concrete jungle even up on the 29th floor. Also, depending on the time of day, you will hear hula shows, drums, etc. The garbage trucks have beepers when they back up and these begin around 6:30am and last for a good 90 minutes several times a week. The point that I am trying to make is that you are still in a big city and expect to hear big city noises. Bring your white noise maker and a good pair of earplugs if you are sensitive to this.

This hotel was perfectly located in Waikiki. The staff were friendly and extremely helpful. Having a kitchen was a real bonus as it made breakfast and dinner a homely option rather than going out especially when supermarkets were near at hand. The rooms were well appointed and the ocean view was a real treat

We have just returned from our stay at the Aqua Pacific Monarch and would recommend it to all. The staff are fun and courteous, always greeting you with a smile. We had our accommodation cancelled with airbnb 12 days prior to departure. Having been to Hawaii many times, the hotels I have stayed in before were booked out as it is busy at this time of year. We had to find something in a hurry and glad we found this place. It had a kitchenette and some of our group were upgraded to a 1 bedroom apartment. The kitchen was well equipped and they have a great room upstairs where you can catch up with friends etc. The hotel is close to everything and buses at the door but you can walk to most places. The ladies at the tour desk are a delight and so helpful. For the price you pay I feel it is good value for money. We stayed in room 1101 much cooler than 1105,6 where our friends stayed.

We stayed for 2 nights and wish we could have extended our time at this fabulous property. What a great experience at a very reasonable price! The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful, gorgeous Waikiki Beach is literally a 3 minute walk from the lobby, and we really enjoyed the breezy views from the rooftop pool. We stayed in one of the serviced apartments, which comfortably accommodated our family of five (myself, my husband, two young kids & my visiting mother). The Aqua Pacific Monarch is so centrally located -- near key shops and restaurants. We can't wait to return. Mahalo!

I stayed here many, many years ago & was very happy with it, so we decided to try again when my family was coming into town. The location is wonderful...near Waikiki Beach, all sorts of shops, & tons of restaurants. The prices are very reasonable considering you're in a high, pricey tourist area. Daily parking is expensive; but if you're not venturing out of the area, you probably won't need a car. You can get a bus to many local attractions. There are choices of rooms with bedrooms, or studios...some with better views than others, but all have some cooking facilities. Enjoyed the roof pool area too!

We stayed here for 3 nights before our cruise. The room was small for 4 people but who cares. We were only in the room to sleep. Place was clean and staff were very nice and helpful. Beautiful view of Waikiki Beach from the pool area. The only thing I'd change would be a more comfortable pull out couch. If I go back to Honolulu, will defiantly stay here again!

This property is half private condos and half hotel. We rented from the private condo side (VRBO) because we could get a better rate. For the private condos, each unit is unique for updates/decor, and of course, there would not be daily maid service like you would get on the hotel side. The building itself is just 2 short blocks to Waikiki Beach! Easy walking to all shops and endless restaurants. We recommend rooms on the upper levels (above 15) because they offer the best views (beach views, mountain views, city views). Some lanai's are narrow, chairs need to be sideways to fit. But the views and breezes are lovely. Beautiful rooftop pool area with panoramic views of Waikiki and Honolulu (and Friday night fireworks from the Hilton down the beach). Atmosphere is more of an older hotel vs a resort. Open-air lobby with nice, small, relaxed seating area with lovely waterfall. Nothing fancy. 3 slow elevators, one was out of service. If you have a car, parking is $25 for 24hrs in the attached parking garage. Honolulu traffic is horrible (2nd only to LA) so best to take a GPS device with you to help navigate all the one-way streets. Nice stay and excellent location for the price.

Wonderful hotel - staff amazing - Danny, Cherlita, everyone was so kind & helpful! We stayed on the 25th floor. Was pleasantly surprised by the '3 blocks' to Waikiki Beach - they were only very short little blocks! You don't have to bring your own beach towel; the hotel supplies towels & beach chairs too but you have to get up early to get a chair. A real nice touch is the large water dispenser with fresh lemon slices in it - FREE! The view from the roof-top pool is incredible! Something we found helpful too was the travel agent desk in the front lobby. We booked our Polynesian Cultural Center trip through Rochelle (there were at least 2 other agents working there while we were visiting). Rochelle also steered us to the best place to rent a car (I chose Alamo Car Rentals; they were great to deal with also) & gave us lots of info re buses, etc. The hotel also provided change for the bus & for the laundry facilities which are on the 3rd floor. We booked a room with a kitchenette. There wasn't an oven but it did have a little 2 burner stove-top, a microwave & a small fridge/freezer. There was an air conditioner & a big ceiling fan. I loved the huge sliding glass doors that opened up completely to the balcony. The building itself is old & is showing its age a bit; elevator is quite slow but there are 3 of them. Kuhio Avenue is one of the main streets so it was easy to get around. It was my first visit to Hawaii. I'd go again in a heartbeat & highly recommend staying at the Aqua Pacific Monarch hotel. Aloha!

Took my so long to review this place because we always thought it was called the ASTON Pafici Monarch. We actually stayed here in May 2011.Well thinking about our stay to this day gives me a home sick goosebump fit.So hoping nothing has changed, our room on the 27th floor was spectacularly wholesome and cozy, excellent view, full cable, nothing cost us any extra but the internet up stairs.Im beginning to think its under new managemtn though, which is sad.

visited hawaii for the first time with a friend from work and we were both so happy with ourexperience at pacific monarch.we were greeted so warmly by raymond who gave us an upgradeto a lovely appartment on the 24th floor,room with kitchenette and spacious balcony.nothing was too much trouble to the lovely staff especially danny cherlita and too many othersto remember all the names.our tour bookings were taken care of by rochelle who did a greatjob with all the tours.location was fantastic, so close to the beach and what about the greatshopping!!!!we spent 7 days enjoying everything about hawaii and would gladly return to thisgreat hotel again, hopefully in the near future. we haven't stopped talking about our time there.a great shopping tip is to visit the ross store, so many bargains you will need an extra suitcaseto take home all the shopping!!!can't wait to return, thank you all again for making our holiday so fantastic.

We stayed on the 30th floor. View was INCREDIBLE! 2 min walk to the beach. ABC stores a block in any direction(except one..). Everything in Waikiki is basically walking distance and if you don't have a car, the bus stops across the road or 30m down the street. There are plenty of car hire businesses in close proximity. This was perfect for our week in Waikiki. Room and fittings are a little dated though...

We travelled as a group of 12 and prior to our arrival to the hotel, we had just indured a rough 9 1/2 hour flight from NZ. The reception staff weren't very welcoming, we arrived maybe a hour before check in time, and we're made to wait another 4 hours before we were allocated rooms. One of the rooms that was shared by four had a blocked toilet and was leaking through the wardrobe in the lounge area. And to add insult, the staff blamed one of the traveling party. They were made to wait another 2 hours before they were relocated to another room!. The room I shared with 2 other guys had a double bed in one room and a sofa bed in the lounge. We were also given the run around by reception staff, but in the end got a comfortable room. Don't bother going to this hotel, the only positives with this place is maybe the kitchenette and the distance to the beach!. We won't be returning to this hotel in the near future and encourage anyone else going to Hawaii to follow suit...

We only stayed 3 nights but this is a great place if you are staying a bit longer as they have kitchens in the units....nice to have a meal or even just toast and coffee in the morning. Units are like timeshare units, however they have daily maid service. We booked an Oceanview studio but we're pleasantly surprised to be **upgraded to a one bedroom corner unit, facing Diamond Head and also had an awesome view of the ocean. The studio units have Juliette balconies. Our unit could sleep 4 if you used the pull-out sofa. Pool area is on the 32 floor. Location of the APM is perfect....close to everything and only a block to the sandy beach!!Front desk staff and cleaning staff are all very pleasant/friendly. Our flight did not leave till 8:30 but they stored our luggage and we were able to use the showers and pool till our shuttle picked us up at 5:30 PM.  Lots of restaurants in the area. We ate at Tanaka of Tokyo's new location, Duke's and California Pizza Kitchen. All were reasonably priced and all had good service. Only wished we could have stayed longer.PS- Ladies there is a ROSS store only a few blocks away. : )

We recently stayed at the Aqua Pacific Monarch for 7 days. We had a studio with small kitchen and balcony. The room was clean and looked EXACTLY like the photos on the website!!! We found the staff very friendly, especially Danny, who always greeted us with a smile and Aloha! He was always willing to help and made our stay that much more pleasant. The location is great, beach, pubs, restaurants, shops, etc very nearby.

Stayed 3 nights in studio room and found kitchen very well equipped. Room was more than adequate for 2..Very central for shopping, beach and restaurants. Comp WiFi with password for each room. Electric kettle was handy. Air con tended to be noisy. We were on the 22nd floor and still found it was noisy until the early hours from traffic, restaurants etc.

Our stay at the Pacific Monarch was amazing. Excellent views, free upgrades and amazing roof top pool and jacuzzi. The staff is incredibly accommodating, it made our staycation absolutely wonderful! I would highly recommend this hotel for travelers.

After a very long flight from the uk ,what a great start to our holiday a lovely smiling face waiting for us at the reception,we were checked in very quickly and off we went to our room and was very pleasantly surprised with the size of our room ,we had a city view apartment which had a balcony :) lovely views ,the room was well equipped with a large cook ,fridge freezer ,microwave ,coffee maker,toaster kettle also hair dry which me and our daughter were very pleased with .we had clean towels every day and lining if needed.Free beach/ pool towels from reception .Free wifi This was our first time to Hawaii and we had a great time and if I get to come again I would definitely wont to come back to the aqua Pacific Monarch :)

We visit Waikiki annually and have stayed in many hotels. Pacific Monarch is now our favorite, we have stayed here 3 times and find the location to be central, the rooms are clean, the prices are reasonable ... overall a very nice accommodation. And the bonus is that the staff are friendly and helpful.

Very nice rooms (I think it's an older hotel that has been renovated?) Excellent free wifi in your room and seating/lounge area on the roof, great location right in Waikiki (not right on the beach but very close) I think the only things this hotel doesn't have is it's own bar and restaurant?? But that doesn't matter, and everything is a very short stroll away. Added bonus material is the view from the lounge area on the roof level and roof top pool. Great staff too.

First time visitor to Hawaii and booked the Pacific Monarch from Sydney. Reception desk staff were more than helpful, even came to assist me showing me how the coffee mach worked.The hotel is central and convenient to everything and only a block away from the beach. There is a bus stop right in front if ever that's needed too.I shall stay here again if ever I return to Hawaii.

My friend and I were getting away for a much needed vacation from work. My daughter attends U of H so it was a great opportunity to visit her.I read the reviews and kept my fingers crossed.We were pleasantly suprised that all the reviews were accurate. We too asked for a room on the highest floor which we were granted. We had the 29th floor with ocean view. Studio was clean, nicely decorated and had a view of mountains, city below and ocean. The lanai was about three feet, so with sliding doors, it was really quite pleasant.The pool and hot tub, while nothing fancy, were nice on the roof. There is no work out room, so strolling on the beach it is LolIf you are here to do work, internet was fine but they do not have a fax available unless they fax stuff for you out of their office which they were willing to do. While it is not the Ritz Carlton, we did not feel like we were in a sub standard setting. It was pleasant, staff were nice, and we definately would stay here again!

My daughter was born in Oahu, but we left when she was only two. So for her 21st Birthday, I felt what a great present to give her (plus a work break for myself) to come back to Hawaii for 5 days. I spent months planning our trip and which hotel to stay at; and I am SO glad I chose the Aqua Pacific Monarch. I asked for a high floor, so they gave us the 29th with a partial ocean view. The minute we walked into the studio, we saw the kitchenette, the decor and those patio doors, the kind that open up the whole room to the lanai/balcony. We stood there taking countless pictures of the mountains, the other hotels and the ocean / beach. She turned to me, smiled and gave me the biggest hug. We took pictures at sunrise and sunset. We loved every single minute of our stay. And even though we had to jam pack every event (from the Luau, shopping at Ala Moana Center, Circle Island to the Maita'i cruise) into those 5 days; we wished we could have spent just one day relaxing in our hotel room. My daughter (and bestie) lives in London and I live in LA, so any time spent together is always special. Aqua Pacific Monarch made our trip even more magical.

We stayed 6 nights in a one bedroom ocean view with kitchen. We pre booked hotel with our return flights via Expedia. We have stayed in Waikiki previously and selected this hotel because of the availability of a view, close location to Waikiki Beach and at a price we could afford. We were on the 12th floor and had reasonable views of the beach/ocean. One of the Hyatt towers is directly in front but we had views either side. I think the higher up the better. There are 29 floors.The room is "hotel sized": main area had compact kitchen but with full size fridge, queen sized sofa/sofa bed, small desk, table and 4 chairs. Bedroom had small hanging space both sides of bed and a set of drawers. Good enough for 2 people but we were a party of 3. We fitted in OK but no real place to put luggage.Hotel has no restaurant but who needs it in Waikiki?????? There is a pool on the roof with great views. Pool a bit small and lack of shade makes it not overly attractive. But again why go there when the beach is a 2 minute walk away???????Staff were friendly and efficient. Lady at the your desk very good and can arrange anything for you.We hired a Hertz car through her: about $55 but if you booked the car online via Hertz, it was $85!!!!!!!!Location is great: two half blocks and you are at the Duke statue. Last time we stayed in Waikiki it was further away from the beach and very noisy: the Pacific Monarch was surprisingly quiet at night, and I guess if in a higher room, it would be even quieter.Overall, very satisfied. Especially so when you look at the Hyatt Regency directly in front and see just how many of their rooms have no view!!

We vacation in Hawaii every year. Last year we decided to find a different hotel. We wanted a good location, as well as having more room. Fortunately we found the Pacific Monarch. We had such a good experience we stayed there again this year. We were there for 3 weeks. Had a one bedroom with a full kitchen that had everything in it we needed. We had a corner room so we had plenty of wonderful light. Our lanai offered wonderful views of the ocean as well as the city. The bedroom had a ceiling fan that provided a very nice cool breeze at night. The staff were great. Our primary housekeeper, Nelly was so very sweet and we appreciated everything she did for us. The front desk staff are very friendly & helpful, especially Danny & Evian. The hotel is very centrally located, the bus stop is right across the street from the front door, very convenient. We were within walking distance to the beach, shopping & restaurants. WiFi worked perfectly & there is a nice self laundry on site. We look forward to our trip next year to Hawaii that will most definitely include a stay at the Pacific Monarch.Margaret & Barb

Great locations. One block from the beach (Dukes statue). The view from the pool is amazing and the pool is great size, and very clean. Reception desk is very helpful. Have stayed for 3 weeks and did not have a problem. Will stay here again.

We stayed at this hotel just as it was changing over from Aston Pacific Monarch to Aqua Pacific Monarch and had a great time. The hotel proved to be the perfect choice for a group of three adults (one couple and one single) as we booked a one-bedroom ocean view room (at a discounted rate via the website) which offered plenty of space and privacy for our very first trip to Hawaii. Great location and very easy to walk to Waikiki's main beach as well as restaurants and shops. Convenience store downstairs was handy for drinks/ice-creams/snacks. Bus stops nearby make it easy to get to Diamond Head and Ala Moana. Rental car companies are on the same block too. Great water views from the room and also from the rooftop pool, which, although on the small side, was a great place to cool off. The room's balcony was a perfect place to sit and eat breakfast when we didn't feel like going out for a big meal (American meals are HUGE). Good kitchen too, although we rarely used it because we were too busy shopping/sightseeing. Staff at the front desk were helpful when it came to directions, info on bus routes etc. I'd definitely consider staying here again.

Aqua Pacific Monarch is a mixed bag. It is an older hotel, the foyer could do with a makeover as could the hospitality room on the rooftop and the hallway carpets, however the view from the room made up for some of its downfalls. We had a 1 bedroom room with Ocean views. When we first arrived we were given a room on the 15th floor, it had twin beds and we preferred to have a double bed. We were moved the next morning to room 2902. The view was spectacular, almost 360 degrees, from diamond head, the Waikiki beachfront and beyond. The room had a microwave, good sized fridge and oven. Only 1 aircon unit, which was in the main living area. The bedroom was hot, even though it's the winter. A quick 4 minute walk to the beach and 2 mins to an ABC store. The bus was just across the road, very handy. The wifi didn't work but the staff gave us a cable for the computer, which worked well.All in all a very pleasant stay.

I stayed at the APM with my family. There were 5 of us total. We had a room on the 16th floor with ocean view. The bedroom was small, two twin beds and we squeezed a roll away between the two beds after pushing them as far to the sides as possible. There is very little storage for 5 suitcases. The kitchen was nice with a full size refrigerator, stove/oven, microwave, toaster and coffee maker. We were able to walk to the Food Pantry just two blocks down the street for cereal, bread, milk and drinks. 2 blocks from the beach, and block and a half from a farmer's market that is held on select days (lots of fresh fruit there). It is walking distance to a lot of restaurants. The pool is small, but nice and there is also a hot tub. We slept with the lanai door open at night, and there aren't many bugs in Waikiki.

This hotel is much better value now that Aqua have taken it over. Yes it's an older place, but very comfortable and the views of the sea are wonderful. Ask for a front room above 16th floor. The lanais are large and create a lovely sitting out spot . Admittedly the weak points are the airconditioners as others have mentioned. They're not too efficient and in the past the check in staff were truly hopeless. Leave plenty of time to check out !!! Overall I love it.

First the positives, a great location 2 mins stroll from waikiki beach and close to food pantry supermarket, small but nice rooftop pool, comfy bed and well equipped kitchen.The not so good? Air con in room is inadequate for the room size and noisy, and doesn't put air into the bedroom. Don't stay here in summer! I felt staff were inattentive and a couple almost rude when I raised issues such as the internet in my room not working (someone ripped it from the wall) and bath plug broken. No full receipt on checkout and no bill explanation. The price is high for an ocean view room which on a lower floor as allocated to me felt like a rip off really, the view was more of the car park and a couple of seedier looking motels plus the Hyatt looming large in front of the beach.

The hotel, although not the newest, was very clean and neat. It was in a great location for us -- we walked each night to the Waikiki beach and shops, Duke's Lane, etc. The kitchen was a great perk -- we were able to use the oven to bake pre-cooked meals from the grocery store and were able to only have to eat one meal each day out. There were three of us on the trip. A married couple and single man (all family). I think it was ideal for a couple or a family since privacy would be an issue otherwise. There was a bedroom with a door and then a pull out couch in the living room. There was only one bathroom and it was off of the living room. The balcony was accessed through the living room and bedroom. The most obvious inconvenience if you're "sharing" the room was there was only a window air conditioning unit which was in the living room. If you closed the bedroom door, and it was a warm evening outside, the bedroom would get a bit stuffy/hot by morning. Overall, it worked great for us. The two I traveled with have been to Hawaii over sixteen times (yearly trips) and they have stayed here for the last 10+years. Depending on your traveling group and needs, this could be a great choice for you! Nice pool and hot tub on the roof, too, with BEAUTIFUL views of Diamond Head and the Waikiki Beach!

From the moment we walked into the foyer we felt as though we were in a 1970"s time warp - huge mosaic , fish tank and water feature . Not that that is a major problem for me but it just felt old and dated. The room was of similar vein - your typical old shower over the bath with cheap curtain , noisy old air conditioner right next to the bed . I must say the position of the hotel was great - 100 meters walk from the heart of waikiki .If your looking for budget accommodation in a great spot this is it .

This was our second stay at this hotel. The previous was on the 6th floor 1bedroom, with no ocean view. This time round, at the renamed Aqua Pacific Monarch, we were lodged on the 29th floor, complete with lanai and full kitchen.The checkin was painless. The clerk was capable and efficient. We got exactly what we had booked.Want to save money? Make a quick trip to a nearby Safeway store, and you're set for your stay. Our room had all the basic kitchen amenities, corkscrew included. Although the rooms weren't modern, they were clean, adequately furnished and offered a great view of the ocean. The lanai was a treat.Danny, one of the many courteous staff, went out of his way to accommodate our elderly mother when she was a little disoriented on the first day. He walked her to the room and assisted her in gaining entry. The cleaning staff were superb. We won't hesitate to recommend this hotel.Mahalo.

We have stayed at the Pacific Monarch 4 times over the past few years and have had no problems. We usually rent the condos by the week so maybe having this under Hotels is something new over the past year or so. Location is excellent and roof top pool is amazing for views. Have never stayed lower than 16th floor so we've always had great views from the units too. There is a fantastic fish tank that spans almost the entire wall across from the elevators. Free movie dvd's from public lounge just under pool level. We have been to Hawaii 9 times and we always check here first for availability and good prices. Last stay was 3 years ago.

I absolutely loved my stay at the Pacific Monarch. My boyfriend and I were in to visit his sister, who lived literally across the street from this hotel. We stayed at three different hotels for this trip but wished we could spend every day here. (We spent three nights total.) The rooms were nice with awesome patios. The location is perfect for Waikiki and we had a kitchenette, even in our studio room. We upgraded to one bedroom- very spacious and nice. The staff was very nice. We didn't have a car so we didn't have to worry about towing- the bus stop is right across from the hotel. If I come back, every night will be booked here. While the hotel has no restaurant or breakfast, the price is well worth it and it is close to other food joints.

Booked our stay here very last minute as our booking elsewhere fell through. SO GLAD we changed to the AP. Was very reasonably priced - much better value than some other properties we looked at since arriving. Excellent location - close to the beach and some excellent eating places, highly recommend the Korean restaurant next door. There are a number of ABC stores nearby for your snacks and drinks and the supermarket only a 5 minute walk away.The service here has been fantastic - the front desk staff always helpful and very friendly. We discovered we didn't have the room type we had booked and it was no drama at all changing it to what we wanted. The rooftop pool isn't heated but my son didn't care, and we loved the view of the ocean from up there. Fatherinlaw managed to block the toilet twice and we had no problem getting the maintenance staff up to fix it within minutes. No trouble with parking here either, although we only needed it for one night.We had a one bedroom suite which was perfect for the 4 of us (2 on the sofa bed). Would have liked a ceiling fan in the bedroom, and perhaps a tv but they're minor gripes. The room is also fairly noisy at night but that's mostly due to the fire dept and loud motorbikes at all hours of the day and night - cant blame the hotel for that. Had a good sized kitchen and large fridge too which was super handy. The bed was super comfy too.Overall if you're looking for an affordable clean property I would certainly recommend the Pacific Monarch. We wouldn't hesitate booking it if we come back to Honolulu

This was our 4th time back to Honolulu, and 3rd time staying at the Pacific Monarch. 1 Bedroom, partial ocean view is the way to go! I had made my reservations (2rooms) in May of 2013 for our stay in December 11th-21st of 2013. So, I had NO idea that the property was changed to Aqua instead of Aston. I was disappointed when I found out of this change (3days before arrival). But, when I arrived, I was pleasantly surprised that the property had not changed physically, and that ALL the staff was very friendly and helpful. I look forward to spending my next visit at this same location. Property is only 1block from Waikiki beach, close to International Market, shopping etc. We rented a vehicle for the entire stay, and parking was quite expensive..but never had a problem finding a parking spot.

This is probably our 6th or 7th visit to this property. Everything was as expected with some minor updates. It's important to point out that this property is not a resort, it's a condo building. So, as always, I'll rate this property based on the attributes it has set for itself. In other words, if you're looking for 5 star treatment you're not going to find it (nor should you expect it) in a 3 star condo. With the Pacific Monarch I believe you get what you pay for and then some.Location: A- No, it's not right on the beach but it's a short 2 block walk taking you to the best location on Waikiki/Kuhio beach. For the price you can't beat this location. To make my point you'll walk past the Hyatt where you'll pay twice the price for half the room.Lobby/Check In B- Great service, but lobby does need help. Still the staff are friendly, attentive and quick. One nice add (since Aqua took over management from Aston) is that they provide beach towels. Nice touch. We always bring our own but this really is a nice perk.Room C+ Funny thing, had they not renovated I'd had probably given this a B but I expected more after renovation. It was nice to see the newer furnishings (although was surprised how much use they've seen in such a short period) and nice newer flooring. That said, the paint was shoddy, the bathroom was pretty much untouched (needs new bathtub and fixtures), and the kitchen… what happened to the lighting? Was a bit disappointed. Still, for a couple hundred a night you get a 1 bedroom suite with a kitchen saving you tons of money eating out…and more space than the previously mentioned Hyatt.Technology D: Before the renovation you could "wheel" the TV into the bedroom, so if you wanted to watch a movie at night that was nice. The new flat screen is mounted to the wall so really only usable for the living room. Stations were limited. More frustrating was that the internet didn't work well. In fact, it wasn't usable.Gym: N/A Run on the beach or along the canal in the morning. Love it!Pool Deck: People rave about this but we never use it. Always at the beach.Overall Solid B: We'll be back when we visit Waikiki. While there are minor issues with the property, given price and location, it's difficult to beat it. After all, we're in Hawaii for the beach, not the room. Kitchen is a big plus for us!

We were very happy with our stay in room 1304 over Christmas holidays. From this room it's not exactly what I'd call "ocean view"...though in a big city full of condo towers it qualifies as such. But we found the view of the city to be lovely and we could see the ocean in between the buildings. The kitchen was adequately stocked for the little cooking we did, and we were promptly given dish liquid when we asked. Only problem was that we had to open the mini-frig in order to open the silverware drawer. There's not enough clearance, but perhaps this could be corrected if the drawer was planed down a bit.All in all, a good place to stay!There's a pool and whirlpool on the roof, but we kept ourselves too busy to use them.

I recently stayed at this hotel and during the night my rental car was towed away. Despite paying the $25 per day parking fee,the tow company said they couldn't see the parking ticket which I had purchased. It cost me $35 in cab fare to go and retrieve my car, plus $197 in towing and storage fees. This has never happened any where else in the world I have travelled. The management of the hotel could have cared less. If you plan on hiring a car while you are Waikiki I would avoid this hotel like the plague.

Only paid $129. on Hotwire for one bedroom with very nice "partial" ocean view. Okay housekeeping. Good enough bed. Great location. Downside was stained carpet, thrift store wobbly table and chairs, and old faded sofa. Beware as you don't know what you'll be getting. We saw much nicer rooms when we peeked into open doors.

I liked this hotel. The location is great and I like having a small kitchen. The roof top pool and hot tub is protected from the wind and very nice. The hotel seems like a condo used by owners. I will stay here again.

We are here now and enjoying it very much.The hotel web site does not give complete helpful information. The following may help you, as, because it is a condo hotel, one is never sure of what is provided. Because airlines are all about luggage weight, why pack things if you don't have to?-pool towels are available at the front desk, so no need to bring your own.-all rooms have blow dryers-shampoo/conditioner/lotion/soap/bath gel are provided-paper towels, tea towel, basic cutlery, plates, rice cooker, cups, glasses are provided.-although they provided packets of ground coffee sealed in round coffee filter packs, it is not good coffee, and you get a few tiny packs of powdered whitener, a single pack of sugar etc that is inadequate, so, be prepared to get take out coffee, or buy grounds at numerous close stores. We use a paper towel as a coffee filter.-Bring you own salt and pepper or buy at the local grocery store.The Good-Charlie at the front desk checked us in and is very helpful. All others that we've encountered are nice as well.-Location.....3 ABC convenience stores within less than a 1 minute walk. Full sized grocery store called the Food Pantry is a 2 minute walk away. Front door to beach is a 1 minute walk. The views are spectacular as long as you are high up. We are on the 31st floor. Am not sure how high you have to be to get a good view. Pool is on 33rd floor. Great view.-Large lanai with table and 4 chairs-Excellent water pressure in shower and plenty of hot water-Good Housekeeping in suite, corridors and lobby.-Self serve laundry on 3rd floor in parking garage is handy. Quarters only. $2 wash and $2 dry.Could Be Improved-Generally, the room and furnishings are in good shape, but the bathroom tub/shower fixtures need replacing. They are old and shabby. The rubber baseboards in the bathroom are peeling away fron the base of the tub. Multiple layers of silicone etc, just doesn't give a feeling of cleanliness. Tub doesn't drain very well.- Roof top pool is small with not many lounge chairs. No atmosphere up there. Perhaps a bit of piped in music would help. We whisper to each other so others can't hear our conversations. Too quiet and dead feeling. Pool apron needs repainting. Lots of flaking paint.-Slow elevators-Poor lighting. Lamp shades are yellowed out. Dull lighting in kitchen area.On the whole, we are very pleased. Usually stay at the Sheraton Waikiki, but wanted the ability to have breakfast items etc. at hand, via fridge etc. Would not hesitate to stay here again. Just hope they invest some money on improving some of the older fixtures etc.

The view from the One Bedroom Ocean View rooms is 5 star, but the hotel overall is a bit tired and dated and so 3 star. It's for that reason that I've rated it four star overall. The One Bedroom Ocean View rooms also have a really spacious balcony with table and four chairs. The staff were friendly and there were laundrette facilities. There is also a really good, big supermarket 3 minutes away (called something Pantry). The beach is also an easy 5 minute walk away. Buses stop nearby.

Have stayed here 3 times now it is very close to everything and a bus stop outside front door to get to anywhere else far away. Every thing else is in walking distant beach shops all one block away. So have a great stay.

review_body: We were here for 14 nights,it was excellent.Unit was clean and tidy and the full kitchen was a bonus.Serviced every day and the sheets were changed every 3 days.Wifi was included.All the staff were very helpful.I suggest you stay on a level as high up as possible,we were on the 20th.

This was my 6th time to visit Hawaii and it was my first time to visit this hotel or condo.Part of the name of this hotel has been changed from "Aston" to "Aqua."We can choose full-kitchen room or kitchenette room and we chose former.Full-Kitchen rooms are located on every corner of every floor and larger than kitchenette room, but not spacious.We stayed at this hotel for 11 days / 10 nights.The room we were assigned was on the 8th floor while this hotel is a 32(or 33) -story building and the 2nd to 5th floor were parking lots.We could not see even a part of the sea or Diamond Head because our room faces to Kuhio Avenue and another hotel next to ours. We could not open the curtain because if we do, someone who stays at the hotel next to us can see hour room.Their service was bad. I felt we had a bad deal to stay at this hotel.1. EVERY DAY, we had some problem.Insufficient room keeping : They don't replenish coffee and toilet rolls even there was nothing to use. They never clean the floor. I found a receipt on the floor when we first entered this room.2. Unkindness : They offer a complimentary Wi-Fi service and they change the password every week, but they don't inform us the password change.3. Expensive parking fee ($25 a day)Were we the only guests that had those kind of problems? Or Everyone?The only thing I liked the hotel is the pool on the roof. It is the highest place in Waikiki Area and we can see 360 degrees. It can compensate the poor view from my room.But I will never stay at this hotel.

Have stayed here before. The staff is very helpful and friendly. We had the 29th floor ocean view. Trade winds flow through the open windows, very nice at night. Room was clean. Bathroom is small but who cares, shower and get out. A little noisy in the mornings. We had breaky and lunch in and went out for dinner. Literally 1 minute to the beach. We paid $ 205 a night but looked at next year and is jacked up to $247, so may look elsewhere. Aqua has just recently taken over management so maybe that is why.

review_body: We stayed the week of Oct 19th-26th Aqua Pacific Monarch the former Aston Pacific Monarch pre cruise on the Pride of America. We had a one bed condo with a city view on the 6th floor. It had two twin beds in the bedroom a small closet with a safe and a queen size bed in the living room & a sofa bed. It was listed as sleeping 5. It could sleep that many but where you would keep your luggage would be a problem. This worked well for the 4 of us. The twin beds will be short for a tall person. The bed in the living was situated in front of the air conditioning unit which blocked the rest of the room from getting any cool air. We immediately move the bed in front of the sliding glass door. This helped but it was still very warm in the bedroom. We kept the curtains closed to help keep it cooler. The curtains did not close tightly. I had brought clothes pin for hand washing laundry. They helped with keeping the early morning sun out. So it really did not matter what view we had because we kept the curtains closed. The lanai was pretty much useless as it was very small &narrow & the view was of the parking garage & the next hotel. We only use it to dry our beach shoes. The kitchen was equipped with a stove/oven, toaster, refrigerator, coffer maker, dishes/bowls, tea kettle, cup/glasses, pot & pans, silverware, dish soap, paper towels coffee, tea ,sweeter & creamer. We used a couple drawers in the kitchens to put clothes in. There is a laundry room on the 3ed floor $2 to wash $2 to dry. You could buy laundry detergent there we brought some tide pods with us.  They no longer charge the $15 a day amenity fee. The free wifi worked great. The bathroom has a shower tub combo. They provided bar soap, body wash shampoo & conditioner & fresh towels daily& mid week sheet change. The maid service was very good.The rooftop pool & hot tub had a beautiful panoramic view from the 32ed floor. We used it almost every day. On Friday night we went up and watch the fireworks. The location was very convenient to Waikiki Beach a 5 min walk about block & half. We rent 2 chairs & umbrella for $20 for 2hr or $50 for all day. Also one day we took an hr catamaran ride for $20 each. We got on near the beach 2 Duke’s.  Now don’t get me wrong this place is not perfect. The area off lobby near the elevator has a very bad smell as dose the stairway to the pool and the hall leading to our room smelled like garbage possibly due to the garbage shoot in the hall. But once you are in your room no odor could be detected. The couch was tired and definitely some new curtains or blinds would freshen up the condo. But we were there only a week we made the best of it.We felt safe & comfortable in our home away from home. We spent very little time in our condo with all there is to do and see. Not to mention the shopping! It was like New York City with palm trees lol. As for the shopping to name a few places the flea market @ the Aloha Stadium is a must on Wed, Sat or Sun. We took a shuttle for $5 each round trip and $1 to get in. We went there on our first full day and did not realize how good the prices really were. We had lunch from the shrimp truck & it was delicious one of many we ate from. There is a free shuttle to Hilo Hattie’s & it will take you to the Flea Market or the Ala Moana Shopping Center. Also there is a shrimp truck in the parking lot of Hilo Hattie’s. Until December, sadly there is the International Market Place. It is slated to be torn down to make way for a Saks Fifth Ave. @ the market there was some great place to grab lunch/dinner. Kings Village is not far from the hotel we notice it from the rooftop pool. One night they had a farmers market & live music. I found some nice souvenirs @ Ross. There is a post office @ the International Market & with a ships it fits box for $16.85 I shipped home my treasures. We contemplated renting a car and driving to the North Shore. Then we met a shuttle driver while we were @ the flea market & asked him about driving us around for the day. He quotes us $65 each & we felt this was good so we took him up on it. His name was Roz 1-808-699-7224. It was the best day. Roz took us all the way around Oahu. He knew exactly where to stop for the best views, interesting place to see & shop & a shrimp farm & restaurant for lunch called Romy’s. Most importantly he knew where the clean rest rooms were. We would have never found any of this on our own. Not to mention the stories alone the way. He picked us up @ 9a & dropped us off @ 6p @ any time we did not feel rushed. He was a very kind caring man he shared stories about his family & his life. We also use him to take us to the cruise port and to the airport. When we first arrive we used A8 and we had no complaints. All in all we enjoyed our stay @ the Aqua Pacific Monarch & if in the area would consider staying again. The location to the beach and the action are ideal & the staff where very helpful & friendly. During the week we attended the Germaine’s Luau it was a long ride in traffic on a bus. But Cousin Kenny helped pass the time joking around & getting people to interact with each other. The Luau will not start until all the buses get there. We must have been the last bus. As soon as we arrived after pictures we were lead to the picnic table about 3 row from the front and we where the first called up in line for the food. It was my first Luau the show was good the food not so much.  I will be glad to answer any questions.

Room was very well equippedViews from the 29th floor of Waikiki beach were outstandingClose to most of the things you want to do during the day or evening in WaikikiOn site parking was handy even though it was a bit dearAir conditioner was woefully inadequate for the size of the unit

A great hotel, good location, spacious and clean rooms. Need to work on their customer service. First issue minor - not overly friendly about rectifying their booking mistake - gave us a double (not ideal for adult brother & sister) when a twin room was clearly on our booking form. Their response was use the sofa bed, and were reluctant to move us to a twin room.The second issue was my mistake but I am really surprised that the hotel wasn't able to provide a good outcome. Just before checking out I'd put my wet bikini in a hotel towel to dry it off a bit, got side tracked packing & ended up leaving it behind. Contacted Hotel within 24 hours of checking out (as soon as I'd got back to NZ). Neither the hotel nor their laundry service located the bikini despite me telling them exactly where it had been left - seems strange to me a bikini wrapped up in a towel wasn't discovered by room service or laundry - where else could it get too?! Disappointed as I know of friends who've left cheap and easily replaceable umbrella's behind and a hotel has posted it to them! You'd hope a hotel would make an effort to locate something a guest left behind but I got the impression they assumed from the outset it was gone.

Stayed in May but I have forgotten to do my review so here it is..Checked in pretty late so check in was nice and quick.. When we got to do the room it was nice and clean. We did not have a nice view from our room, just a view looking down onto the street. Did not have even any issues with room during our stay . The hotel is a 5 minute walk to Waikiki beach which was very convenient. There was ABC store on every corner if you needed to buy anything. If you want to buy liquor do it before 11pm!! One en night we were stuck driving around looking for a place to buy alcohol but they stop selling at 11pm everywhere. The rooftop pool was nice, such a great view. We went up there since the beach was too packed and it was nice to get some sun and be in the water.We rented a car since we went there for a wedding and needed to drive outside of waikiki area. I recommend if you are planning on staying in the waikiki area and only going out on tours you do not need to rent a car. We also needed to pay $20 a day for parking.We went to Hanauma bay for snorkelling which a must do! If you are driving I recommend going to Waimanalo beach. It is beautiful!! The beach I quiet and you don't have to worry about lots of people.We enjoyed our stay in Hawaii, would come back to this hotel if I got a good deal but I would probably try out a different hotel on the Waikiki strip.

We stayed for 2 separate one nights before and after a week on Maui, on the first night I left my gents gold band heirloom ring on the bed side table on check out at 10.00am, with travelling to Maui and all that entailed it was not until 4.00pm when I was able to telephone the hotel from Maui and enquire about my 'lost' possession, how relieved I was, not to mention my wife who was going to 'skin me alive' to be told it was handed in by housekeeping to reception and I was able to retrieve my ring one week later when we returned. We duly rewarded 'housekeeping' for her honesty and this made our holiday complete.
